part_of_speech: n.[C,U]: 能力；能耐[+to-v]；才能；專門技能[P1]
sentences: She did the work to the best of her ability. 她已盡了力去做那件工作了。
He is a man of great ability. 他是位能力很強的人。
The acting abilities of both are well-known. 兩人的表演才能都是眾所周知的。

part_of_speech: adv.: 在國外；到國外；在外面；到外面
n.: （用在from後）異國，海外[U]
sentences: My son is still living abroad. 我的兒子仍住在國外。
They usually walk abroad in warm days. 在暖和天氣他們通常去戶外散步。
The news spread abroad that a new factory was going to be built in the county. 將在該縣興建一家新工廠的消息傳開了。
He is much abroad in his guess. 他猜得太離譜了。
They just returned from abroad. 他們剛從國外回來。

part_of_speech: adv.: 絕對地，完全地；【口】（用於對答）一點不錯，完全對
sentences: It's absolutely no business of hers. 這件事與她毫不相關。

other_types: 過去式：accepted   過去分詞：accepted   現在分詞：accepting
part_of_speech: vt.: 接受，領受；答應，同意；承認，認可[（+as）][O2][+that]
vi.: 接受；應允
sentences: He has accepted our invitation. 他已經接受了我們的邀請。
The astronaut accepts danger as being part of the job. 太空人承認他們的工作中包含著危險。
He wouldn't accept that smoking was detrimental to health. 他不相信吸菸有害健康。
I don't accept that the firm will go bankrupt. 我不相信公司會破產。

part_of_speech: n.: 接近，進入；接近的機會，進入的權利；使用[U][（+to）]；通道，入口，門路[C][U][（+to）]
vt.: 【電腦】存取（資料）；使用；接近
sentences: access broadcasting 向公眾開放的節目播送（電臺，電視臺開放給少數民族或利益團體傳遞訊息或做宣傳的節目播送）
Only a few people have access to the full facts of the case. 只有少數幾個人能看到有關該案全部事實的材料。
The only access to their house is along that narrow road. 只有沿著那條狹窄的路走才能到達他們的房子。
in an access of fury 勃然大怒

part_of_speech: adj.: 可（或易）接近的；可（或易）進入的；可（或易）得到的；可（或易）使用的[（+to）]
sentences: a town accessible by rail 有鐵路通達的城鎮
Medicine should not be kept where it is accessible to children. 藥品不應放在兒童容易拿到的地方。
He is not accessible to pity. 他不大有同情心。
Those are his most accessible stories. 那些是他最受歡迎的短篇小說。

part_of_speech: n.: 事故；災禍[C]；意外事情；偶然因素，機遇[C][U]
sentences: He died in an automobile accident years ago. 他數年前死於車禍。
The discovery was a happy accident. 這一發現出人意料，令人高興。

other_types: 過去式：accommodated   過去分詞：accommodated   現在分詞：accommodating
part_of_speech: vt.: 能容納；能提供……膳宿；（飛機等）可搭載
sentences: The hotel can accommodate 500 tourists. 這家旅館可住五百名觀光客。
You will have to accommodate yourself to the changed situation. 你必須適應變化了的形勢。
The policeman accommodated us when we asked for help. 我們請求警察幫忙，他爽快地答應了。
The bank will accommodate him with a loan. 銀行將向他提供一筆貸款。

part_of_speech: n.: 適應；調節[U][S1]；調和；和解[U][C]
sentences: make an accommodation to wartime conditions 適應戰時的條件
They reached an accommodation with neighboring countries. 他們同鄰國和解了。
overnight accommodations 過夜的住處
He called the hotel for accommodations. 他打電話給旅館訂房間。

other_types: 過去式：accomplished   過去分詞：accomplished   現在分詞：accomplishing
part_of_speech: vt.: 完成，實現，達到；走完，度過
sentences: They didn't accomplish the purpose desired. 他們沒有達到預期的目的。
They have accomplished their mission successfully. 他們成功地完成了任務。
She has accomplished 95 years of her life. 她已達九十五高齡。
The journey was accomplished in five weeks. 花了五個禮拜走完全部旅程。

part_of_speech: n.: 成就；成績[C]；才藝，教養；造詣；技能[P1]
sentences: The first walk on the moon was quite an accomplishment. 第一次在月球上行走是一項了不起的成就。
That class increased her accomplishments as a pianist. 那個培訓班增長了她作為鋼琴師的技藝。
This plan is difficult of accomplishment. 這個計畫很難完成。

part_of_speech: adj.: 相符的；和諧的；相應的；accord的動詞現在分詞、動名詞
sentences: You need to make an according decision. 你需要做一個相應的決定。

part_of_speech: adv.: 照著；相應地；因此；於是
sentences: Learn the rules and act accordingly. 學會這些規則，然後就照著做。
He was too sick to stay. Accordingly, we sent him home. 他身體欠安，不能待下去了，於是我們便派人把他送回家去。

part_of_speech: n.: 會計；會計學；結帳

other_types: 比較級：more accurate   最高級：most accurate
part_of_speech: adj.: 準確的；精確的[（+in/at）]
sentences: The new salesgirl is accurate at figures. 新來的女售貨員計算正確無誤。
His information was accurate. 他的情報是準確的。

other_types: 過去式：achieved   過去分詞：achieved   現在分詞：achieving
part_of_speech: vt.: 完成，實現；達到，贏得
vi.: 達到目的
sentences: You will never achieve anything if you spend your time that way. 你若總是這樣消磨時間，就永遠不會有所成就。
The actor achieved fame when he was only nineteen. 那位演員十九歲時就成名了。

other_types: 過去式：acquired   過去分詞：acquired   現在分詞：acquiring
part_of_speech: vt.: 取得，獲得；學到；養成
sentences: The museum has just acquired a famous painting by Pablo Picasso. 該美術館剛剛獲得一幅畢卡索的名畫。
Gradually we acquired experience in how to do the work. 我們逐步獲得了做這工作的經驗。
She has mastered English grammar and acquired a large vocabulary without the help of a teacher. 她在沒有老師指導的情況下，掌握了英文文法，學到了大量字彙。

other_types: 過去式：acted   過去分詞：acted   現在分詞：acting
part_of_speech: vt.: 扮演；裝出；舉動像
vi.: 做事，行動[（+on/for）]；起作用，見效[（+on/upon）]
n.[C]: 行為；行動；【戲】（常大寫）幕；節目
sentences: He acted Othello at the Royal Theater that evening. 那天晚上他在皇家劇院扮演奧賽羅。
He acted the wise man who knew everything and never made mistakes. 他假裝成是無所不知，從不出錯的聰明人。
We should act immediately. 我們應該立即行動。
The actress acts very well. 這位女演員的表演非常出色。
John acted as chairman in his absence. 他不在時，約翰充當主席。
I don't think she acted right. 我認為她做得欠妥。
get one's act together 【俚】冷靜下來仔細籌劃（吸食迷幻藥，迷惘失向後重新振作）
My first act was to run into the bedroom. 我做的第一件事便是跑進臥室。
She was magnificent in Act One of Carmen. 她在《卡門》的第一幕中演得好極了。
Would you tell us something about the new Education Act? 請你給我們講講新的教育法好嗎？
He's just putting on an act. 他只是裝腔作勢罷了。

part_of_speech: adv.: 實際上，真的；竟然
sentences: Did you actually see him break the window? 你真的看到他打破窗戶嗎？
She looks young, but she's actually 50. 她看上去年輕，可是實際上已五十歲了。
She was so angry that she actually tore up the letter. 她一氣之下竟然將信撕碎了。

other_types: 過去式：adapted   過去分詞：adapted   現在分詞：adapting
part_of_speech: vt.: 使適應，使適合[（+to）]；改編，改寫[（+for）]
vi.: 適應[（+to）]
sentences: He tried hard to adapt himself to the new conditions. 他努力使自己適應新的情況。
The author is going to adapt his play for television. 作者將把他的劇本改編成電視劇。
The boys adapted the old barn for use by the club. 孩子們將這個舊穀倉改造成為俱樂部用房。
He has not yet adapted to the climate. 他還沒適應這種氣候。

part_of_speech: n.: 改編者；改寫者；【機】接合器；轉接器
adj.: 添加的；附加的；額外的
sentences: We needed additional money for our trip. 我們出去旅行需要更多的錢。

part_of_speech: adj.: 能滿足需要（量）的，足夠的[（+for）][+to-v]；適當的[（+to/for）]
sentences: Martin decided that he had no adequate proof. 馬丁斷定他沒有充足的證據。
He sought for an adequate solution to the problem. 他尋求解決這個問題的適當辦法。
She proved adequate to the job. 事實證明她能勝任此項工作。
That hotel is merely adequate. 那家旅館只能說是差強人意。

other_types: 過去式：adjusted   過去分詞：adjusted   現在分詞：adjusting
part_of_speech: vt.: 調節；改變……以適應[（+to）]；校正；校準；調整
vi.: 調整；校準；適應[（+to）]
sentences: She must learn to adjust herself to English life. 她必須學會適應英國的生活。
I must adjust my watch, it's fast. 我的表快了，我得把它校準。
Astronauts in flight must adjust to weightlessness. 太空人在飛行中得適應失重狀態。

part_of_speech: n.: 調節；調整；校正[U][C][（+in/of）]；調節裝置[C]
sentences: The company made an adjustment in my salary. 公司對我的薪金作了調整。
the adjustment on a micrometer 測微計上的調節器
the adjustment of conflicts 衝突的調解

part_of_speech: n.: 管理，經營；監督[U]；行政，施政[U]
sentences: The administration of a big business requires skill in dealing with people. 管理一個大企業需要與人相處的技巧。
The last Administration did a lot to curb inflation. 上屆政府做了大量工作以抑制通貨膨脹。
Her work involved more than administration of first aid to the wounded. 她的工作不僅是對傷者的急救。

other_types: 過去式：admired   過去分詞：admired   現在分詞：admiring
part_of_speech: vt.: 欽佩；欣賞[（+for）]；稱讚，誇獎
sentences: We admire her for her diplomatic tact. 我們佩服她的外交手腕。
We admired him all the more for his frankness. 他的率直使我們對他更加敬佩。
He admired her new hat. 他稱讚她的新帽子。

other_types: 過去式：admitted   過去分詞：admitted   現在分詞：admitting
part_of_speech: vt.: 承認[+v-ing][+（that）][O2]；准許進入；准許……進入（或加入）[（+into/to）]
vi.: 承認[（+to）]；容許，有餘地[（+of）]
sentences: You must admit the task to be difficult. 你得承認這個任務是艱鉅的。
We have to admit that he's a highly competent man. 我們必須承認他是個非常能幹的人。
No one but ticket-holders was admitted. 只有持票者方可入內。
The theater admits 1000 people. 這劇院可容納一千人。
I must admit to feeling ashamed of my conduct. 我得承認因自己的行為而感到羞愧。
This matter admits of no delay. 這事不容耽擱。

part_of_speech: n.: 進入；入場許可；【建】通道

other_types: 過去式：advanced   過去分詞：advanced   現在分詞：advancing
part_of_speech: vt.: 使向前移動；推進，促進；將……提前
vi.: 前進；向前移動[（+on/upon/against）]；進展；進步
n.: 前進[S1]；發展[C]
adj.: 先行的；預先的，事先的
sentences: The president has done his utmost to advance the national interest. 總統已盡了最大努力來增進國家的利益。
The date of the meeting was advanced by four days. 會議提前四天召開。
We will advance him some money for traveling expenses. 我們將預付給他一些錢以供支付旅費。
The theory was advanced by an American professor. 該理論系一位美國教授提出的。
He was soon advanced to the position of CEO. 不久他被提升為總裁。
The bank advanced him 20,000 dollars to start his business. 銀行預付他兩萬元以開始他的事業。
She advanced on him silently. 她悄悄地向他走去。
We had greatly advanced in our knowledge of the world. 我們在世界知識方面大有長進。
He advanced shortly to a full professor. 他很快被提升為教授。
Rice has advanced fifteen cents a pound. 米一磅漲了一角五分。
The advance of the enemy troops was halted by a heavy snow. 一場大雪阻止了敵軍的進攻。
Remarkable advances have been made in space science. 太空科學已有了長足的發展。
Her colleagues were all surprised at her rapid advance in the company. 她的飛速升遷令公司同仁均感驚奇。
He was given an advance of fifty dollars on his salary. 預支了五十圓薪金給他。
He did not respond to her advances. 他對她的友好表示無動於衷。
black advance （在競選對手露面場合安排的）預先搗亂
We sent advance copies of the new course book to the teacher and the students who were to use it. 我們先送了幾冊新教科書給要用書的老師和學生們。
I have received an advance payment. 我已收到一筆預付款。

other_types: 比較級：more advanced   最高級：most advanced
part_of_speech: adj.: 在前面的；先進的；開明的
sentences: an advanced position 一處前沿陣地
Ancient Greece was an advanced civilization. 古希臘是個先進的文明國家。
My younger sister studied advanced math. 我妹妹學過高等數學。
His grandfather died at an advanced age of 98. 他祖父在九十八歲高齡時去世。

part_of_speech: n.: 有利條件，優點，優勢[C][U][（+over）]；利益，好處[C][U]
vt.: 有利於；使處於優勢
vi.: 獲利
sentences: He had the advantage of a good education. 他具備受過良好教育的優勢。
What is the advantage of using nuclear power? 使用核能有何好處？
It would advantage him to go abroad. 出國會對他有好處。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有利的；有助的；有益的
sentences: His decision is advantageous to us. 他的決定對我們有利。

other_types: 過去式：advertised   過去分詞：advertised   現在分詞：advertising
part_of_speech: vt.: 為……做廣告；為……宣傳；公布；通知
vi.: 做（或登）廣告，作宣傳[（+for）]
sentences: If you want to sell your product you must advertise it. 如果你要推銷自己的產品，你就必須做廣告。
He advertised them of his decision to withdraw from the election. 他告知他們自己要退出選舉的決定。
The company is advertising for typists in the newspapers. 那家公司在報紙上登廣告徵聘打字員。

part_of_speech: n.: 廣告，宣傳[U]；（一則）廣告，公告，啟事[C]
sentences: Advertisement helps to sell goods. 廣告有助於推銷商品。

part_of_speech: n.: 勸告，忠告[U][（+on/to/about）]；消息，報告[P1]
sentences: I want your advice, sir. I don't know what to do. 先生，我需要您的指點。我不知該怎麼辦才好。
Advices from abroad indicate that war is about to begin. 來自國外的消息表明戰爭即將開始。

other_types: 過去式：advised   過去分詞：advised   現在分詞：advising
part_of_speech: vt.: 勸告，忠告[O][O2][O5][O6]；當……的顧問[W][（+on）]
vi.: 勸告，忠告；當顧問[W]
sentences: We advised her that she (should) wait. 我們勸她等。
We advised him against acting in haste. 我們勸他不要匆忙行事。
Please advise us of any change in your plan. 你們的計畫倘有變更，請告訴我們。
I advised against their doing it. 我勸他們不要做這件事。
He advised with his partners before making the decision. 他在作出決定前曾與合夥人商量過。

other_types: 過去式：affected   過去分詞：affected   現在分詞：affecting
part_of_speech: vt.: 假裝，裝作[+to-v]；愛好，愛用
sentences: He affected not to see her. 他假裝沒看見她。
He affected ignorance of the law. 他假裝不知法。
She affects old furniture and china. 她喜歡古老的傢俱和瓷器。

other_types: 過去式：afforded   過去分詞：afforded   現在分詞：affording
part_of_speech: vt.: （常與can, could, be able to連用）買得起；有足夠的……（去做……）[+to-v]；【書】提供，給予[O1]
sentences: They did not consider whether they could afford the time or not. 他們沒有考慮是否抽得出時間。
We can't afford to pay such a price. 我們付不起這個價錢。
Dancing affords us pleasure. 跳舞給我們帶來快樂。

part_of_speech: adj.: 負擔得起的
sentences: I really like this sports car, but I am afraid its price is not affordable. 我實在很喜歡這部跑車，但它的價格不是我所能負擔得起的。

part_of_speech: n.: 代辦處，經銷處，代理機構[C]；專業行政機構，局，署，處，社[C]
sentences: Our company has agencies in major cities of the country. 我們公司在國內主要城市都設有代理機構。
Carbon dioxide is converted into oxygen through the agency of plants. 二氧化碳由於植物的作用轉化為氧氣。
Through the agency of relatives he got the position. 透過親戚的周旋，他得到了那個職位。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 待議諸事項；議程；日常工作事項
sentences: item No.3 on the agenda 議程上的第三個事項
What's on your agenda today? 你今天有那些工作要做？

other_types: 過去式：agreed   過去分詞：agreed   現在分詞：agreeing
part_of_speech: vi.: 意見一致[（+with/about/on）][W]；同意，贊同[（+to）]
vt.: 同意[+to-v]；承認[+（that）]
sentences: I don't agree with Phil on many things. 我和菲爾在許多事情上意見不一致。
I think we should stop; do you agree? 我覺得我們該停止了，你同意嗎？
This bill does not agree with your original estimate. 這張帳單與你當初的估計不符。
Seafood doesn't agree with me. 我不適宜吃海鮮。
Why can't you agree together? 為何你們不能在一起友好相處？
They agreed to give it to me the next day. 他們同意第二天將它給我。
He agreed that Ann was the winner. 他承認安是獲勝者。
The trade union has agreed the company's pay offer. 工會同意了公司的付酬條件。

part_of_speech: adj.: 令人愉快的，宜人的；欣然贊同的；準備同意的[F][（+to）][+to-v]
sentences: an agreeable odor 好聞的氣味
They were all agreeable to our proposal. 他們都樂於接受我們的建議。
This arrangement is agreeable to both sides. 這樣安排對雙方都合適。

part_of_speech: n.: 同意，一致[U]；協定，協議[C]
sentences: My parents are in agreement on what color to paint the house. 我父母親對於用什麼顏色漆房子意見一致。
The three sides reached an agreement to stop the war. 三方達成協議停止戰爭。

part_of_speech: adj.: 農業的；務農的；農用的；農藝的；農學的
sentences: There is a great demand for agricultural machinery in this country. 這個國家十分需要農用機器。
an agricultural college 農學院

other_types: 過去式：aided   過去分詞：aided   現在分詞：aiding
part_of_speech: vt.: 幫助，救助，支援[O2][（+in/with）]；有助於
vi.: 幫助
n.: 幫助，救助，援助[U]；幫助者；助手[C]
sentences: She made no effort to aid Sophia. 她根本不去幫助蘇菲亞。
A good dictionary can aid language learning. 一部好詞典有助於語言學習。
He should be able to read this without the aid of a dictionary. 他應當能夠不用字典就讀懂這個。
a visual aid 視覺教具

other_types: 過去式：aimed   過去分詞：aimed   現在分詞：aiming

sentences: He aimed the gun at the door. 他把槍對準那扇門。

part_of_speech: n.: （飛機的）航線[C]；航空公司[P]
sentences: I often travel by Northwest Airlines. 我常坐西北航空公司的飛機旅行。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: （戲院，列車，教堂等座席間的）通道，走道；（教堂的）側廊
sentences: He followed the usher down the aisle. 他跟著領座員沿著通道走過去。

part_of_speech: n.: 警報；警報器[C]；鬧鐘[C]（= alarm clock）
vt.: 向……報警，向……告急；使驚慌不安，使恐懼
sentences: The doorkeeper gave the alarm as soon as he saw the smoke. 守門人一看見冒煙就發出警報。
What's up? he asked in alarm. 出什麼事了？他驚恐地問道。
Don't be alarmed. I am no robber. 別慌，我不是強盜。

other_types: 過去式：allowed   過去分詞：allowed   現在分詞：allowing
part_of_speech: vt.: 允許，准許[O2][+v-ing]；准……進；准……出[O]
vi.: 容許[（+of）]；考慮[（+for）]
sentences: Swimming is not allowed at this beach. 這片海灘禁止游泳。
She allowed us to smoke. 她允許我們抽菸。
He doesn't allow cats in the room. 他不允許貓進入房內。
Their teacher allowed them three days for the assignment. 他們的老師給他們三天時間完成作業。
The windfall allowed me to buy a house. 這意外之財使我得以購置一幢房子。
The judge allowed the claim. 法官同意了這一請求。
He allowed that they were right. 他承認他們是對的。
The situation allows of no delay. 情況不容許有任何延誤。
In working with this cloth, be sure to allow for shrinking. 用這種布縫衣，務必考慮到洗後會縮水。

part_of_speech: a.[Z: 兩者（或若干）中擇一的；非此即彼的；替代的；供選擇的
n.: 選擇，二擇一[the S][（+of）]；供選擇的東西（或辦法等）[C]
sentences: There was no alternative route open to her. 她別無選擇。
If you don't like the school lunch, you have the alternative of bringing your own. 要是你不喜歡學校準備的午餐，你可以自己帶飯。
What alternatives are there? 還有什麼可選擇的？
They had no alternative in the matter. 在這件事上，他們沒有選擇的餘地。

other_types: 比較級：more ambitious   最高級：most ambitious

sentences: She is an ambitious woman. 她是一個雄心勃勃的女人。

other_types: 過去式：amended   過去分詞：amended   現在分詞：amending
part_of_speech: vt.: 修訂，修改；訂正；改進，改善
vi.: 改進，改善；改過自新
sentences: The constitution was amended in 1920 to give women the right to vote. 美國憲法於一九二零年修訂，賦予婦女投票權。
The motion to amend the club's constitution was defeated by 20 votes to 15. 修改俱樂部章程的動議以二十票對十五票被否決了。
He was determined to amend. 他決心改過自新。

part_of_speech: n.[C: 總數；總額；數量
vi.[: 合計，共計；相當於
sentences: What is the amount we owe them? 我們總共欠他們多少錢？
We need a small amount of fuel. 我們需要少量的燃料。
The total cost of repairs amounted to US$100. 修理費用總計一百美元。
Keeping what belongs to another amounts to stealing. 將他人之物佔為己有等於偷竊。
He'll never amount to anything. 他將來絕不會有出息。

other_types: 比較級：more amusing   最高級：most amusing
part_of_speech: adj.: 有趣的，好玩的；引人發笑的
sentences: It was amusing to watch the trained elephants perform. 觀看受過訓練的大象表演很有趣。
He told amusing jokes after dinner. 他在飯後講了幾則令人捧腹的笑話。

part_of_speech: n.: 分析；分解；解析[C][U]；【美】精神分析[U][C]
sentences: In the last analysis, the responsibility for this failure must lie with the chief engineer. 追根究底，失敗的責任在於總工程師。
I was very much pleased by your analysis of the situation. 我非常滿意你對形勢的分析。

other_types: 過去式：analyzed   過去分詞：analyzed   現在分詞：analyzing
part_of_speech: vt.: 分析；對……進行心理分析
sentences: The linguists' main interest has been to analyze and describe languages. 語言學家的主要興趣一直在於分析並描述語言。

They analyzed the ore and found iron in it. 他們分析了礦砂，從中發現了鐵。

part_of_speech: n.: 通告，布告，通知；預告[C]；宣告，宣布[U]
sentences: An announcement will be made next week. 下週將有一個通告發布。

part_of_speech: adj.: 討厭的；惱人的，使人煩惱的；annoy的動詞現在分詞、動名詞
sentences: It is annoying that there is no hot water. 沒熱水，真傷腦筋。

part_of_speech: a.[Z]: 一年的；一年一次的；每年的；全年的
n.[C]: 年刊，年鑑；一年生植物
sentences: Employees are entitled to an annual paid leave of fifteen days. 職員一年可享受十五天帶薪的假期。

Are beans annuals? 豆類是一年生植物嗎？

other_types: 過去式：anticipated   過去分詞：anticipated   現在分詞：anticipating
part_of_speech: vt.: 預期，期望；預料[+v-ing][+that][+wh-]；預先考慮到；預先做（或準備）[+wh-][+that]
sentences: It is impossible to anticipate when it will happen. 不可能預料這事何時發生。

The Chinese anticipated the European discovery of gunpowder. 中國人先於歐洲人發現火藥。
No employees of the firm are allowed to anticipate their salary. 這家商行不允許僱員提前支用薪金。

other_types: 比較級：more anxious   最高級：most anxious
part_of_speech: adj.: 焦慮的，掛念的[（+about/at/for）]；令人焦慮的

We're anxious for your safe return. 我們盼望你平安歸來。

other_types: 過去式：apologized   過去分詞：apologized   現在分詞：apologizing

These subjects have lost their appeal for most students. 對多數學生來說，這些學科已經失去了吸引力。

part_of_speech: n.: 開胃的食物，開胃小吃；【喻】吊胃口的東西

part_of_speech: n.: 申請人[C][（+for）]

part_of_speech: n.: 應用，適用；運用[U][C][（+of/to）]；申請，請求；申請書[C][U][（+to/for）][+to-v]

part_of_speech: adj.: 可估計的；（大得）可以看到（或察覺到）的，相當可觀的

part_of_speech: a.[(: 有欣賞力的；能確認價值的；表示讚賞的，感謝的

vt.: 辯論；議論；主張，認為[+that]

a flower arrangement 插花

The English assignment is a book report. 英語課外作業是寫一份讀書報告。

other_types: 過去式：assisted   過去分詞：assisted   現在分詞：assisting
part_of_speech: vt.: 幫助，協助[（+with/in）][O2]；支持，促進
vi.: 幫助，協助[（+with/in）]；參加[（+in）]
n.[C]: 【美】【口】幫助；【美】【棒】助殺
sentences: We asked him to assist us in designing a new bridge. 我們請他幫助我們設計一座新橋。
He assisted in designing the new bridge. 他協助設計那條新橋。
She refused to assist at the reception for reasons unknown. 不知什麼緣故她不肯出席招待會。

part_of_speech: n.: 援助，幫助[U][（+in）]
sentences: Your technical assistance in the project is greatly appreciated. 您對這個專案的技術援助大受贊賞。

other_types: 過去式：assumed   過去分詞：assumed   現在分詞：assuming
part_of_speech: vt.: 以為；假定為；（想當然地）認為[+（that）][O2][O8][O9]；承擔；就任；取得
vi.: 裝腔作勢；多管閒事
sentences: I assumed that he had gone for a stroll. 我想他去散步了。
The prince assumed power when he was only fifteen. 王子在十五歲時就掌權了。
His illness assumed a very grave character. 他的病顯得非常的嚴重。
He assumed a look of surprise. 他裝出吃驚的神色。

other_types: 過去式：attached   過去分詞：attached   現在分詞：attaching
part_of_speech: vt.: 裝上，貼上，繫上[（+to）]；使依附；使附屬[（+to）]
vi.: 附屬；附加[（+to）]；歸屬[（+to）]
sentences: He'll attach the label to your luggage. 他會把標籤繫在你的行李上。
This hospital is attached to the medical college nearby. 這個醫院附屬附近的那所醫學院。
He attached himself to the expedition. 他參加了那個探險隊。
How can you attach the blame for this accident to the taxi-driver? 你怎麼能把這次事故的責任歸於計程車司機呢？
The new employee was attached to the sales department. 新來的僱員被派在銷售部工作。
The blame for this accident attaches to the man who drove under the influence. 這起事故的責任應由酒後開車的那個人承擔。
Those are advantages that attach to the profession. 那些都是從事該職業的種種有利條件。

part_of_speech: n.: 連接；安裝；附著[U][（+to）]；附屬物；附件；附加裝置[C][（+to/for）]
sentences: attachments to a reaping machine 收割機的配件
She formed a strong attachment for him. 她對他產生了熱烈的愛慕之情。

other_types: 過去式：attended   過去分詞：attended   現在分詞：attending
part_of_speech: vt.: 出席，參加；上（大學等），前往
vi.: 出席，參加[（+at）]；照料，處理[（+to）]
sentences: He did not attend the meeting yesterday. 昨天他沒有參加會議。
The school was attended almost entirely by local children. 上這個學校讀書的幾乎全是當地的孩子。
There was no one to attend him but Tina. 除了蒂娜，再無人照顧他了。
I'll attend to the matter. 我來處理此事。
She didn't attend to what I was saying. 她並不注意聽我所說的話。

part_of_speech: n.: 到場；出席[C][U][（+at）]；出席人數[S][（+at）]
sentences: My attendance at school is excellent. 我在學校的出席情況極好。
There was a large attendance at the party. 參加聚會的人很多。
She is in attendance on the sick child. 她在照料病孩。

part_of_speech: adv.: 聚精會神地；周到地

other_types: 過去式：attracted   過去分詞：attracted   現在分詞：attracting
part_of_speech: vt.: 吸；吸引；引起（注意，興趣等）
vi.: 吸引
sentences: The garden city attracts many tourists. 那個花園城市吸引許多遊客。
A magnet attracts both iron and steel. 磁鐵吸鐵也吸鋼。
Jim was attracted to the Italian girl. 吉姆對那位義大利女孩產生了好感。
The salesman banged a drum to attract a crowd. 推銷員擊鼓以吸引人群。

part_of_speech: n.: 聽眾，觀眾；讀者群[C][G]；愛好者[C][G]
sentences: His books have a large audience. 他的書有廣大的讀者。
The audience enjoyed every minute of the performance. 觀眾自始至終欣賞這次演出。
He was granted an audience with the king. 他獲准覲見國王。

other_types: 過去式：audited   過去分詞：audited   現在分詞：auditing
part_of_speech: n.: 審計；查帳；決算
vi. : 審核；查帳；【美】以旁聽生資格出席；旁聽
n.: 權，權力；職權[U][（+for）][+to-v]；當權者，管理機構[C]
sentences: Who gave you authority to do this? 誰給你權力這樣做的？
The authorities did not interfere with us. 當局不干涉我們。
He is an authority on international law. 他是一位國際法權威。

other_types: 過去式：authorized   過去分詞：authorized   現在分詞：authorizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 授權給，全權委託[O2]；批准，認可；允許
sentences: A senior member of the committee was authorized to act for the chairman during his absence. 主席不在時，授權委員會中的一位資深委員代理他的職務。
The local government authorized the construction of a new airport. 地方政府批准建造一個新機場。

part_of_speech: n.: 有效；有益；可利用性；可得到的東西（或人）；可得性
adj.: 可用的，在手邊的；可利用的[（+for/to）]；可得到的，可買到的
sentences: The swimming pool is available only in summer. 這個游泳池只在夏天開放。
Is there water available around here? 附近弄得到水嗎？
TV sets are available in any department stores. 電視機在任何一家百貨公司裡都能買到。
The principal is available now. 現在校長可以接見你。
This film ticket is no longer available. 這張電影票不再有效。

other_types: 過去式：avoided   過去分詞：avoided   現在分詞：avoiding
part_of_speech: vt.: 避開，躲開；避免[（n./+v-ing）]
sentences: I avoided him as much as possible. 我盡量避開他。
They all avoided mentioning that name. 他們都避免提及那名字。
She braked suddenly and avoided an accident. 她緊急煞車，避免了一場車禍。

part_of_speech: n.: 察覺；覺悟；體認[U][S1][（+of）][+（that）]
sentences: There is a general awareness that smoking is harmful. 人們普遍認識到吸菸有害健康。

part_of_speech: adj.: 笨拙的；不熟練的，不靈巧的[（+with）]；使用不便的；難操縱的[+to-v]
sentences: She is still awkward with chopsticks. 她用筷子還不熟練。
This machine is awkward to handle. 這臺機器很難操作。
He asked several awkward questions at the press conference. 他在記者招待會上提了幾個難回答的問題。
He felt awkward and uncomfortable. 他感到尷尬和不舒服。

part_of_speech: n.: 背景（與前景foreground相對）[C]；（事件等的）背景，遠因[C][U]
sentences: He took a picture of me with the pavilion in the background. 他以那個亭子為背景給我照了一張相片。
This book gives the background of the Civil War. 這本書敘述了南北戰爭的背景。
He came from an impoverished background. 他出身貧寒。
She has a lot of power, but likes to remain in the background. 她的權力很大，但是喜歡隱身幕後。

other_types: 過去式：backpacked   過去分詞：backpacked   現在分詞：backpacking

vi.: 背負簡便行李旅行

other_types: noun: baggage reclaim, plural noun: baggage reclaims
part_of_speech: n.: the area in an airport where arriving passengers collect luggage that has been carried in the hold of the aircraft.
n.: 平衡，均衡[U][S]；協調，和諧[U][S]
vt.: 使平衡；保持……的平衡；權衡，比較[（+against）]
vi.: 得到平衡；保持平衡；相稱
sentences: I lost my balance and fell. 我身體失去平衡，摔了一跤。
In what way is a laboratory balance different from a balance found in a store? 實驗室的天平與商店裡的秤在什麼方面有所不同？
The balance on your account is US$5. 你的帳戶上餘額為五美金。
In order to balance their trade, they would have to buy less goods in the United States. 為了平衡貿易，他們將不得不減少在美國購貨。
The judge balanced the contention of both parties. 法官權衡了雙方的論點。
Wage increase was balanced off by rising cost of living. 增加的薪資被上升的生活費用抵銷。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 堤；岸；田埂
vt.: 築堤防護[（+up）]；把……堆積起來[（+up）]
vi.: 堆積[（+up）]；（飛機，汽車等）帶坡度轉彎
sentences: They stood on the river bank to fish. 他們站在河岸邊釣魚。
There was a bank of snow over ten feet deep in there. 那裡有一堆深達十英尺多的雪。
We have banked up the river to prevent flooding. 我們已沿河築堤以防河水泛濫。
Snow banked up along the road. 沿途堆積著雪。

other_types: 過去式：bankrupted   過去分詞：bankrupted   現在分詞：bankrupting
part_of_speech: adj.: 破產的；有關破產的；已完全失敗的，枯竭了的
vt.: 使破產；使赤貧；使枯竭
n.[C]: 破產者；赤貧者；（在某方面）完全喪失者
sentences: His business failed and he went bankrupt. 他的生意失敗了，他也破產了。
a morally bankrupt society 道德淪喪的社會
He was bankrupt of original ideas. 他毫無獨創性的見解。
He has spent so much money on the venture that it will bankrupt him. 他花了這麼多錢從事這冒險買賣，到頭來會破產的。
These people are intellectual bankrupts. 這些人一點知識也沒有。

part_of_speech: n.: （商品包裝上的）條碼
n.[C]: 協議[（+with）][+that]；買賣，交易
vi.: 討價還價[（+with/over/about）]；達成協議
vt.: 討價還價後賣掉；經談判後使得[O]
sentences: Clement made a satisfactory bargain with him. 克雷孟特和他作了一次滿意的交易。
These toys are a real bargain at such low prices. 這些玩具的價格這麼便宜，真划得來。
She bargained with the fishmonger over the price. 她與魚販講價錢。
They bargained on a two-year term. 他們講定以兩年為期。
They finally bargained out the obstacles to an agreement. 他們透過談判終於排除了達成協議的障礙。
The trade union bargained that its members should have another week's holiday. 工會提出其會員增加一週假日的要求。
I bargain that the job will be done in three days. 我保證這一工作在三天內完成。

other_types: 比較級：more basic   最高級：most basic
part_of_speech: adj.: 基礎的，基本的；初步的[（+to）]；起點的，不包括附加部分的[B]
n.[t: 基礎；基本原理；基本原則
sentences: These poor people lack the basic necessities of life. 這些窮人缺乏生活的基本必需品。

other_types: 過去式：behaved   過去分詞：behaved   現在分詞：behaving

vt.: （後接oneself）使檢點，使守規矩；（後接oneself）使表現得（……）[O]
sentences: The young lady behaved courageously in the face of danger. 那位年輕女士面對危險表現得十分勇敢。
How is the new machine behaving? 新機器的性能怎樣？
The chemical can behave as an acid. 這種化學製品能起酸的作用。
Behave yourself! 規矩點！

part_of_speech: n.: 財產；攜帶物品；家眷；親戚
adj.: 有益的；有利的；有幫助的[（+for/to）]；【律】有權益的；受益的
sentences: It would be beneficial to keep abreast of developments in Asia. 跟上亞洲形勢的發展會有助益。
beneficial legacy 有權受益的遺產

part_of_speech: n.: 利益，好處；優勢[U][C]；津貼，救濟金[C][U]
vt.: 對……有益，有益於
vi.: 得益，受惠[（+by/from）]
sentences: The new hospital will be a great benefit to the town. 新建成的醫院將給全城帶來莫大好處。
The sea air will benefit you. 海邊的空氣對你有益。
We benefited greatly by this frank talk. 這次坦率的談話使我們獲益匪淺。

part_of_speech: n.: 飲料[C]
sentences: Beverages are not allowed in the school bus. 校車上不准喝飲料。

other_types: 動詞變化：bade /  bid / bidden /  bid / bidding
part_of_speech: vt.: 命令，吩咐[O3]；祝；向……表示[O1]
vi.: 命令，吩咐；喊價，出價；投標[（+for）]
n.[C]: 出價；喊價；投標[（+for）]；出價（或投標）數目
sentences: Do as you are bidden. 按命令行事。
He bade me hold my tongue. 他吩咐我不要吭聲。
He bade his friends good-bye and left. 他與朋友告別後離開了。
He bid $300 for the oil painting. 他出價三百元買那幅油畫。
He was bidding to discredit his opponent. 他正企圖搞臭對手。
Do as he bids. 照他的吩咐去做。
The firm decided to bid on the guidance system. 該公司決定投標導航系統。
Bids for the new bridge were invited from firms both at home and abroad. 國內外公司都被邀請對承建該座新橋投標。
Our firm won the bid. 我們公司中了標。
Whose bid is it? 輪到誰叫牌？
He made a bid for middle class support. 他努力試圖得到中產階級的支持。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 帳單[（+for）]；目錄，清單；節目單
vt.: 給……開帳單；要……付款；在……貼海報
sentences: The store sent me a bill for $50. 那家商店寄給我一張五十美元的帳單。
The House of Commons has not yet passed the bill. 下議院尚未通過該議案。
Please bill me later. 請以後開帳單給我。

part_of_speech: n.: （書籍）裝訂工；捆縛（或包紮）者[C]；捆縛（或包紮）用具；繩索，帶子[C]
sentences: Tar is a binder for gravel in paving. 在鋪路時柏油用來黏結礫石。
a loose-leaf binder 活頁夾

adj.: 總括的，全體的；適用於所有情況的；沒有限制的
vt.: （似）用毯覆蓋[H][（+with）]；掩蓋
sentences: The valley was covered with a blanket of snow. 山谷白雪如毯。
The boss promised a blanket wage increase. 老板答應全面加薪。
The valley was blanketed with snow. 山谷中覆蓋著如毯的白雪。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 塊[（+of）]；積木[P]；【美】（四面圍有街道的）街區
adj.: 大塊的，成批的[B]；交通堵塞的
vt.: 阻塞，堵住，封鎖；阻擋，妨礙，阻止
sentences: The store is three blocks away. 那家商店距此三條街。
There is a block in the pipe and the water can't flow away. 管子裡有阻塞物，水流不出去。
He holds a block of shares. 他擁有大宗股票。
A piece of rock had fallen and blocked up the path. 一塊岩石掉了下來，堵住了路。
They were blocked from joining the club. 他們被阻加入該俱樂部。

part_of_speech: n.: 木板；板[C]；牌子；布告牌；黑板；（棋）盤[C]
vt.: 用木板覆蓋（或封閉）[（+up/over）]；上（船，車，飛機等）
vi.: 搭伙，包飯；膳宿[Q]；逆風作之字形航行
sentences: He sawed the board in half. 他將木板鋸成兩塊。
We will provide room and board for them. 我們將提供他們的食宿。

He quit the boards years ago. 數年前他就離開了舞臺。
He boarded up the windows. 他用木板將窗釘上。
The passengers boarded the plane at 9 a.m. 旅客們上午九時登上飛機。
She boarded with a Japanese family. 她寄宿在一個日本人的家裡。

part_of_speech: ph.: 登機證
n.: 會議室；交換場所

other_types: 過去式：boasted   過去分詞：boasted   現在分詞：boasting
part_of_speech: vi.: 自吹自擂；誇耀[（+about/of）]
vt.: 自吹自擂說，吹噓[Y][+that]；（指物）以有……而自豪；擁有，包含[W]
n.[C]: 自吹，牛皮，大話；引以為榮的事物
sentences: The captain is always boasting of his military valor. 上尉老是自誇陣前之勇。
Our school library boasts quite a few rare books. 我們學校圖書館以藏有好多珍本書而自豪。
That brother of yours is full of boasts. 你那個寶貝兄弟滿口大話。
It is his boast that he has never been late for work. 他為自己上班從未遲到感到自豪。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 書，書本，書籍；著作；報章雜誌；本子；簿冊；支票簿
vt.: 預訂；預僱；預約；（警方）將……登記入冊以作指控之用
vi.: 預訂；【英】（旅客）登記住入旅館
sentences: She has written several books on the subject. 她已經寫了幾部有關這方面的書了。
His name is no longer on our books. 他的名字從我們的名冊上勾銷了。
Mary has booked a flight from New York to London. 瑪麗已預訂了從紐約到倫敦的飛機票。
The cop booked John on a charge of speeding. 警察指控約翰超速駕駛。

part_of_speech: n.[C: 一舉，一抬；一推；推動；幫助；促進
vt.: 舉，抬；推；推動；促進；為……作宣傳
sentences: He gave me a boost over the fence. 他抬我一把助我翻越籬笆。
a boost to their morale 對他們士氣的激勵
Boost me into the saddle. 請抬我一把，讓我跨上馬鞍。
boost a program 為一項綱領作宣傳
The company boosted its sales this year. 這家公司使今年的銷售量增加了。

other_types: 過去式：borrowed   過去分詞：borrowed   現在分詞：borrowing
part_of_speech: vt.: 借，借入[（+from）]；【婉】擅自取走
vi.: 借；借東西，借錢[（+from）]；視風向擊輕球
sentences: How much have you borrowed from him? 你向他借了多少錢？

These words were borrowed from French. 這幾個字是從法語引進的。
She often borrows from them. 她時常向他們借這借那。

other_types: 過去式：bothered   過去分詞：bothered   現在分詞：bothering
part_of_speech: vt.: 煩擾，打攪；使惱怒
vi.: 煩惱，擔心[（+with/about）]；麻煩，費心[（+with/about）][+to-v][+v-ing]
n.: 煩惱，麻煩[U]；使人煩惱的人（或事物）[S]
int.: 討厭！去你的！
sentences: I can't bother him with my little affairs. 我不能因自己那點小事去打擾他。
The way my brother talked to Mother bothered me. 我兄弟對母親說話的那副模樣惹我惱火。
The complexities of interpersonal relations bothered her. 人際關係的複雜情況使她困惑不已。
Don't bother about that trifling matter. 別為那件小事煩惱。
You needn't bother to come to my office. 你不必特地來我辦公室。
We had a lot of bother finding a vacant apartment. 我們費了不少周折才找到一間空的公寓。
Tom is a bother to his teacher. 湯姆使他老師大傷腦筋。

part_of_speech: ph.: 帳本底線，帳本盈虧結算線；基本意思（或情況），概要
sentences: The corporation's bottom line is a good profit margin. 公司的基本要求是好的利潤。
The bottom line, however, is that he has escaped. 然而，結果是他已經逃脫了。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 樹枝；枝；支族；支流；支線；支路[（+of）]
vi.: 出枝；分支；分岔
sentences: The river has three main branches. 這條河有三條主要的支流。
The bank has branches all over the country. 該銀行在全國各地均有分行。
English is a branch of the Germanic family of languages. 英語是日耳曼語系的一個分支。
The tree near the house branched over the roof. 屋旁那棵樹的分枝長到了屋頂上。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 品牌；商標；牌子[（+of）]；（某人特有的）一種（風格，舉止等）[（+of）]
vt.: 打烙印於；印……商標於；將……汙名加於……[（+as）][O9]
sentences: This brand of tea is my favorite. 這種茶我最愛喝。
He has his own brand of humor. 他有他獨特的幽默。
The brand of a coward is a liability in a military career. 懦夫的汙名對戎馬生涯是不利的。
All cattle on the farm were branded with the letter A. 這農場所有的牛都烙上A的印記。
The press branded him a liar. 新聞界加給他騙子的醜名。
The bitter lesson is branded on his memory. 那個慘痛的教訓深深銘刻在他記憶中。

part_of_speech: n.: 公事包[C]
n.: 簡報；作戰指示

other_types: 動詞變化：broadcast /  broadcasted / broadcast /  broadcasted / broadcasting
part_of_speech: vt.: 廣播，播送；廣為散播，傳布
vi.: 廣播，播放；參加廣播演出；發表廣播演說
a.[Z: 廣播的，播音的；散布的；撒播的
n.: 廣播；廣播節目；散布；播種
adv.: 經廣播；廣泛地；散布地
sentences: The program is broadcast every Monday evening. 這檔節目每星期一晚上播出。
She broadcast the secret to her colleagues. 她向同事們傳播這一祕密。
The president will broadcast this evening. 今晚總統將發表電視講話。
There's something very interesting in the broadcast program. 這檔廣播節目中有些內容很有趣。
These broadcasts will be heard in most parts of the country. 這些廣播節目國內大部分地區都能聽到。
The child snowed crumbs of bread broadcast. 那孩子把麵包屑撒得到處都是。

other_types: 過去式：broadened   過去分詞：broadened   現在分詞：broadening
part_of_speech: vi.: 變寬，變闊；擴大
vt.: 使寬，使闊；使擴大
sentences: One's views broaden at college. 一個人的見解在大學時代變得開闊起來。
This narrow highway should be broadened. 這條狹窄的公路應該加寬。

part_of_speech: n.: 瀏覽者；【電腦】瀏覽器
n.[C]: （常構成複合詞）刷，刷子；毛筆，畫筆
vt.: 刷；（用毛筆）寫；（用畫筆）畫；擦掉，拂去，推開[O]
vi.: 刷，拂[（+at）]；刷牙，梳頭髮
sentences: I paint with a brush. 我用畫筆作畫。
I had a brush with the customs men. 我與海關官員小衝突了一場。
I'm going to brush my teeth. 我要去刷牙了。
The maid brushed the crumbs from the table. 女佣拂去桌上的麵包屑。
The wind blew lightly, brushing through her hair. 微風輕輕吹過她的頭髮。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 預算；預算費；生活費，經費[（+for）]；（一）批，（一）堆；大信息量長信[（+of）]
vt.: 把……編入預算；按照預算來計畫；安排，預定
vi.: 編列預算[（+for）]
adj.: 低廉的，收費公道的[B]
sentences: It is essential to balance one's budget. 量入為出是很重要的。
She tried to keep her monthly budget below $400. 她試圖將每月的開支限制在四百元以下。
We have a budget of news today. 今天我們有許多新聞。
The school budgeted one million dollars for a new library. 學校編列了一百萬美元建新圖書館的預算。
She is extremely busy, so she has to budget her time carefully. 她忙極了，所以必須好好安排時間。
The old couple budgeted for the coming year. 老兩口為下一年定預算。
He bought the house at a budget price. 他以低廉的價錢買下這所房子。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 公報；公告；新聞快報
vt.: 公告，公布
sentences: Here is the latest bulletin about the President's health. 這裡是有關總統健康的最新公報。

part_of_speech: ph.: （總稱）（客機）航班空服員
n.: 自助餐館，自助食堂[C]

other_types: 過去式：calculated   過去分詞：calculated   現在分詞：calculating
part_of_speech: vt.: 計算[+（that）][+wh-]；估計；預測；推測[+（that）][+wh-]
vi.: 計算；作打算
sentences: He calculated the costs very carefully. 他仔細計算開支。
His remark was calculated to hurt her. 他的話是故意要傷她的。
I calculate they will soon arrive. 我看他們快要到了。
Have you finished calculating yet? 你計算好了嗎？

part_of_speech: n.: 計算[U]；計算結果[C]
sentences: Did I make any error in my calculation? 我計算中有沒有出差錯？
The scientist's calculations proved exactly right. 那位科學家的計算結果完全正確。
By my calculation, 5% of the students will fail in the exam. 據我估計，百分之五的學生不能通過這次考試。
After much calculation they decided to give him the position of manager. 經仔細考慮，他們決定讓他擔任經理職務。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 計算者；計算表
sentences: He is a rapid calculator. 他是個算得很快的人。
Does anyone have a calculator here? 這裡有沒有人有計算機？

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 戰役；運動，活動[（+for/against）][+to-v]
vi.: 從事運動[（+for/against）]；參加競選[（+for）]
sentences: The campaign to seize the city was a failure. 攻佔這個城市的戰役失敗了。
The city hall is planning to start a campaign against smoking. 市政府計畫發起禁菸運動。
The presidential campaign was in full swing. 總統競選運動正在全力進行中。
The union leaders are campaigning for better working conditions. 工會領導人為爭取改善工作條件而積極活動。
He hasn't decided whether to campaign for the senate. 他尚未決定是否參加參議員的競選。

other_types: 動詞變化：canceled /  cancelled / canceled /  cancelled / canceling /  cancelling
part_of_speech: vt.: 刪去，劃掉；勾銷，蓋銷（郵票等）；取消，廢除；中止
vi.: 【數】相約，相消；互相抵消
n.[C]: 刪除；取消；撤銷；軋票鉗，打孔器[P1]
sentences: You should cancel this preposition in the sentence. 你應該刪去句子中的這個介係詞。
The game was cancelled because of the rain. 比賽因為下雨而取消了。
This will cancel your debt to me. 這可抵消你欠我的債務。
The $5 I owed him and the $5 he owes me cancel out. 他與我各欠對方五元，正好相互抵消。

part_of_speech: n.: 取消；【數】約；相消
n.[C: 候選資格，候補資格；候選狀態，候補狀態
n.[C]: 候選人；候補者[（+for）]；應試者，攻讀學位者[（+for）]
sentences: They were in favor of the Democratic candidate for President. 他們支持民主黨總統候選人。
Milo was the strongest candidate for the job. 米洛在求職應徵者中具備最好的條件。

part_of_speech: n.: 容量，容積[U][S]；能量，生產力[U][S]
sentences: The theater has a seating capacity of 800. 這個劇場可容納八百名觀眾。
The auto plant now has an annual capacity of 12,000 cars. 這家汽車廠現在每年能生產一萬二千輛汽車。
He has a great capacity for learning languages. 他學語言的能力很強。
He said that in the capacity as mayor. 他是以市長的身分說那番話的。

part_of_speech: n.: 首都；首府；省會[C]；（某種工業，活動等集中的）重要都市[C]
adj.: 可處死刑的；致命的[B]；大寫字母的[B][cf：lower case小寫]
sentences: Dublin is the capital of Ireland. 都柏林是愛爾蘭的首都。
The corporation has enough capital to build another factory. 這家公司有足夠的資金來興建另一家工廠。
There is no capital punishment in some countries. 有些國家沒有死刑。
Proper nouns are spelled with a capital letter. 專有名詞用大寫字母。
He came up with a capital idea. 他想出了一個絕妙的主意。

part_of_speech: n.: （終身的）職業[C]；經歷；生涯；歷程[C]
vi.: 猛衝，飛跑[Q]
adj.: 職業的，專業的[B]
sentences: He wasn't interested in her stage career. 他對她的演戲職業不感興趣。
He found it both interesting and instructive to learn about the careers of great men. 他覺得了解偉人的生平既很有趣又有教益。
The car was careering down the road. 汽車在公路上疾馳。
Her brothers are both career diplomats. 她的兩個兄弟都是職業外交家。

other_types: 比較級：more careless   最高級：most careless
part_of_speech: adj.: 粗心的，疏忽的；草率的；隨便的；自然的
sentences: He made a careless mistake. 他犯了一個粗枝大葉的錯誤。
He sat into a chair with careless ease. 他隨便往椅子裡舒舒服服一坐。
She's careless about her clothes. 她對穿著一點都不講究。
careless days 無憂無慮的日子

other_types: 過去式：cashed   過去分詞：cashed   現在分詞：cashing
part_of_speech: n.[U]: 現金，現款；【口】錢
vt.: 把……兌現[O1]
sentences: I have no cash on me. Can I pay you later? 我沒帶現金，能否以後付給你？
Can you cash this check for me? 你能為我兌現這張支票嗎？

other_types: 過去式：cashiered   過去分詞：cashiered   現在分詞：cashiering
part_of_speech: vt.: 撤……的職，開除；丟棄
sentences: Stevens was cashiered in 1948. 史蒂文斯於一九四八年被免職。

part_of_speech: n.: 原因；起因[C][U][（+of）]；理由，根據；動機[U][（+for）][+to-v]
vt.: 導致，使發生，引起[O1][O2]
sentences: What was the cause of the accident? 造成這一事故的原因是什麼？
You have no cause to complain. 你沒有理由抱怨。
World peace is a cause we should all work for. 爭取世界和平是一項我們都應該為之而努力的事業。
What caused him to quit his job? 是什麼原因使他辭職的？
I'm afraid I'm causing you much trouble. 我怕給你增添很多麻煩。

part_of_speech: adj.: 十分小心的，謹慎的[（+about/of/with）]
sentences: The old lady is very cautious with money. 那位老太太用錢很謹慎。
My nephew is a cautious investor. 我侄子是個小心謹慎的投資者。

other_types: 過去式：celebrated   過去分詞：celebrated   現在分詞：celebrating
part_of_speech: vt.: 慶祝；舉行（宗教儀式）；主持（聖餐等）
vi.: 慶祝，過節；舉行宗教儀式
sentences: We held a party to celebrate our success. 我們舉行宴會慶祝我們的成功。
The event was celebrated by poets and historians. 這一事件為詩人和歷史學家所讚頌。
Today is his birthday, so we're going to celebrate. 今天是他的生日，所以我們要慶祝一下。

part_of_speech: n.: 慶祝[U]；慶祝活動，慶典[C]
sentences: The party was in celebration of Mother's silver wedding. 聚會是為慶祝母親的銀婚。
A Fourth of July celebration includes a display of fireworks. 七月四日獨立紀念日慶典包括燃放煙火。
His novels were celebrations of anarchism. 他的小說頌揚無政府主義。

part_of_speech: ph.: 行動電話，手機（等於 cellular phone 或 mobile phone）
n.[C]: 證明書；執照；（沒有學位的）結業證書；憑證，單據；證券
sentences: To obtain a passport, you have to send in your birth certificate with the form. 要取得護照，你得把出生證和表格一起呈上。

part_of_speech: n.: 證明；檢定；保證
sentences: If you want to be classified as being physically handicapped, you must have certification from a hospital. 你若要申請殘障人士，必須要有醫院的證明。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 鏈，鏈條；項圈；一連串，一系列；連鎖，連續[（+of）]
vt.: 用鎖鏈拴住；拘禁；束縛[O]
sentences: The dog was fastened to a post by a chain. 那條狗被鏈條拴在柱子上。
The traffic accident led to a chain of events. 交通事故引起了一連串的事件。
He chained his dog to a post. 他把狗拴在柱子上。

part_of_speech: ph.: 【美】連鎖商店
n.: （通常指單人用的）椅子[C]；（會議的）主席（= chairman, chairwoman或chairperson）；主席席位（或職位）[C]
vt.: 主持（會議）；任（會議的）主席；使入座
sentences: Mary sat in a chair reading a novel. 瑪麗坐在椅中讀小說。
The chair called the meeting to order. 主席宣布會議開始。
The murderer got the chair. 兇手遭電椅處決。
Megan will chair the meeting. 梅根將擔任該會議的主席。
I'd like you to chair the meeting. 我想請你主持會議。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 主席；議長；委員長；董事長；（大學的）系主任
n.: 議長；主席（沒有性別歧視的字眼）
adj.: 特有的，獨特的；典型的；表示特性的[（+of）]
n.[C]: 特性，特徵，特色；【數】（對數的）首數
sentences: Urban inhabitants have to live with the characteristic noises of cities. 城市居民不得不忍受都市特有的喧囂。
Quick decision is characteristic of him. 快速決定是他的特徵。
It is their distinguishing characteristic. 這是他們與眾不同的特徵。
The characteristic of the logarithm 6.3214 is 6. 對數6.3214的首數是6。

other_types: 過去式：characterized   過去分詞：characterized   現在分詞：characterizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 描繪……的特性[（+as）]；具有……的特徵，以……為特徵
sentences: The author characterizes the central figure as a weakling. 作者把書中的中心人物描繪成一個懦弱的人。
A miser is characterized by greed. 守財奴的特點是貪婪。

other_types: 過去式：charged   過去分詞：charged   現在分詞：charging
part_of_speech: vt.: 索價；對……索費；課（稅）[O1][（+for）]；把……記入帳冊，賒購[（+to）]
vi.: 索價；收費[（+for）]；衝鋒，向前衝[（+at）]
n.: 費用，價錢，索價[C][（+for）]；掌管；照顧；責任；任務[U]
sentences: This store often charges only 65 US cents a dozen for large eggs. 一打大雞蛋在這家店裡常常僅賣六角五分。
Please charge my account. 請記在我帳上。
They charged the enemy three times. 他們向敵人發過三次突擊。
He was charged with stealing. 他被控犯有偷竊行為。
The statement charged that their actions violated the agreement. 聲明指責他們的行為違背了協定。
The nurse was charged with the care of the children. 孩子們託付給褓姆照顧。
The battery needs to be charged. 這電池需要充電了。
The store doesn't charge for delivery. 該店免費送貨。
The lion charged at those little animals. 獅子向那些小動物衝了過去。
The charge for admission is US$5. 入場費五美元。
She became her aunt's charge after her mother died. 她母親去世後由姑媽照管。
He was arrested on the charge of robbery. 他因被控犯有搶劫罪而被捕。

part_of_speech: n.: 慈悲，仁愛，博愛；慈善[U]；施捨；善舉[U]
sentences: She gave the beggar some money out of charity. 她出於慈善給乞丐一些錢。
Poor as they were, the old couple never asked for charity. 老兩口雖然很窮，但從不請求施捨。
The rich lady left all her money to charities. 那個闊太太把所有的錢都捐給慈善事業。
The fire victims received food and clothes from several charities. 火災災民從數個慈善團體收到食物和衣服。

part_of_speech: adj.: 便宜的，價廉的；劣質的，廉價品的
adv.: 便宜地；卑鄙地
sentences: Eggs are very cheap now. 現在蛋很便宜。
The coat may be expensive but looks cheap. 那件大衣也許很貴，但是看起來很粗劣。
Talk is cheap. 說空話是不費力的。
I was very lucky to get the book so cheap. 我這本書買得這麼便宜是很幸運的。

part_of_speech: ph.: 到達並登記; 報到；記錄
sentences: He has just checked in at the hotel. 他剛剛在旅館辦好住宿手續。
The ticket agent checked in the passengers one by one. 售票員逐一登記乘客。

part_of_speech: ph.: 結帳離開；檢查
sentences: Mrs. Hyde has checked out this morning. 海德夫人今天上午已經結帳走了。
I have checked out all the figures and found them to be correct. 我核對了所有數字, 發現都正確。
All the trainees checked out all right. 所有的受訓人員都符合要求。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: （餐館等的）主廚，大師傅；廚師
n.: （根據權利而提出的）要求[C][U][（+for/on/to）]；（對某事物的）權利；要求權；所有權[C][U][（+on/to）]
vt.: （根據權利）要求；認領；索取；自稱，聲稱；主張[Y][+to-v][+（that）]
vi.: 提出要求[（+on/for）]
sentences: Mary made a claim to the pencil. 瑪麗認為她應得到這枝鉛筆。
What claim does he have to the property? 他有何權利要求得到這筆財產？
The old man claimed the land. 老人要求得到這塊土地。
She claimed that the ring was stolen, not lost. 她聲言那只戒指是被偷的，而不是遺失的。
She claims to be a good pianist. 她聲稱是位優秀的鋼琴家。
The trend claims our attention. 這一趨勢需要我們予以注意。
The tornado claimed dozens of lives. 那場龍捲風奪去了幾十條人命。

part_of_speech: n.: 主張者；要求者；原告；【商】索賠者
n.: 分類；分級[U]；【生】分類法[U]
sentences: the classification of books in the library 圖書館中書籍的分類

other_types: 過去式：classified   過去分詞：classified   現在分詞：classifying
part_of_speech: vt.: 將……分類；將……分等級；將……歸入某類（或某等級）
sentences: People who work in libraries spend a lot of time classifying books. 在圖書館工作的人花大量的時間為書籍分類。
Eggs are classified according to size. 雞蛋按大小分等級。
The government has classified this information secret. 政府已把這資料列為機密。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 辦事員，職員；書記；記帳員；【美】店員，銷售員
vi.: 【美】當銷售員（或職員等）
sentences: She got a job as a bank clerk. 她得到一份銀行職員的工作。
His kid sister clerks in a store. 他妹妹在商店當店員。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 委託人，（律師等的）當事人；顧客，客戶
sentences: He has been a valued client of our bank for many years. 他多年來一直是我們銀行的重要客戶。

part_of_speech: n.: 氣候[C][U]；風土；具有某種氣候的區域[C]
sentences: He could not stand the terrible English climate. 他忍受不了糟糕的英國氣候。
She is not used to living in a cold climate. 她不習慣寒帶生活。
After the revolution, the climate of the country remained tense. 革命以後，那個國家的氣氛依然緊張。

other_types: 過去式：closured   過去分詞：closured   現在分詞：closuring
part_of_speech: n.: 關閉；打烊；結束；終止
vt.: 使結束；結束討論
n.: 【美】巴士，公車；【英】長途公車；（普通）旅客車廂
vt.: 訓練，指導，輔導[（+for/in）]
vi.: 作指導（或輔導）；接受輔導；乘馬車旅行
sentences: I had to cross a number of coaches to reach the dining car. 我得穿過好幾節車廂才到餐車。
Our football team has got a very experienced coach. 我們的足球隊有了一個很有經驗的教練。
He coaches people for TOEFL examinations. 他指導人準備托福考試。

part_of_speech: n.: 法典，法規[C]；規則，規範；禮教習俗[C]
vt.: 為……編碼；把……譯成電碼（密碼等）
sentences: Students must observe the code of the school. 學生必須遵守校規。
He sent a message in code. 他用密碼發送了一份訊息。
The librarian is coding the new books. 圖書館員在為新書編號。

other_types: 過去式：collected   過去分詞：collected   現在分詞：collecting
part_of_speech: vt.: 收集，採集；使集合；領取（信件等）；接走
vi.: 聚集，堆積；收款，收帳[（+for）]
adj.: （電話，電報等）受話人（或收報人等）付費的
adv.: （打電話，電報等時）由受話人（或收報人等）付費
sentences: Why do you collect stamps? 你為何集郵？
He's gone to collect his daughter. 他去接女兒了。
Give the speaker a few minutes to collect herself and then begin the programme. 給演講者幾分鐘集中思考一下，然後就開始這項節目。
Water collects in hollows. 水在坑窪處聚集。
As I had no money with me, I made a collect call. 因為身上沒錢，我打了一個由對方付款的電話。
You can call me collect. 你可以打由我付款的電話給我。

other_types: 過去式：commenced   過去分詞：commenced   現在分詞：commencing
part_of_speech: vt.: 開始；著手[+v-ing][+to-v]
vi.: 開始[（+with）]；【英】得學位
sentences: He commenced studying law in 1988. 他於一九八八年開始學習法律。
She commenced to cry. 她開始哭了起來。
The bull-fight was to commence in twenty minutes. 鬥牛在二十分鐘後開始。

part_of_speech: n.: 佣金[C][U][（+on）]；（權限，任務等的）委任，委託[U]
vt.: 委任，委託[O2]；任命，授銜[O1]
sentences: He gets a 10% commission on everything he sells. 他從銷售的每件商品中得到百分之十的佣金。
We all approve of the commission of authority to him. 我們都贊成把職權委任於他。
The problem was assigned to a commission. 這個問題交給一個委員會處理。
He was indicted for the commission of a crime. 他因犯罪而被控告。
The artist was commissioned to paint a picture for the hall. 這位藝術家受委託為這個大廳作一幅畫。
He was commissioned a general at the age of 50. 他五十歲時被任命為將軍。

other_types: 過去式：committed   過去分詞：committed   現在分詞：committing
part_of_speech: vt.: 犯（罪），做（錯事等）；使承擔義務；使作出保證；使表態[（+to）]
sentences: I committed an error in handling the business. 我在處理這一業務時犯了一個錯誤。
He didn't commit himself to anything. 他沒有作任何承諾。
The child was committed to the nurse's care. 孩子被交給護士照顧。
The judge committed him to ten years' imprisonment. 法官判處他十年徒刑。
The company committed most of its profits to building new factories. 公司撥出大部分利潤建造新工廠。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 委員會[G]；【律】監護人
sentences: He is on the finance committee. 他是財政委員會的委員。

other_types: 形變：commoner, more common,commonest, most common
part_of_speech: adj.: 普通的；常見的；一般的，平常的[Z][B]
n.: 公共用地，公有地[C]
sentences: Smith is a very common last name in England. 在英國史密斯是很常見的姓。
Common interests bind us together. 共同的利益使我們結合在一起。
We must all work for the common good. 我們大家必須為公共的利益而工作。

other_types: 副詞比較級：more commonly   最高級：most commonly
part_of_speech: adv.: 通常地，一般地；平凡地；粗俗地，下賤地
sentences: Robert is commonly called Rob. 羅伯特通常喚做羅伯。

other_types: 過去式：commuted   過去分詞：commuted   現在分詞：commuting
part_of_speech: vt.: 減輕（刑罰等）[（+to）]；用……交換（或代替）；交換[（+for/into）]
vi.: （購用月票或季票）通勤[（+between/from/to）]；替代；代償
n.: 【口】通勤[C]
sentences: His sentence was commuted from death to life imprisonment. 他由死刑改判為終身監禁。
She commutes between Chicago and Rockford every day. 她每天通勤於芝加哥和洛克福之間。
commute with payment in place of labor 出錢代償勞役
It's a long commute from New York to Boston. 從紐約通勤到波士頓路程很長。

part_of_speech: n.: 通勤者；經常乘公交車輛往返者[C]
sentences: I knew a commuter who rode in town on the first train every morning. 我認識一個每天都乘頭班火車進城的通勤者。

part_of_speech: n.: 公司，商號[C][G]；劇團[C][G]
sentences: Tom works for a computer company. 湯姆在一家電腦公司上班。
People are judged by the company they keep. 根據某人結交的朋友便能判斷其人了。
Do you expect company for the weekend? 這個週末你家有客人嗎？

part_of_speech: adj.: 可比較的[（+with）]；比得上的[（+to）]
sentences: The sets of figures are not comparable. 這幾組數字是不可比的。
The music of Irving Berlin is scarcely comparable to that of Beethoven. 歐文‧伯林的音樂很難與貝多芬的媲美。

other_types: 過去式：compared   過去分詞：compared   現在分詞：comparing
part_of_speech: vt.: 比較，對照[（+with/to）]；比喻為，比作[（+to/with）]
vi.: （可與……）相比，匹敵[（+with）]
n.: （常用於慣用語）比較[U]
sentences: Compared with him, I am a bungler. 與他相比，我只能算是一個笨拙的人。
Compare this with that, and you will see which is better. 將這個與那個比較一下，你就會知道哪個比較好了。
This view is beyond compare. 這景色無與倫比。

part_of_speech: adj.: 能共處的；可並立的；適合的；兼用式的；【電腦】相容的

other_types: 過去式：compensated   過去分詞：compensated   現在分詞：compensating
part_of_speech: vt.: 補償，賠償；酬報[（+for）]；改變貨幣含金量以穩定貨幣
vi.: 補償，賠償；抵銷[（+for）]
sentences: We compensate workers for injuries suffered at their work. 我們對工人在工作中受傷給予補償。
She used her good looks to compensate for her lack of intelligence. 她智力欠佳權以美貌彌補。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 補償，彌補；賠償[（+for/on）]；賠償金；補償金[S1][（+for）]
sentences: Tom gave me a new knife as compensation for the one he lost. 湯姆給了我一把新刀，算是賠償那把被他丟失的刀。
Did you get any compensation when you were dismissed from your job? 你被解僱時有沒有拿到補助金？
The job is hard but the compensation is good. 這個工作很辛苦，但報酬是高的。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有能力的，能幹的；能勝任的，稱職的；充分的，足夠的；令人滿意的，合格的
sentences: Mark proved to be a very competent manager. 馬克證明了自己是一個很能幹的經理。
She has a competent knowledge of English. 她已掌握了足夠的英語知識。

part_of_speech: n.: 競爭，角逐[U][（+with/between/for）]；比賽，競賽；賽會[C][+to-v]
sentences: Competition among youths to enter the best colleges is intense. 年輕人想進一流大學的競爭是很激烈的。
I entered a chess competition and finished third. 我參加了象棋比賽名列第三。
He's no competition for Henry. 他不是亨利的對手。

other_types: 比較級：more competitive   最高級：most competitive
part_of_speech: adj.: 競爭的；經由競爭的，競爭性的；好競爭的
sentences: the competitive nature of our society 我們社會的競爭性
A competitive person loves to win and hates to lose. 競爭心強的人喜歡贏討厭輸。

part_of_speech: n.: 競爭者；對手，敵手[C]
sentences: The two friends were competitors for the class presidency. 那兩位朋友在爭當班長一事上是競爭對手。

other_types: 過去式：complained   過去分詞：complained   現在分詞：complaining
part_of_speech: vi.: 抱怨，發牢騷；訴說（病痛等）[（+to/about/of）]；控訴，投訴[（+to/about/of）]
vt.: 抱怨；控訴[Y][+that]
sentences: I've really got nothing to complain of. 我確實沒有什麼可抱怨的。
He complained to me about the food. 他向我抱怨伙食不佳。
He complained to the police of the boys stealing his apples. 他向警方控告那些男孩偷他的蘋果。
He complained that the exam was too hard. 他抱怨考試太難了。

part_of_speech: n.: 抱怨；抗議；怨言；抱怨的緣由[C][U][（+about/over/against）]；【律】控告；控訴[C][（+against/with）]
sentences: There is no real reason for complaint. 沒有什麼可抱怨的理由。
The storekeeper signed a complaint accusing them of shoplifting. 店主簽署了控告書，指控他們在店裡扒竊貨物。
Arthritis is a common complaint among the elderly. 關節炎是老年人的一種常見病。

other_types: 比較級：more complete   最高級：most complete
part_of_speech: adj.: 完整的；全部的；完成的；結束的[F]
vt.: 使齊全；使完整；完成；結束
sentences: Is this a complete list? 這是份完整的清單嗎？
We can't go out until our homework is complete. 我們把作業做完才能出去。
A more complete study of the subject is needed. 對這個問題需要作更加徹底的研究。
He demanded complete silence. 他要求完全肅靜。
He bought a lovely house complete with furniture. 他買下一幢帶有傢俱的漂亮的房子。
David is considered the complete manager. 大衛被認為是一位完美無缺的經理。
Complete the sentences in the exercise by filling in the blanks. 在空白處填充使練習中各句成為完整句。
By the end of August we had completed the work. 我們到八月底就完成了這項工作。

other_types: 比較級：more complex   最高級：most complex
part_of_speech: adj.: 複雜的，錯綜複雜的；難懂的；由各種部分所構成的，複合的，合成的
n.[C]: 複合物，綜合體；集團；綜合設施
sentences: It was a complex problem. 這是一個複雜的問題。
A petrochemical complex is to be built here. 這兒將建造一個石油化學聯合企業。
She has a complex about rats. 她對老鼠有病態恐懼。

part_of_speech: n.: 複雜（性），錯綜（性）[U]；錯綜複雜的事物[C][P1]
sentences: a political problem of great complexity 極為複雜的政治問題

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 讚美的話；恭維；敬意[（+on）]；問候；致意；道賀[P]
vt.: 讚美；恭維；祝賀[（+on）]；向……贈送（某物）以表示敬意（或祝賀）[（+with）]
sentences: It's the nicest compliment I've ever had. 這是我聽到的最好的恭維話。
My compliments to your father! 向你父親代為致意！
He complimented her on her new dress. 他稱讚她的新衣服漂亮。

part_of_speech: adj.: 贊賞的；恭維的；表示敬意的；問候的；【美】贈送的[Z]
sentences: My boss was very complimentary about my work. 老板對我的工作極其稱讚。
a complimentary ticket 贈券

other_types: 過去式：complied   過去分詞：complied   現在分詞：complying
part_of_speech: vi.: （對要求、命令等）依從，順從，遵從[（+with）]
sentences: We comply with all fire safety rules. 我們遵守有關消防安全的全部條例。

part_of_speech: adj.: 廣泛的；無所不包的；綜合的；有充分理解力的
n.: （為獲得高一級學位必須通過的）專業綜合測驗，總考[P]；【英】綜合學校
sentences: a comprehensive survey 全面的考察
a comprehensive mind 具有充分理解力的頭腦

part_of_speech: n.: 妥協，和解[C][U][（+between）]；妥協方案，折衷辦法；折衷物[C]
vt.: 互讓解決（分歧等）；連累，危及
vi.: 妥協，讓步[（+on）]
sentences: I hope we shall come to a compromise. 我希望我們能達成妥協。
The interior decoration of the house is a compromise between Chinese and foreign styles. 這所房子的內部裝飾是中西兩式的折衷物。
She did it without compromise of her reputation. 她做這事而無損她的名譽。
You will compromise your good name if you associate with these people. 你如果與這些人交往就會損害你的好名聲。
He refused to compromise his principles. 他拒絕放棄原則。
They found it wiser to compromise with her. 他們覺得與她妥協更明智。

part_of_speech: adj.: 必須做的；義務的；必修的；強制的，強迫的
sentences: Is English a compulsory subject? 英語是必修科目嗎？
Education is compulsory for children in most countries. 多數國家對兒童實施義務教育。
compulsory legislation 強制性立法

other_types: 過去式：conceded   過去分詞：conceded   現在分詞：conceding
part_of_speech: vt.: （勉強）承認[+that]；讓給，給予；容許[O1][（+to）]
vi.: 讓步；承認失敗
sentences: The candidate conceded that he had lost the election. 這位候選人承認他已經在競選中失敗。
They conceded us the right to cross their land. 他們容許我們在他們的土地上有過路權。
It is impossible for us to concede to your unreasonable request. 要我們對你的無理要求讓步是不可能的。
The senator had to concede. 參議員只好承認競選失敗。

other_types: 過去式：concerned   過去分詞：concerned   現在分詞：concerning
part_of_speech: vt.: （不用被動式）關於；涉及，關係到；影響到
n.: 關心的事，重要的事[C]；關係；利害關係[C][U][（+with/in）]
sentences: The letter is chiefly concerned with export commodities. 這封信主要是關於出口商品的。
The news concerns your brother. 這消息與你兄弟有關。
The boy's poor health concerned his parents. 那男孩健康狀況不佳，使他的父母親憂慮。
He is concerned for her safety. 他擔心她的安全。
He was very concerned about her. 他對她非常關心。
That's no concern of mine. 那不關我的事。
Andrew expressed his concern. 安德魯表示了他的關切。

other_types: 過去式：concluded   過去分詞：concluded   現在分詞：concluding
part_of_speech: vt.: 結束[（+by/with）]；推斷出，斷定[W][Y][+that]
vi.: 結束，終了[（+with）]；斷定
sentences: We concluded our meeting at 9 o'clock. 我們九點鐘結束了會議。
What can you conclude from these observations? 你從這些觀察中能得出什麼結論？
He concluded that he would wait a little longer. 他決定再等一會兒。
He concluded to quit on pay day. 他決定在發薪水這天辭職。
The meeting concluded after two hours. 兩小時後會議結束了。

part_of_speech: n.: 結論；推論；決定[C][+that]；結尾，結局[C]
sentences: They drew different conclusions from the facts. 他們從這些事實中引出了不同的結論。
The debate did not come to a conclusion until midnight. 辯論直到午夜才結束。
The conclusion of this agreement is in the interests of both sides. 簽訂這份合同對雙方都有好處。

part_of_speech: n.: 匯合；集合；合流；群集；廣場；（車站、機場）中央大廳
n.: 情況；（健康等）狀態[C][U]；環境；形勢[P]
vt.: 決定；為……的條件；使適應；【心】使形成條件反射[O2]
sentences: What's the patient's condition? 病人的情況如何？
The miners there worked in dreadful conditions. 那裡的礦工們在極其惡劣的環境中工作。
Conditions were favorable for business then. 當時的形勢有利於經商。
I'll do it on condition that you pay for everything. 我可以做此事，條件是你得支付一切費用。
Hard work is a condition of success. 勤奮是成功的前提。
Mr. Toffler has a lung condition. 托夫勒先生患肺病。
Ability and effort condition success. 成功取決於才幹和努力。
Exercise conditions your muscles. 運動可以使你肌肉變得結實。

other_types: 過去式：conducted   過去分詞：conducted   現在分詞：conducting
part_of_speech: vt.: 引導，帶領；實施；處理；經營，管理
vi.: 引導，帶領；指揮樂隊
sentences: He conducted the members of the audience to their seats. 他引觀眾到他們的座位上。
They hired agents to conduct their affairs. 他們僱請代理人來處理他們的事務。
Mr. Green will conduct the orchestra. 格林先生將指揮這支管弦樂隊。
Most metals conduct electricity. 大多數金屬能導電。

other_types: 過去式：confirmed   過去分詞：confirmed   現在分詞：confirming
part_of_speech: vt.: 證實；確定[+（that）][+wh-]；堅定；加強
sentences: His letter confirmed everything. 他的信證實了一切。
The latest developments confirmed me in my belief. 最新的發展使我堅信我的信仰。
The queen confirmed the treaty. 女王批准了此項條約。

part_of_speech: n.[U: 確定；確證；批准；【宗】（天主教等的）堅信禮，堅振禮
sentences: I think I can come next Tuesday, but I will send you a confirmation by post. 我想下星期二可以來，不過我會寫信把肯定的答覆告訴你。
Evidence in confirmation of his statements is lacking. 缺少可資證實他所言的證據。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 混亂；混亂狀況；騷動；混淆
sentences: The room was in a state of confusion. 房間一片雜亂。
You can avoid confusion by speaking clearly. 你說得清楚些，這樣可以避免誤解。
The old woman looked at him in confusion. 老婦人用迷茫的目光打量著他。

other_types: 過去式：connected   過去分詞：connected   現在分詞：connecting
part_of_speech: vt.: 連接，連結[（+with/to）]；聯想[（+with）]
vi.: 連接，連結[（+by/with/to）]；（交通工具）銜接，聯運[（+with）]
sentences: This railway connects London and Edinburgh. 這條鐵路連接倫敦與愛丁堡。
We connect the word blue with the color of the sky. 我們由藍這個字會聯想到晴空的顏色。
Connect me with Taipei, please. 請給我接通臺北。
This wire connects with that one. 這根電線與那根連接。

part_of_speech: n.: 連接；聯絡；銜接[C][U][（+with/between）]；關係，關聯[C][U][（+with/between）]
sentences: The connection of our telephone took several hours. 我們用了好幾個小時才接通了電話。
Trade connections existed between the two countries before the war. 戰前兩國之間有過貿易往來。
The train was late and I missed my connection. 火車晚點了，我未能轉上車。
He is a distant connection of my wife's. 他是我妻子的一個遠親。
She's just a business connection. 她只是我的一個客戶。
The company has connections with a number of Japanese firms. 這家公司與幾家日本商號有業務往來。

part_of_speech: n.: 結果，後果[C][（+of）]；重大，重要（性）[U][（+to）]
sentences: I'm quite willing to accept the consequences. 我完全願意承擔後果。
He is a man of great consequence. 他是一個很重要的人物。
The young man rambled on with an air of great consequence. 小伙子帶著妄自尊大的神態沒完沒了地東拉西扯。

other_types: 過去式：considered   過去分詞：considered   現在分詞：considering
part_of_speech: vt.: 考慮，細想[+v-ing][+wh-]；考慮到[+that][+wh-]
vi.: 考慮，細想
sentences: I've begun to consider what to do next. 我已在考慮下一步該怎麼辦。
We're considering moving to Seattle. 我們考慮搬往西雅圖。
Have you considered that he is only a little boy? 你有沒有考慮到他僅僅是個小孩？
His health is good if you consider his age. 如果你考慮到他的年紀，他的健康狀況就算良好了。
We consider that the defendant is not guilty. 我們認為被告無罪。
Michael is considered an expert in computer science. 邁克被認為是位電腦專家。
He paused a moment to consider. 他停下來想了一會兒。

other_types: 比較級：more considerable   最高級：most considerable
part_of_speech: adj.: 相當大的；相當多的；值得考慮的；重要的
n.: 【美】【口】大量[U]
sentences: He made a considerable sum of money in real estate. 他做房地產生意賺了大筆錢。
Paul is a considerable person in his town. 保羅是鎮上的一位重要人物。
I figure he earned considerable. 我估計他賺了不少。

part_of_speech: n.: 委託；交付；運送[U]；託付物；託賣品；遞運的；委託貨物[C]

other_types: 過去式：consisted   過去分詞：consisted   現在分詞：consisting
part_of_speech: vi.: 組成，構成[（+of）]；在於，存在於[（+in）]
sentences: A university consists of teachers, administrators and students. 大學由教師，行政人員和學生組成。
The House of Commons consisted of 658 members. 下議院由六百五十八名議員組成。
The beauty of the picture consists in its balance of colors. 這幅畫的美在於其色彩的調和。
Tolerance consists in respecting the opinions of others. 寬容在於尊重別人的意見。
The information consists with his account. 消息與他的敘述相符合。

other_types: 比較級：more consistent   最高級：most consistent
part_of_speech: adj.: 始終如一的，前後一致的[（+in）]；與……一致的；符合的[F][（+with）]
sentences: He remained consistent in his opposition to anything new. 他始終反對一切新事物。
His behavior is consistent with his teaching. 他的行為與其教誨相符。

part_of_speech: adv.: 一貫地；固守地
adj.: 固定的，不變的；不停的，接連不斷的，持續的
n.[C]: 【數】【物】常數，衡量；不變的事物
sentences: The birth rate in this city is almost constant. 這城市的出生率幾乎是不變的。
He hates his wife's constant nagging. 他討厭他妻子嘮叨不休。
He remained constant till death. 他至死忠貞不渝。
The speed of light is an important constant. 光速是一個重要的常數。

other_types: 副詞比較級：more constantly   最高級：most constantly
part_of_speech: adv.: 不斷地；時常地
sentences: She is constantly changing her mind. 她經常改變主意。

part_of_speech: n.: 建造，建設；建造術[U]；建築物，建造物[C]
sentences: The new school is still under construction. 新學校還在建造中。
The building is a construction of wood. 這是木質結構的建築。
You will soon learn when to use this kind of construction. 你不久就會學會何時該用這種句法結構。
Let's put a good construction on her conduct first. 讓我們對她的行為先作一個善意的解釋吧。

other_types: 過去式：consulted   過去分詞：consulted   現在分詞：consulting
part_of_speech: vt.: 與……商量；找（醫生）看病；請教
vi.: 商議，磋商[（+with）]；當顧問[（+for）]
sentences: I'll do nothing without consulting you. 我採取行動之前一定和你商量。
He went to town to consult his doctor. 他進城去看醫生。
He consulted his notebook repeatedly during his speech. 他講演時不斷看他的筆記本。
We will consult together about her education. 我們將一起商議她的教育事宜。
The retired executive consults for several large companies. 那位退休的總裁在好幾家大公司當顧問。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 顧問；會診醫生，顧問醫生
sentences: There are two consultants to the governor on environmental protection. 州長有兩個環保問題顧問。
a consultant on environmental protection to the governor 州長的環境保護問題顧問
The consultant was a man who had many unanswered questions. 這個男性諮詢者有許多待解的問題。

other_types: 過去式：consumed   過去分詞：consumed   現在分詞：consuming
part_of_speech: vt.: 消耗，花費；耗盡；吃完，喝光
vi.: 耗盡生命；被（燒）毀
sentences: She consumed most of her time in reading. 她把大部分時間都花在讀書上。
The kids soon consumed all the food on the table. 孩子們一會兒功夫便把桌上的食品全部吃光。
The fire consumed half the village. 大火吞噬了半個村莊。
The boy was consumed with curiosity. 那男孩充滿好奇心。
She consumed away with grief. 她抑鬱而死。

part_of_speech: n.: 消費者；消耗者

other_types: 過去式：contained   過去分詞：contained   現在分詞：containing
part_of_speech: vt.: 包含；容納；控制，遏制
sentences: The jar contains ten glasses of water. 這隻大口瓶能裝十杯水。
The pill contains vitamins. 這藥丸中含有多種維他命。
I could not contain my laughter. 我無法控制自己不笑出聲來。
A gallon contains four quarts. 一加侖相當於四夸脫。
10 contains 5 and 2. 十可被五和二除盡。

part_of_speech: n.: 貨櫃[C]；容器（如箱、盒、罐等）[C]
adj.: 多次重複的，頻頻的[B]；不間斷的，連續的
sentences: He still smokes despite the continual warnings of his doctor. 儘管他的醫生多次警告，他還是抽菸。
Continual rain ruined the crops. 連續陰雨毀壞了莊稼。

part_of_speech: n.: （間斷後的）再開始；繼續不斷；延續[U][S1]；續編；添附物；延長部分[C]
sentences: Continuation of my work was difficult after I had been ill for six months. 我生了半年病後，對繼續工作感到很困難。
The children hoped that the continuation of the serial would be more interesting. 孩子們希望連續廣播劇的續編會更有趣些。

other_types: 過去式：continued   過去分詞：continued   現在分詞：continuing
part_of_speech: vi.: 繼續，持續；延伸[（+with）]；留，仍舊[L]
vt.: 使繼續；使延伸[+v-ing][+to-v]；使留任
sentences: The forest continues for miles. 森林綿延數英里。
The weather continues cold. 天氣還是冷。
I was allowed to continue using the library. 我獲准繼續使用該圖書館。
They continued to meet every week. 他們繼續每週見面。
The company continued him in office for another year. 公司留他繼續任職了一年。
Don't worry about Jack, she continued. 不必擔心傑克，她繼續說道。
The judge continued the case until next Friday. 法官推遲到下個星期五審理該案。

other_types: 過去式：contributed   過去分詞：contributed   現在分詞：contributing
part_of_speech: vt.: 捐（款）；捐獻，捐助[（+to/towards）]；貢獻，提供[（+to/towards）]
vi.: 捐獻[（+to/towards）]；貢獻，出力[（+to/towards）]
sentences: He contributed half of his savings to the relief fund. 他將積蓄的一半捐獻給救濟基金會。
He didn't contribute one idea to the document. 他對這個文件沒有提供一個主意。
He contributed generously to the Red Cross. 他對紅十字會慷慨捐助。
He never contributes to the discussion. 他在討論時從不發表意見。
The scientist often contributes to an academic journal. 這位科學家常常給那家學術期刊撰稿。

part_of_speech: n.: 貢獻[C][U][（+to/towards）]；捐獻，捐助[U]
sentences: The invention of paper was a great contribution to human civilization. 紙的發明是對人類文明的一大貢獻。
I made a contribution of $100 to the Famine Relief Fund. 我向救災基金會捐獻了一百元錢。
Will you give us some contribution? 你能給我們投稿嗎？
The editor is short of contributions for the May issue. 編輯缺少五月號一期上的稿件。

other_types: 過去式：controlled   過去分詞：controlled   現在分詞：controlling
part_of_speech: vt.: 控制；支配；管理；克制；抑制
n.: 支配；控制；調節；抑制[U][（+of/over）]；控制手段（或措施）；統制[P1][（+on/over）]
sentences: She is skillful enough to control the machine now. 現在她已有了足夠的技術可以操縱這臺機器了。
The British government at that time controlled the island. 當時英國政府控制該島。
You must learn to control your temper. 你必須學會克制著不發脾氣。
They have no control over him. 他們控制不了他。
The helicopter landed with Joe at the controls. 直升機在喬的操縱下降落。

other_types: 比較級：more convenient   最高級：most convenient
part_of_speech: adj.: 合宜的；方便的；便利的[（+for/to）]；近而方便的[（+for/to）]
sentences: Please come whenever it is convenient to you. 方便的時候，請隨時來。

part_of_speech: adv.: 方便地，便利地；合宜地
sentences: My house is conveniently near the bus-stop. 我家就在公車站附近，非常方便。

other_types: 過去式：convinced   過去分詞：convinced   現在分詞：convincing
part_of_speech: vt.: 使確信，使信服；說服[（+of）][O5][O2]
sentences: He convinced me of his innocence. 他使我相信他是無辜的。
I was convinced that he knew the truth. 我確信他知道事實。

other_types: 比較級：more convincing   最高級：most convincing
part_of_speech: adj.: 有說服力的；令人信服的；有論據證實的
sentences: a convincing argument 富有說服力的論點

part_of_speech: adj.: 法人（組織）的；團體的；公司的
sentences: a corporate body/a body corporate 法人（團體）
corporate property 公司財產
corporate effort 共同的努力

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 法人；社團法人；【美】股份（有限）公司
sentences: He landed a job in a large American corporation. 他在一家美國大公司謀得一職。

part_of_speech: n.: 費用；成本[C]；代價；損失[U][C]
vt.: 花費[O1]；使付出（時間，勞力，代價等），使喪失[O1]
vi.: 花費
sentences: We must reduce the production cost. 我們必須降低生產成本。
The car cost him around ten thousand US dollars. 這車花去他一萬美元左右。
The error cost the company one million pounds. 這錯誤使公司損失了一百萬英鎊。
The builder costed the job at $1,000. 這活兒營造商估價為一千元。

part_of_speech: adv.: 反方向地，相反地[（+to）]
adj.: 相反的；反對的；對立的[F][（+to）]
n.[C]: 相反之事物；對立物；（拳擊的）回拳，還擊
vt.: 反對；反擊；反駁；抵銷；（拳擊時）還擊
vi.: 反對；反擊；反駁；（拳擊時）還擊
sentences: He acted counter to old conventions. 他的行為與舊習俗背道而馳。
Our neighbor's opinion was counter to that of my parents. 我家鄰居的意見與我父母的意見相反。
I am inclined to believe the counter of what was said. 我傾向於相信與傳說相反之事。
He countered my plan with one of his own. 他用他自己的計畫與我的計畫抗衡。
He hit me but I did not counter. 他打了我，但我沒有還手。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 送遞急件（或外交信件）的信差；（團體旅遊的）導遊，嚮導
sentences: The letter was delivered by a courier this morning. 送遞急件的信差今天早晨送來了這封信。
You will probably learn more on this trip if you go with a courier. 如果跟導遊一起走，你大概會從這次旅遊中學到更多的東西。
A courier reported that the Russian and the Spanish fleets had sailed for these waters. 情報員報導俄國和西班牙艦隊已向這個海域出航。
The news was from the Courier of that morning. 這則消息來自那天早晨的信使報。

part_of_speech: ph.: 附信
n.: 覆蓋，覆蓋範圍；保險項目（或範圍）
n.: 共同工作者；同事；幫手

other_types: 過去式：crashed   過去分詞：crashed   現在分詞：crashing
part_of_speech: vi.: （發出猛烈聲音地）碰撞，倒下，墜落；（飛機等）墜毀，撞壞
vt.: （發出猛烈聲音地）撞擊，砸碎；使（飛機等）墜毀，使（飛機等）撞壞
n.[C]: 相撞（事故）；（飛機的）墜毀，迫降；撞擊聲，爆裂聲
adj.: 應急的，速成的[B]
sentences: The motorcycle crashed into the fence. 摩托車猛地撞在籬笆上。
An airliner crashed west of Denver last night. 昨夜一架客機在丹佛西邊墜毀。
Listen to the thunder crash. 聽劈雷發出的巨響。
His company crashed last year. 他的公司去年破產了。
I'd crashed Friday afternoon -- I hadn't completely recovered from the infection. 我星期五下午昏睡過去了，我發炎還沒完全恢復過來。
The PC just crashed. 那部個人電腦剛當機了。
They crashed their tanks through the railings. 他們開著坦克嘩啦一聲衝過圍欄。
X crashed the system. X把那個系統給當了。
A lot of passengers were killed in the train crash. 許多旅客在火車車禍中喪生了。

part_of_speech: n.: 國書（證明大使身分的證件）；credential的名詞複數
n.: 賒帳，賒欠[U]；（經濟上的）信譽[U]
vt.: 相信；把……記入貸方
sentences: He bought the furniture on credit. 他賒帳買了這傢俱。
Our international credit is excellent. 我們的國際信譽極好。
How much does he have to his credit? 他存了多少錢？
I did not give credit to her story. 我沒有相信她的話。
The credit for this invention goes to Mr. Lodge and his collaborators. 這項發明的榮譽屬於洛奇先生和他的合作者。
She is a credit to her family. 她是給家裡增光的人。
Nobody credited his story. 沒有人相信他的話。
The bank credited 50,000 dollars to us. 那家銀行貸了五萬元給我們。
The accident was credited to carelessness on the part of the driver. 這起事故是由於駕車人不小心引起的。
I credit him with honesty. 我相信他是誠實的。

part_of_speech: adj.: 緊要的，關鍵性的，危急的；批評的，批判的，評論性的
sentences: That was a critical time in the nation's history. 那是涉及國家命運的一個關鍵時刻。
Your critical analysis helped me a great deal. 你的評論分析對我幫助很大。
She is so critical that nobody can get along with her. 她很愛挑剔，沒有人能和她相處得來。
His attendance is critical to the success of the meeting. 他的出席對於這次會議的成功是必不可少的。

other_types: 過去式：criticized   過去分詞：criticized   現在分詞：criticizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 批評；批判；苛求；非難[（+for）]；評論；評價
vi.: 批評；批判；苛求；非難；評論；評價
sentences: He criticized her in a very unfair way. 他極不公平地指摘她。
It's hard to criticize one's own work. 評價自己的工作並非易事。

part_of_speech: n.: 人群[C][G]；【口】一伙，一幫[C]
vt.: 擠滿；將……塞進[O]
vi.: 擠，擁擠[Q]；聚集
sentences: There was a crowd of people in front of the town hall. 市政大廳前有一群人。
Sam and his crowd went into the discotheque. 山姆及其一伙走進了那家迪斯可舞廳。
I saw a crowd of magazines and papers on her desk. 我看見她桌上放著一堆雜誌和報紙。
You can do what you want to do, but never follow the crowd. 你想做什麼就做什麼，可別隨大流。
Passengers crowded the platform. 月臺擠滿了乘客。
He crowded more books onto the shelf. 他向書架上又塞了一些書。
Don't crowd me, I'll pay. 別催逼我，我會付的。
People crowded into the cinema. 人們擠進電影院。

other_types: 比較級：more crowded   最高級：most crowded
part_of_speech: adj.: 擁擠的，擠滿人群的；閱歷豐富的；事變多的
sentences: a crowded train 擁擠的火車
crowded cities 擁擠的城市

other_types: 比較級：more crucial   最高級：most crucial
part_of_speech: adj.: 決定性的，重要的[（+to/for）]；嚴酷的，艱難的
sentences: These negotiations are crucial to the future of our firm. 這些談判對我們公司的前途至關重要。
a crucial incision 十字形切口

other_types: 過去式：cruised   過去分詞：cruised   現在分詞：cruising
part_of_speech: vi.: （無目的地的）巡航；航遊；（計程車，警車等）緩慢巡行
vt.: 巡航於；航遊於；緩慢巡行於
n.[C]: 巡航；航遊；巡邏；（坐船）旅行
sentences: The coastguard cutter cruised along the coast looking for smugglers. 海岸警衛隊緝私艇沿海巡邏搜尋走私犯。
The taxi was cruising down the street in search of passengers. 計程車沿大街緩慢地行駛以兜攬顧客。
The police car cruised the neighborhood. 警車在那個地區巡行。
I saw several boys cruising the street. 我看見幾個男孩徘徊於街頭。
The liner is making a round-the-world cruise. 客輪正在做環球航行。

part_of_speech: n.: 通貨，貨幣[C][U]；通用，流通；流傳，傳播[U]
sentences: The Japanese yen is one of the stronger currencies in the world. 日元是世界上較堅挺的貨幣之一。
These ideas have gained wide currency. 這些思想已廣泛傳播。

other_types: 比較級：more current   最高級：most current
part_of_speech: adj.: 現時的，當前的；現行的；通用的，流行的
n.: 流動，水流，氣流[C]；電流[C][U]
sentences: Our current methods of production are too expensive. 我們現今用的生產方法太花錢了。
This note is no longer current. 這種紙幣已不流通。
This view was current in the country. 當時這種看法在這個國家很流行。
The current in this place is very rapid. 這兒的水流很急。
The military government failed to control the current of public opinion. 軍人政府未能控制輿論的動向。

part_of_speech: n.: （社會，團體的）習俗，慣例[C][U]；（個人的）習慣[C]
adj.: 訂做的，訂製的[B]
sentences: The celebration of Christmas is a custom. 慶祝耶誕節是一種風俗。
Did you have any trouble with the Customs? 你通過海關有麻煩嗎？

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 顧客；買主；【口】傢伙，小子
sentences: The store has a lot of regular customers. 這家商店有許多老主顧。
Steven is a queer customer. 史蒂文是個怪人。

part_of_speech: n.: 關稅[K]；（常大寫）海關；報關手續[J]
sentences: I paid $20 in customs on the $100 Swiss watch. 我為一百美元的瑞士表付了二十美元的關稅。
As soon as I got through customs I jumped into a taxi. 我一通過海關就跳進了一輛計程車。

part_of_speech: ph.: 最前線；尖端；最重要的位置
sentences: California is on the cutting edge of trends that spread nationwide. 加州走在全國流行的尖端。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 週期；循環；一轉；整個系列；整個過程
vi.: 循環，輪轉；騎腳踏車（或摩托車）
vt.: 使循環，使輪轉
sentences: The seasons of the year make a cycle. 一年四季構成一個循環。
He studied the cycle of events leading to the Great Depression. 他研究了導致大蕭條的一系列事件。
She goes to work on her cycle. 她騎腳踏車上班。
The machine cycles automatically. 這臺機器自動循環運轉。
I cycled to the beach. 我騎車去海灘。

part_of_speech: adj.: 每日的；日常的
adv.: 每日
n.[C]: 日報；【英】【口】（通勤的）女佣人
sentences: These workers are paid on a daily basis. 這些工人領的是日薪。
There was little change in their daily lives. 他們的日常生活幾乎沒有變化。
My father goes for a walk daily. 我父親每天散步。
A new daily will appear soon in our town. 一份新的日報不久將在本市發行。

part_of_speech: n.: 損害；損失[U][（+to）]；賠償金[P]
vt.: 損害，毀壞
sentences: The earthquake caused great damage. 地震造成了極大的損害。
She has not got any damages. 她沒有得到任何賠償費。
A torrent of rain came down and damaged the crops. 大雨傾盆而下，損害了農作物。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 截止期限，最後限期；（報紙等的）截稿時間
sentences: Can they finish this before the deadline? 他們能不能在最後期限之前完成這項工作？
The deadline for making an application is next Friday. 申請於下星期五截止。
The reporter's deadline was 8 P.M. for the morning edition. 記者給上午版發稿的截止時間是（前一天的）下午八點。

other_types: 過去式：dealt   過去分詞：dealt   現在分詞：dealing
part_of_speech: vt.: 發（紙牌）[（+to/out）][O1]；分配，分給[（+to/out）]
vi.: （紙牌戲）發牌；經營；交易[（+in/with）]
n.: 交易[C]；數量，大量[S][（+of）]
sentences: The Red Cross dealt out food to hungry villagers. 紅十字會把食品分發給飢餓的村民。
He dealt Jim a blow on the ear. 他打了吉姆一記耳光。
It's his turn to deal. 該他發牌。
This store deals in silk. 這家店經營絲綢。
It was probably the best business deal I ever did. 那也許是我曾經做過的最好的一筆生意。
He had given this question a great deal of thought. 他對這個問題做過許多思考。

other_types: 過去式：debited   過去分詞：debited   現在分詞：debiting
part_of_speech: n.: 【會計】借方
vt.: 把……記入借方
n.: 債，借款[C]；恩義，情義[C]
sentences: He has a lot of old debts to meet. 他有許多舊債要償付。
The debt that he owed her could never be paid. 他欠她的情永遠也還不了。
It's much easier to get into debt than to get out of debt. 借債容易還債難。

part_of_speech: n.: 決定，決心；判斷；結論[C][U][+to-v]；果斷，決心[U]
sentences: It was a sudden decision. 這是一個突然的決定。
My father lacks decision. 我父親缺乏果斷力。

other_types: 過去式：decorated   過去分詞：decorated   現在分詞：decorating
part_of_speech: vt.: 裝飾，修飾[（+with）]；粉刷；油漆
vi.: 裝飾，布置
sentences: The great hall was decorated with flowers. 大廳裡裝飾著花朵。
The general was decorated for winning the battle. 將軍因贏得這一戰役而被授勛。

other_types: 過去式：decreased   過去分詞：decreased   現在分詞：decreasing
part_of_speech: vi.: 減；減少，減小[（+in/to）]
vt.: 減；減少，減小[（+to）]
sentences: Car sales are decreasing. 汽車銷售量下跌。
These measures will help decrease the cost of production. 這些措施有助於降低生產成本。
They are making every effort to decrease the production cost. 他們正盡力減少生產成本。

other_types: 過去式：dedicated   過去分詞：dedicated   現在分詞：dedicating
part_of_speech: vt.: 以……奉獻，以……供奉[（+to）]；為（建築物等）舉行落成典禮
sentences: The monument was dedicated to the memory of the national hero. 這座碑是為紀念那位民族英雄而建造的。
The school dedicated the new building on Sunday. 學校於星期日為新大樓舉行落成典禮。
He dedicated his life to science. 他獻身科學。
She dedicated her first book to her father. 她將她的第一本書獻給了她父親。

other_types: 過去式：deducted   過去分詞：deducted   現在分詞：deducting
part_of_speech: vt.: 扣除，減除[（+from）]
sentences: deduct a tax from one's wages 從薪資中扣除稅款

part_of_speech: n.: 缺點，缺陷，不足之處[C]
vi.: 逃跑，脫離，背叛[（+to/from）]
sentences: Indecision is his chief defect. 優柔寡斷是他的主要缺點。
He defected to the enemy. 他投敵了。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有缺陷的，不完美的[（+in）]；【語】不完全變化的，變形不全的
n.[C]: 身心殘障者；【語】不完全變化字
sentences: defective in workmanship 工藝上存在瑕疵
Ought is a defective verb. ought是變化不完全的動詞。
He's mentally defective. 他心智不健全。

part_of_speech: adj.: 明確的，確切的；一定的，肯定的
sentences: She made no definite answer. 她沒有作確定的回答。
It's definite that he'll be late again. 他肯定又要遲到。

other_types: 副詞比較級：more definitely   最高級：most definitely
part_of_speech: adv.: 明確地；明顯地，清楚地；肯定地；當然
sentences: I cannot say definitely until I see Hunt. 我要等見過亨特後才能有個明確的說法。
He is definitely coming. 他一定會來的。

part_of_speech: n.: 度，度數[C]；程度；等級[C][U]
sentences: Water freezes at zero degrees Centigrade. 水在攝氏零度結冰。
Our teacher has a high degree of responsibility. 我們老師有高度的責任感。
I agree with you to some degree. 在某種程度上我與你意見一致。
He has just got his M.A. degree. 他剛拿到文學碩士學位。

other_types: 過去式：delayed   過去分詞：delayed   現在分詞：delaying
part_of_speech: vt.: 延緩；使延期；耽擱；延誤
vi.: 拖延；耽擱
n.: 延遲；耽擱[U][C]；耽擱的時間[C]
sentences: The accident delayed the train for two hours. 事故使火車耽擱了兩小時。
I'm sorry that I've delayed so long. 我很抱歉拖了這麼久。
My doctor advised me to give up smoking without delay. 我的醫生勸我立即戒菸。
Heavy fog is causing serious delays of all incoming flights. 濃霧造成了降落班機嚴重的誤點。

other_types: 過去式：deleted   過去分詞：deleted   現在分詞：deleting
part_of_speech: vt.: 刪除；劃掉（文字等）；擦去
n.: 欣喜，愉快[U]；樂事，樂趣[C]
vt.: 使高興
vi.: 高興；喜愛；取樂[（+in）]
sentences: To our delight, our football team won. 令我們高興的是，我們的足球隊贏了。
She ran back home with delight. 她興高采烈地跑回家。
He enjoyed the delights of New York's night life. 他喜歡紐約夜生活的樂趣。
I'm delighted that you are back. 你回來了，我很高興。
We were delighted to read your novel. 我們很高興拜讀你的小說。
She delights in her work. 她喜愛她的工作。

other_types: 比較級：more delighted   最高級：most delighted
part_of_speech: adj.: 高興的，快樂的[（+at/with/by）][+to-v][+（that）]；delight的動詞過去式、過去分詞
sentences: My parents will be delighted to see you. 我父母見到你會很高興。
He was very much delighted with the results. 他對這個結果感到非常滿意。

other_types: 過去式：delivered   過去分詞：delivered   現在分詞：delivering
part_of_speech: vt.: 投遞；傳送；運送[（+to）]；給予（打擊等）；發動（進攻）[O]
vi.: 投遞；送貨；傳送；履行，實現[（+on）]
sentences: The mailman delivered the letters promptly. 那個郵差準時地投遞信件。
He delivered an important report at the meeting. 他在會上作了重要報告。
She delivered twins in the evening. 晚上她生了一對雙胞胎。
Education delivered him from ignorance. 教育把他從無知中解救出來。
I am certain that he will deliver on his promise. 我確信他會履行諾言。

part_of_speech: n.: 投遞，傳送[U][C]；交付，交貨[U][C]
sentences: How many deliveries are there in your town every day? 你們城裡每天送幾次信？
We guarantee prompt delivery of goods. 我們保證立即交貨。
delivery of a criminal 引渡罪犯
The mother had a difficult delivery. 那位母親難產。
He has an excellent delivery. 他有極優美的演講風格。

part_of_speech: n.: 要求，請求[C][（+for）]；需要，需求[S][U][（+for）]
vt.: 要求，請求[+to-v][+that][（+of）]；需要
sentences: They rejected the union demand. 他們拒絕了工會的要求。
The supply of vegetables falls short of demand this year. 今年蔬菜供不應求。
The boss demanded that Mary (should) finish it within a week. 老板要求瑪麗在一週內完成它。
They demanded the right to vote. 他們要求選舉權。
What is that? the policeman demanded. 那是什麼？警察盤問道。

part_of_speech: adj.: 苛求的；使人吃力的；高要求的；demand的動詞現在分詞、動名詞

other_types: 過去式：demonstrated   過去分詞：demonstrated   現在分詞：demonstrating
part_of_speech: vt.: 論證，證明[+（that）]；（用實驗，實例等）說明，教[+wh-]
vi.: 示威，舉行遊行示威[（+against）]
sentences: The lawyer demonstrated that the witness was lying. 律師證明證人在說謊。
The doctor demonstrated the harmful effects of tobacco. 醫生用實例說明菸草的有害的影響。
The salesperson demonstrated a new washing machine. 推銷員示範操作新的洗衣機。
This fully demonstrates their willingness to cooperate. 這充分表明他們願意合作。
The workers demonstrated for higher wages. 工人示威要求加薪。

other_types: 過去式：departed   過去分詞：departed   現在分詞：departing
part_of_speech: vi.: 【書】起程，出發；離開，離去[（+from/for）]；背離，違反[（+from）]
sentences: They departed at noon. 他們於中午離開。
He is unwilling to depart from regular practice. 他不願意背離常規。

part_of_speech: n.: （行政，企業等的）部；司；局；處；科；部門[C][G]；（大學的）系[C][G]
sentences: She's the head of the firm's personnel department. 她是公司人事部門的負責人。

part_of_speech: n.: 離開；出發，起程[C][U][（+for）]；背離，違背，變更[C][（+from）]
sentences: The plane's departure was on schedule. 飛機準時起飛。
The new policy represents a complete departure from their previous position. 新政策意味著他們完全背離了以前的立場。

part_of_speech: ph.: 確信; 堅信; 信賴；(能)相信某人/某事物可靠
sentences: I'm depending on you coming. 我肯定你會來的。
You can never depend on his arriving on time. 決不可指望他能準時到達。
You can't depend on the train arriving on time. 千萬不要認為這列火車能正點到達。
She's a woman who can be depended on. 她是個可以信賴的人。
A lot will depend on how she responds to the challenge. 在很大程度上將取決於她對這一難題的反應。
How much is produced depends on how hard we work. 產量的大小在於我們努力的程度。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 依靠，依賴；視……而定[（+on/upon）]；信任，信賴[（+on/upon）]
sentences: We need to reduce our dependence on oil as a source of energy. 在能源方面，我們需減少對石油的依賴。
He's not a man you can put much dependence on. 他不是值得你信賴的人。

other_types: 過去式：deposited   過去分詞：deposited   現在分詞：depositing
part_of_speech: vt.: 放下，放置；寄存[O]；使沉澱；使沉積
vi.: 沉澱
n.: 存款[C]；保證金；押金；定金[C][S1]
sentences: You can deposit your bags at the counter. 你可將皮包存放在櫃臺處。
The river deposited silt at its mouth. 那條河在河口沉積淤泥。
He deposited 5,000 dollars in the bank. 他在銀行存了五千元。
You must pay a deposit if you want to reserve the room. 你要預訂房間，就得先付定金。
The country is short of known deposits of coal. 這個國家缺少已知的煤礦礦床。

part_of_speech: n.: 描寫；敘述；形容[U][C]；（物品）說明書[C]
sentences: He gave a description of what he had seen. 他對看到的情況作了描述。
In the zoo there are animals of every description. 那個動物園裡有各種各樣的動物。

other_types: 過去式：designated   過去分詞：designated   現在分詞：designating
part_of_speech: vt.: 標出；表明；指定；把……定名為，稱呼[（+as）][O9]
adj.: 指定的，選定的[A]
sentences: Churches are designated on the map by crosses. 地圖上教堂以十字形記號標出。
The ruler of a kingdom is designated a king. 王國的統治者稱作國王。
He was designated to lead the expedition. 他被指派率領遠征隊。
the minister designate 部長指定人選

part_of_speech: adj.: 情急拼命的，鋌而走險的；危急的；絕望的；孤注一擲的
sentences: A desperate man will stop at nothing to get what he wants. 一個亡命之徒為了達到自己的目的什麼事都做得出來。
He was desperate when he lost all his money. 當他丟了所有的錢時，他絕望了。
He was desperate for work to provide for a large family. 他渴望有個工作，掙錢供養子女眾多的家。

part_of_speech: n.: 甜點心；餐後甜點[U][C]
sentences: After dinner, we had ice-cream for dessert. 吃過晚飯之後，我們吃冰淇淋作為甜點。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 目的地，終點；目標，目的
sentences: We reached our destination, tired and hungry. 到達目的地時，我們又累又餓。
The destination of her study is medicine. 她打算學醫。

part_of_speech: n.: 細節；詳情；瑣事；枝節[C]；詳述；細部；局部[U]
vt.: 選派，派遣[O2]；詳述，詳細說明
sentences: He can probably tell us all the details we want. 他也許能告訴我們所需的全部詳情。
She began to tell me the plot in great detail. 她開始告訴我該陰謀的詳情。
The man detailed to us all the wonders he had seen in his travels. 那人向我們詳述了他旅途所見之奇事。

part_of_speech: adj.: 詳細的；精細的；複雜的

other_types: 過去式：detected   過去分詞：detected   現在分詞：detecting
part_of_speech: vt.: 發現，察覺；查出，看穿；【無】對……檢波
sentences: I detected anger in her voice. 我察覺出她說話聲裡含著憤怒。
He soon detected the faulty valve. 他很快查到了出毛病的閥門。

part_of_speech: n.: 惡化，變壞；退化；墮落[U]
sentences: mental deterioration 精神衰頹

other_types: 過去式：determined   過去分詞：determined   現在分詞：determining
part_of_speech: vt.: 決定[+to-v][+（that）]；使決定，使下決心[H][O2]
vi.: 決定[（+on）]；【律】終止；判決
sentences: She determined to go that very afternoon. 她決定就在那天下午走。
My mom's encouragement determined me to go on with my study. 我母親的鼓勵使我決心繼續學業。
He was determined to win the game. 他決心要贏得那場比賽。
The court determined that the man was guilty of drunken driving. 法官判決那個人酒醉開車有罪。
They have determined where the new school will be built. 他們已確定這所新的學校將建造在什麼地方。
Demand determines supply. 需求決定供給。

other_types: 比較級：more determined   最高級：most determined
