part_of_speech: adj.: 已下決心的[F][+to-v][+that]；果斷的，決然的，堅定的
sentences: She is determined to finish law school. 她決意在法學院讀到畢業。
a very determined woman 十分堅定的女士

other_types: 過去式：developed   過去分詞：developed   現在分詞：developing
part_of_speech: vt.: 使成長；使發達；發展；詳盡闡述；展開
vi.: 生長；成長；形成；進步；進化
sentences: Swimming develops the muscles. 游泳能使肌肉發達。
The builders are developing that part of the city. 建築商正在開發這座城市的那個地區。
Try to develop good reading habits. 要養成良好的閱讀習慣。
Plants develop from seeds. 植物由種子發育而成。
Her friendship with David developed slowly. 她與大衛的友誼發展緩慢。

part_of_speech: n.: 開發者；顯影劑
n.: 生長；進化；發展；發達[C][U][（+from/into）]；發展（或培育等）的結果；產物[C][（+from/of）]
sentences: The doctor followed the development of the child closely. 醫生仔細觀察這個孩子的成長情況。
This new rose is a development from a very old kind of rose. 這一玫瑰新品種是從一種很老的品種培育出來的。
Have you heard of the latest development in the murder trial? 你有沒有聽到謀殺案審判的最新情況？
Many people live in new housing developments. 許多人住在新建住宅區內。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 設備，儀器，裝置；手段；謀略；詭計
sentences: The television receiver is an electronic device. 電視接收器是一種電子裝置。
She got the information by some device. 她運用某種手段獲取了情報。

other_types: 過去式：diagnosed   過去分詞：diagnosed   現在分詞：diagnosing
part_of_speech: vt.: 診斷
sentences: He is only forty years old, but he has been diagnosed with diabetes. 他才四十歲，但已被診斷出有糖尿病。

part_of_speech: adj.: 差別的；依差別而定的；鑑別性的；獨特的，與眾不同的
n.: （可相比之事物間的）差別[C]；【數】微分[U]
sentences: They pay differential rents according to their income. 他們根據收入多少付級差房租。
differential features 特徵
a differential gear 差動齒輪
differentials in salary 薪資級差
total differential 全微分

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 主管；署長；局長；處長；主任；董事；經理
sentences: the Director of the CIA （美國）中央情報局局長
a board of directors 董事會
Her husband is a film director. 她丈夫是電影導演。
a band director 樂隊指揮

other_types: 過去式：disagreed   過去分詞：disagreed   現在分詞：disagreeing
part_of_speech: vi.: 不一致，不符[（+with）]；意見不合；有分歧[（+with/on）]
sentences: Our answers to the problem disagreed. 我們對這個問題的回答不一致。
We disagreed on which movie to see. 我們對看哪一個電影意見不一致。
The two neighbors disagreed bitterly about their boundary line. 這兩個鄰居在住房界線問題上劇烈爭吵。
Strawberries disagree with me. 我一吃草莓就不舒服。

part_of_speech: n.: 意見不合[U]；爭吵，爭論[C]
sentences: I am in total disagreement with you as to the value of your plan. 對你計畫的價值我的看法與你的完全兩樣。
He had a loud disagreement with his boss. 他和老板大吵了一場。
There was apparent disagreement between their stories. 他們的說法明顯不一致。

part_of_speech: adj.: 使失望的；令人掃興的；不起勁的；disappoint的動詞現在分詞、動名詞

other_types: 過去式：disconnected   過去分詞：disconnected   現在分詞：disconnecting
part_of_speech: vt.: 使分離，分開，斷開[（+from）]；切斷（電話、電源等）
sentences: disconnect a water pipe from the main supply 斷開水管與幹線的連接
The repairman disconnected the television set before fixing it. 修理工在修電視機前先把電源切斷。

part_of_speech: n.[C,U]: 折扣；打折扣；貼現；貼現率
vt.: 將……打折扣；將商品打去……折扣；將……貼現
vi.: 打折扣出售商品；貼現
sentences: We give a special discount of 10 per cent for cash. 如用現金購買，我們給予九折優待。
The author's conclusions must be taken at a discount. 作者的結論我們不應全信。
That store discounts all its slow-selling goods. 那家商店削價出售所有滯銷貨。
You must discount much of what he says. 他說的好些話，你必須打個折扣聽。
In his plans he discounted the expense. 他在計畫中沒有考慮費用。
The price of the stock fell before its dividend was reduced, for the reduction had already been discounted. 股票的價格在股息降低之前下跌，因為股息降低早在預料之中。
Many stores do not discount at all. 許多商店出售商品一概不打折扣。

part_of_speech: n.: 不一致，不符，差異；不一致之處[U][C][（+between/in）]
sentences: There was a discrepancy in the two reports of the accident. 關於那起事故的兩份報導有矛盾之處。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 辨別，區別；識別力，辨別力
sentences: the discrimination between right and wrong 是非的分辨
The furnishings in their house showed taste and discrimination. 他們家的室內陳設顯示了主人的審美力和鑑別力。
Is there racial discrimination in your country? 你們國家是否存在種族歧視？

other_types: 過去式：discussed   過去分詞：discussed   現在分詞：discussing
part_of_speech: vt.: 討論，商談；論述，詳述[（+with）][+wh-]
sentences: They discussed how to promote cooperation between the two countries. 他們討論如何促進兩國間的合作。
Mr. Wood refused to discuss the matter. 伍德先生拒絕討論這件事。

part_of_speech: n.: 討論，商討；談論[C][U][（+about/on/over）]
sentences: We had a discussion on language and communication. 我們就語言和交際問題進行了討論。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 碟，盤；一盤菜；菜餚
vt.: 盛……於盤中；使成碟狀
vi.: 成碟狀
sentences: Mary put the peaches in a white dish. 瑪麗將桃子裝在一個白盤子裡。
Fried eggs are my favorite dish. 煎蛋是我最喜愛的菜餚。
I'll do the dishes tonight. 今晚我洗碗。
Paul's new girl-friend is quite a dish, isn't she? 保羅新交的女友挺性感的，是不是？
She dished the strawberries into the bowl. 她將草莓盛入碗中。

other_types: 過去式：dismissed   過去分詞：dismissed   現在分詞：dismissing
part_of_speech: vt.: 讓……離開；把……打發走[（+from）]；解散，遣散
sentences: He was dismissed from the hospital a week later. 他一週之後出院了。
The teacher dismissed the class on time. 教師按時下課。
He was dismissed from his job. 他被開除了。
She dismissed the idea of going to Paris. 她打消了去巴黎的念頭。
The judge dismissed the case for lack of evidence. 法官因缺乏證據而拒不受理這宗案件。

part_of_speech: adj.: （表示）解僱（或免職、開除）的；表示輕視的

other_types: 過去式：displayed   過去分詞：displayed   現在分詞：displaying
part_of_speech: vt.: 陳列；展出；顯示；表現；顯露
n.: 展覽，陳列；表演[C][U]；陳列品，展覽品[C]
sentences: The cakes were displayed in the window. 糕點陳列在櫥窗中。
He displayed interest in archaeology. 他對考古學有興趣。
Children enjoy a fireworks display. 孩子們喜愛看煙火。
I like the way the displays are arranged in the museum. 我喜歡那個博物館裡展覽品陳列的方式。
He made a display of his learning. 他誇耀自己有學問。

part_of_speech: adj.: 可任意處理的；可自由使用的；用完即丟棄的，一次性使用的

other_types: 過去式：disposed   過去分詞：disposed   現在分詞：disposing
part_of_speech: vt.: 配置，布置[（+for）]；處置，處理；整理
vi.: 處置，處理；（能）決定[（+of）]
sentences: They disposed troops along the river. 他們沿河布置了軍隊。
The good pay disposed him to take the job. 高薪使他接受了這份工作。
I want to dispose of these old books. 我想處理掉這些舊書。
Man proposes, God disposes. 謀事在人，成事在天。

other_types: 過去式：disputed   過去分詞：disputed   現在分詞：disputing
part_of_speech: vi.: 爭論；爭執[（+about/on/over/with/against）]
vt.: 爭論；爭執[+wh-]；對……提出質疑
n.: 爭論；爭執；爭端[C][U][（+about/over/with）]
sentences: The two countries disputed for years over a small strip of land on their border. 這兩個國家為了邊界上一塊土地已經爭執多年。
It is ridiculous to dispute about such things. 爭論這類事情真是可笑。
The couple disputed where to spend the holiday. 夫妻倆為上哪兒度假而發生爭論。
They disputed the election results. 他們對選舉結果提出異議。
The two teams were disputing the cup. 兩隊正在爭奪獎杯。
The dispute was settled last week. 爭端在上週解決了。

part_of_speech: n.: 分裂；崩潰；瓦解；中斷
sentences: The large-scale demonstrations mounted by the students caused a disruption in the city's traffic. 由學生舉行的大型示威造成城市交通的中斷。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有特色的，特殊的
sentences: distinctive features 特點
Soldiers often have distinctive insignias on their lapels. 士兵的翻領上常佩有特殊的軍階識別符號。

other_types: 過去式：distinguished   過去分詞：distinguished   現在分詞：distinguishing
part_of_speech: vt.: 區別；識別[（+from）]；（憑感覺器官）辨認出
vi.: 區別；識別；辨別[（+between）]
sentences: He can distinguish a genuine antique from a reproduction. 他能區別真正的古董與複製品。
I can distinguish my roommates by their footsteps. 我能根據室友的腳步聲辨認出他們。
She distinguished herself as an African American lawyer. 她成了一位傑出的黑人律師。
It is certainly important to distinguish between right and wrong. 明辨是非當然要緊。

other_types: 過去式：distributed   過去分詞：distributed   現在分詞：distributing
part_of_speech: vt.: 分發；分配[（+to/among）]；散布，分布[（+over）]
sentences: They had distributed the lands among the peasants. 他們把土地分給農民。
This species of butterfly is widely distributed over our country. 這種蝴蝶在我國分布很廣。
The teacher distributed the pupils into three groups. 老師把學生分成三組。

part_of_speech: n.: 分發；分配；配給物[U][C]；分布；（生物的）分布區域[U][S1]
sentences: They could not agree about the distribution of the profits. 他們無法就利潤分配一事達成協議。
The pine-tree has a very wide distribution. 松樹的分布區域極廣。
the distribution of news 新聞的傳播
We have a good product but our distribution is bad. 我們的產品很好，但銷售情況不佳。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 【數】被除數；【經】紅利；股息
sentences: The company declared a large dividend at the end of the year. 公司在年底宣布紅利甚豐。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 公文，文件；證件，單據
sentences: She carefully filed all the documents. 她將全部文件仔細地整理歸檔。

other_types: 過去式：donated   過去分詞：donated   現在分詞：donating
part_of_speech: vt.: 捐獻，捐贈[（+to）]
n.: 捐獻，捐贈[（+to/towards）]
sentences: She donated her books to the library. 她把自己的書捐贈給圖書館。

part_of_speech: n.[(: 捐獻，捐贈[U][C]；捐款；捐贈物[C]
sentences: She made a donation of $5,000 to the Children's Hospital. 她捐了五千美元給兒童醫院。

part_of_speech: a.[Z]: 兩倍的；加倍的；雙的；成雙的；雙層的
adv.: 雙倍地；加倍地；雙重地
n.: 兩倍（數或量），加倍[C][U]；酷似的人或物[C]
vt.: 使加倍；是……的兩倍；把……對摺[（+back/over）]；握緊（拳頭）
vi.: 變成兩倍；增加一倍；（橋牌）叫加倍
sentences: I'll give you double pay for working overtime. 你加班我付你雙倍工錢。
We reserved a double room. 我們訂了一間雙人房。
The date had a double significance. 那個日子有雙重意義。
That man has a double tongue. 那人說話不老實。
Be double careful when you cross the street. 你過街時要加倍小心。
We used to ride double on Nancy's horse. 我們過去常常兩人同騎南茜的馬。
His pay is the double of mine. 他的薪資是我的兩倍。
John is the double of his father. 約翰長得酷似他父親。
Two doubles were employed for this scene. 拍這個場面僱用了兩個替角。
The population of Japan doubles that of Canada. 日本的人口是加拿大的兩倍。
He doubled his slice of bread to make a sandwich. 他將一片麵包對摺做成三明治。
The child birthrate in that area has doubled. 該地區的嬰兒出生率已經增加了一倍。
The fox doubled back to avoid capture. 狐狸順原路折回以避免被捕獲。
Mary, who played the part of the dancer, doubled as her mother. 扮演舞蹈家的瑪麗同時兼演她的媽媽。

part_of_speech: vt.: 【電腦】下載

other_types: 過去式：downsized   過去分詞：downsized   現在分詞：downsizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 以較小尺寸設計或製造；裁減（員工）人數
n.: 向下彎曲；降低；（經濟）衰退，下降
adj.: 向下的，下降的[B]；日趨沒落的
adv.: 向下；日趨沒落地
sentences: prices with a downward tendency 趨向下降的價格
He looked downward to avoid my eyes. 他低著頭看，以避開我的目光。

part_of_speech: adj.: 戲劇的；劇本的；戲劇般的；戲劇性的；充滿激情的
sentences: give dramatic performances 演出戲劇
dramatic changes in the international situation 國際形勢的戲劇性變化

part_of_speech: adj.: 激烈的，猛烈的；嚴厲的；極端的
sentences: drastic measures to cure inflation 處理通貨膨脹的嚴厲措施

part_of_speech: adv.: 大大地；徹底地；激烈地

other_types: 過去式：drew   過去分詞：drawn   現在分詞：drawing
part_of_speech: vt.: 劃，畫，繪製，描寫；拉，拖；拉長，拖長
vi.: 劃線；畫圖；漸漸移動；行駛[Q]
n.[C]: 平局，平手；抽籤
sentences: I think it's very well drawn. 我認為畫得很好。
Mary drew a house on the paper. 瑪麗在紙上畫了一棟房子。
The cart was drawn by two horses. 大車由兩匹馬拉著。
He drew the cork from the bottle. 他把瓶口的軟木塞拔了出來。
I'll draw some money from my account. 我要提取一些存款。
Her shouts drew the attention of the police. 她的喊叫引起了警察的注意。
They drew the same conclusion. 他們得出了同樣的結論。
He managed to draw her out. 他設法使她把話講出來。
She draws well. 她很會畫畫。
The car drew near. 汽車開近了。
The two teams drew. 這兩個隊打成平局。
The film drew well. 那部電影很賣座。
The game ended in a draw. 比賽以平局結束。
She is always a great draw at social parties. 她在社交聚會上總是引人矚目。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 抽屜；內褲[P]
sentences: I put it in the left-hand drawer. 我將它放在左手的抽屜內。

part_of_speech: n.: 駕車旅行；（開車）兜風；車程[C]；（私人住宅的）車道，汽車路[C]
vt.: 駕駛（汽車等）；用車送（人）[O]
vi.: 開車；（風，雨）狂吹猛打；疾馳
sentences: We went for a drive in the afternoon. 我們下午開車出去兜風。
We saw a red car parked on his drive. 我們看到一輛紅色轎車停在他的私人車道上。
The manager decided to launch a sales drive. 經理決定展開一次促銷活動。
He was dominated by an insatiable drive for fame. 他被一種難以滿足的成名慾支配著。
He is a man of great drive. 他是一個幹勁十足的人。
I don't know how to drive a carriage. 我不會駕馬車。
He'll drive us to the airport. 他會開車送我們去機場。
He drove the sheep up the hill. 他把羊群往山上趕。
The machine is driven by electricity. 這機器用電力驅動。
We first drove the stakes into the ground. 我們首先把樁打入地裡。
The farmers drove wells to water the crops. 農民打井灌溉莊稼。
He drove her to admit it. 他逼迫她承認。
He was driven by necessity to steal. 他迫不得已而偷竊。
It is dangerous to drive after drinking. 酒後開車危險。
The rain was driving in our faces. 大雨猛打著我們的臉。

part_of_speech: n.: （一）滴[C]；點滴，微量[C]
vt.: 使滴下；丟下，扔下；降低
vi.: 滴下；落下；掉下；（價格，溫度等）下降；（聲音，風等）變弱
sentences: The rain was leaking in large drops through the roof. 雨正大滴大滴地從屋頂漏下來。
The drop in prices was quite unexpected. 價格的下跌是完全沒有料到的。
They are requesting air drops of foodstuffs to the flooded areas. 他們要求對洪災地區空投食品。
She dropped some lemon juice into her tea. 她在茶裡滴了幾滴檸檬汁。
I dropped the letter into the mail-box. 我將信投入信箱。
Please drop me at the school gate. 請讓我在校門口下車。
If a fire alarm is given, drop whatever you are doing, and leave the building at once. 如遇火警，立即停止手頭的一切工作，馬上離開建築物。
He's been dropped from the boxing team. 他已被拳擊隊除名。
He dropped me a hint over dinner. 我們一起吃飯時他給了我暗示。
He dropped a whole line in typing. 他打字時漏了整整一行。
She dropped acid in high school. 她高中時代服迷幻藥。
A flower pot dropped from his balcony. 一個花盆從他家陽臺落下。
The temperature has dropped drastically. 氣溫已大大下降。
I'd like to drop in and see you sometime next week. 我想在下週什麼時候順便來看看你。
He dropped with overwork. 他因過度工作累倒了。

part_of_speech: adj.: （色彩等）不鮮明的，晦暗的；無光澤的；不明顯的，隱約的，模糊的
vt.: 弄鈍；使遲鈍；使陰暗
vi.: 變得遲鈍；（興趣，痛苦等）減少；減輕
sentences: He had a dull pain in the chest. 他胸部隱隱作痛。
It's very dull today but I don't think it'll rain. 今天天氣很陰暗，但我認為不會下雨。
The story is dull. 這個故事乏味得很。
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy. 只工作不玩耍，聰明孩子也變傻。
His hearing was dulled by age. 他的聽覺因上了年紀而變得遲鈍了。

part_of_speech: n.: （時間的）持續，持久；持續期間[U]
sentences: for the duration of the war 在整個戰爭期間
The duration of the examination is three hours. 考試時間為三個小時。

part_of_speech: adj.: 免稅的
adv.: 免稅地

other_types: 過去式：earned   過去分詞：earned   現在分詞：earning
part_of_speech: vt.: 賺得，掙得；博得，贏得
sentences: How much do you earn a week? 你一週賺多少錢？
His achievements earned him respect and admiration. 他的成就贏得人們的尊敬和仰慕。

part_of_speech: n.[K]: 收入，薪資；利潤，收益
sentences: You must show your annual earnings in the tax form. 你必須在稅單上注明你的年收入。

part_of_speech: adj.: 經濟的，節約的；節儉的
sentences: This car is economical to run because it doesn't use much fuel. 開這輛車省錢，因為它耗油不多。
be economical of time and energy 節省時間和精力
She is an economical housewife. 她是個節儉的家庭主婦。

other_types: 過去式：economized   過去分詞：economized   現在分詞：economizing
part_of_speech: vi.: 節約，節省[（+on）]
vt.: 節約，節省
sentences: He economized by using buses instead of taking taxis. 他不坐計程車而改乘公車以節省錢。
We have to economize on water during the dry season. 我們在旱季不得不節約用水。

part_of_speech: n.: 節約，節省[C][U]；經濟；經濟情況；經濟結構[U][C]
adj.: 廉價的；經濟的
sentences: The employees of the firm practised economy in doing everything. 該公司的僱員做任何事都勵行節約。
The nation's economy is growing rapidly. 這個國家的經濟在快速增長。

other_types: 比較級：more effective   最高級：most effective
part_of_speech: adj.: 有效的[（+against/in）][+to-v]；（法律等）生效的，起作用的[Z]
n.: 實際可作戰的部隊（或士兵）[P]
sentences: Window screens are effective in keeping out mosquitoes. 紗窗能有效地擋住蚊子。
A bill passed by congress becomes effective as soon as the President signs it. 國會通過的法案一經總統簽署立即生效。
That's rather an effective use of color. 那樣使用顏色效果甚佳。
Although there is a parliament, the army is in effective control of the country. 雖然有議會存在，但軍隊實際上控制著這個國家。

part_of_speech: adv.: 有效地；生效地；實際上
sentences: They attempted to make the system work more effectively. 他們試圖使該系統工作得更有效。
Effectively, their response was a refusal. 實際上，他們的答覆是一種拒絕。

part_of_speech: n.: 有效；有力
n.[U]: 效率；效能；功效；【物】效率
sentences: These machines have increased our work efficiency many times. 這些機器使我們的工作效率提高了許多倍。

other_types: 比較級：more efficient   最高級：most efficient
part_of_speech: adj.: 效率高的；有能力的，能勝任的[（+in）]；（直接）生效的；有效的；收效大的
sentences: He is an efficient manager. 他是一位辦事效率高的經理。
It is not efficient to hire poorly trained workers. 僱用未經嚴格訓練的工人會妨礙工作效率。

part_of_speech: adv.: 效率高地；有效地
sentences: You should work more efficiently. 你得工作得更有效率。

part_of_speech: adj.: 年長的；上了年紀的[R]；老式的，過時的
sentences: Who will take care of the elderly? 誰來照料上了年紀的人？
My father is rather elderly now and can't walk very fast. 我的父親挺老了，走路走不快。

part_of_speech: adj.: 與電有關的，電氣科學的；電的；用電的
sentences: He is an electrical engineer. 他是個電氣工程師。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 【美】電梯；升降機；起重機，起卸機
sentences: Many department stores have both elevators and escalators. 許多百貨公司既有電梯又有自動扶梯。

other_types: 過去式：embarked   過去分詞：embarked   現在分詞：embarking
part_of_speech: vi.: 上船（或飛機等）；從事，著手[（+on/in/upon）]
vt.: 使上船（或飛機等）；裝載；使從事，使著於[H]
sentences: We embarked on a cruiser. 我們登上一艘遊艇。
They embarked on a campaign to get people to vote. 他們展開一場動員人們投票的運動。
The ship embarked passengers and cargo. 那艘船載上乘客，裝上貨物。
We are already embarked on a new course. 我們已開始踏上一條新的道路。
He embarked his fortune in trade. 他把財產投資做生意。

part_of_speech: n.: 緊急情況；突然事件；非常時刻[U][C]
sentences: In an emergency, call 119. 遇有緊急情況，請打119。

other_types: 過去式：emphasized   過去分詞：emphasized   現在分詞：emphasizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 強調，著重[+that][+wh-]；加強……的語氣
sentences: The speaker emphasized what he was saying by waving his hands. 發言人揮舞雙手強調他所說的。
My boss emphasized that everyone should come on time. 我的老板強調指出每個人都該準時到。
emphasize one's eyes with mascara 塗睫毛油以使眼廓分明

other_types: 過去式：emphasized   過去分詞：emphasized   現在分詞：emphasizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 強調，著重[+that][+wh-]；加強……的語氣
sentences: The speaker emphasized what he was saying by waving his hands. 發言人揮舞雙手強調他所說的。
My boss emphasized that everyone should come on time. 我的老板強調指出每個人都該準時到。
emphasize one's eyes with mascara 塗睫毛油以使眼廓分明

other_types: 過去式：employed   過去分詞：employed   現在分詞：employing
part_of_speech: vt.: 僱用[（+as）][O2]；使用，利用
n.: 僱用；使用[U]
sentences: The mill employs a thousand workers. 這家工廠僱用了一千名工人。
How do you employ your spare time? 你是怎樣利用你的空餘時間的？
The children were employed in painting. 孩子們忙於畫畫兒。
The children employed themselves in painting. 孩子們忙於畫畫兒。

part_of_speech: n.: 受僱者，僱工，僱員，從業員工[C][（+of）]
sentences: The firm has 1000 employees. 這家公司有一千名員工。

part_of_speech: n.: 僱主，僱用者[C]
sentences: The university is a major employer in the area. 該大學是這一地區的大僱主。

part_of_speech: n.: 僱用；受僱[U]；職業，工作[U]
sentences: A large office requires the employment of many people. 一個大事務所需要僱用許多人。
He found employment as a mechanic. 他找到了一份機修工的工作。
The employment of airplanes sped up delivery. 使用飛機加快了投遞的速度。
Picnicking is a pleasant employment for our holidays. 遠足是我們假日喜愛的活動。

other_types: 過去式：enabled   過去分詞：enabled   現在分詞：enabling
part_of_speech: vt.: 使能夠；賦予……能力[O2]；使成為可能
sentences: Training will enable you to find work. 培訓將使你找到工作。
The program will enable a large increase in student numbers. 這一計畫能使學生人數大量增加。

other_types: 過去式：enclosed   過去分詞：enclosed   現在分詞：enclosing
part_of_speech: vt.: 圍住；圈起；關閉住[H][（+with/by）]；把（公文，票據等）封入
sentences: The palace is enclosed by a high wall. 皇宮為高牆圍住。
A white fence enclosed the house. 房子周圍有一圈白色的籬笆。
A check is enclosed herewith. 隨信附寄支票一張。

other_types: 過去式：encouraged   過去分詞：encouraged   現在分詞：encouraging
part_of_speech: vt.: 鼓勵；慫恿[O2]；促進，助長；激發
sentences: She encouraged him to talk to her. 她鼓勵他與她交談。
Don't encourage her laziness by doing things for her. 別替她做事，這會助長她的懶惰。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 忍耐，耐久力；持久（力）；耐久（力）
sentences: He came to the end of his endurance. 他忍無可忍了。
Running the marathon tests a person's endurance. 馬拉松賽跑考驗人的耐力。

other_types: 過去式：endured   過去分詞：endured   現在分詞：enduring
part_of_speech: vt.: 忍耐，忍受；（常與cannot等否定詞連用）容忍[+to-v][+v-ing]
vi.: 忍耐，忍受；持久，持續
sentences: The old man had to endure a toothache. 這位老人不得不忍受牙痛。
I could endure it no longer. 我對此再也無法忍受了。
I can't endure to see/seeing you so discouraged. 我不忍看到你如此頹喪。
They vowed their love would endure forever. 他們海誓山盟地久天長。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 工程師，技師；機械工；輪機手
vt.: 精明地處理；操縱；策劃；設計；建造[H]
vi.: 設計，建造
sentences: She engineered the whole thing from start to finish. 這事從頭至尾都是她策劃的。

part_of_speech: n.: 工程；工程學[U]；engineer的動詞現在分詞、動名詞
sentences: genetic engineering 生物遺傳工程（學）
civil engineering 土木工程（學）

other_types: 過去式：enhanced   過去分詞：enhanced   現在分詞：enhancing
part_of_speech: vt.: 提高，增加（價值，品質，吸引力等）
sentences: Beautiful coloured illustrations enhanced the book. 漂亮的彩色插圖使這本書更具吸引力。

other_types: 過去式：enrolled   過去分詞：enrolled   現在分詞：enrolling
part_of_speech: vt.: 把……記入名冊，登記（名字等）；使入會；使入學，招（生）；使入伍，徵（兵）
vi.: 記入名冊，被登記；入會，參加；入學，註冊；入伍，應徵
sentences: The secretary enrolled our names. 祕書登記了我們的名字。
The school will enroll new students in August. 這所學校將於八月份招收新生。
They enrolled us as members of the club. 他們將我們吸收為該俱樂部會員。
All contestants must enroll by Saturday. 所有參賽者必須在星期六前登記。
She enrolled in the literature course. 她註冊學習文學課程。

other_types: 過去式：ensured   過去分詞：ensured   現在分詞：ensuring
part_of_speech: vt.: 保證；擔保[O9][+that][+v-ing]；使安全，保護[Q][（+from/against）]
sentences: I can't ensure his being on time. 我不能保證他的準時。
I can't ensure that he will be there on time. 我不能擔保他會及時到那兒。
These are safety devices to ensure workers against accidents. 這些安全設施是為了保護工人不出事故。

part_of_speech: n.: （有一定冒險性的）事業[C]；冒險精神；進取心，事業心[U]
sentences: Tom is a man of great enterprise. 湯姆很有進取精神。
This enterprise is doing a good business. 這家企業生意興隆。

other_types: 比較級：more enthusiastic   最高級：most enthusiastic
part_of_speech: adj.: 熱情的；熱烈的；熱心的[（+about/over/at）]
sentences: David is very enthusiastic about the plan. 大衛對該項計畫十分熱心。
They are enthusiastic admirers of that movie star. 他們是那位電影明星的狂熱崇拜者。

part_of_speech: adv.: 熱心地；滿腔熱情地
n.: 應得的權利；津貼
n.: 【法】入場權；【美】主菜
n.: 環境；四周狀況[C][S1]；自然環境；生態環境[the S]
sentences: Children need a happy home environment. 孩子們需要愉快的家庭環境。
It is highly important to preserve the environment. 維護自然環境至關重要。

part_of_speech: adj.: 環境的；有關環境（保護）的
adj.: 相等的，相同的[（+to）]；等價的，等值的；等量的；等效的[（+to）]
n.[C]: 相等物；等價物[（+of/to）]；同義字[（+of/for）]
sentences: His reply is equivalent to a refusal. 他的回答等於是拒絕。
A meter is equivalent to 39.37 inches. 一米相當於三十九點三七英寸。
A dime is the equivalent of two nickels. 一角硬幣等於兩個五分鎳幣。
Some English words have no Chinese equivalents. 有些英文字在中文裡沒有對應的詞。

part_of_speech: adj.: 必要的，不可缺的[（+to/for）]；本質的，實質的；基本的[B]
n.[P]: 要素，要點；必需品；本質，實質
sentences: Hard work is essential to success. 成功必須努力工作。
There is no essential difference between the two drafts. 兩份草稿沒有本質上的不同。
Our course deals with the essentials of management. 我們的課程講述管理的基本要點。

other_types: 過去式：estimated   過去分詞：estimated   現在分詞：estimating
part_of_speech: vt.: 估計，估量[（+at）][O2][+（that）]；評價；判斷
vi.: 估計；估價[（+for）]
n.[C]: 估計；估價；估計數；（承包人的）估價單
sentences: The police estimated the number of demonstrators at about 5,000. 警方估計示威者的人數為五千左右。
The medicare cost is estimated to be one billion dollars. 老年醫療保健費用估計為十億美元。
I asked a contractor to estimate for the repair of the house. 我請了承包商估計修繕這幢房子的費用。
The expert's estimate is that the painting is worth one million. 專家估計這幅畫值一百萬元。
My estimate of the situation is not so optimistic. 我對形勢的估計不那麼樂觀。

other_types: 過去式：evaluated   過去分詞：evaluated   現在分詞：evaluating
part_of_speech: vt.: 估……的價；對……評價；為……鑑定
n.: 事件，大事[C]；（比賽）項目[C]
sentences: Winning the scholarship was a great event in the boy's life. 贏得這項獎學金是這個男孩一生中的一件大事。
Which events have you entered for? 你參加了哪些比賽項目？

part_of_speech: n.: 證據；證詞；證人；物證[U][（+of/for）][+that][+to-v]；跡象[U][C][（+of）][+（that）]
vt.: 證明；顯示，表明
sentences: He was punished for giving false evidence. 他因作偽證而受到懲罰。
The evidence is very shaky. 這證據相當靠不住。
There are evidences that somebody has been living here. 有跡象顯示有人一直住在這裡。

other_types: 過去式：evolved   過去分詞：evolved   現在分詞：evolving
part_of_speech: vt.: 使逐步形成；發展，展開；【生】進化形成；發育成
vi.: 逐步形成；發展；進化；成長[（+from/into）]
sentences: How did you evolve this very personal and original style? 你是怎樣逐步形成這種很有個性且具獨創性的風格的？
We had to evolve the truth from a mass of confused evidence. 我們不得不從大量龐雜的證據中推斷出事情的真相。
Scientists think that birds probably evolved from reptiles. 科學家認為，鳥很可能是由爬行動物進化而來的。
The simple plan evolved into a complicated scheme. 這個簡單的計畫發展成了一項複雜的規劃。

other_types: 形變：exacter, more exact,exactest, most exact
part_of_speech: adj.: 確切的，精確的；精確無誤的，精密的
vt.: 強要；勒索；急需，需要
sentences: It was difficult to tell her exact age. 很難說出她的確實年齡。
The scholar is an exact thinker. 這位學者思維嚴謹。
The kidnappers exacted ransoms for their hostages. 綁匪勒索人質的贖金。

part_of_speech: n.: 檢查，調查[C][U][（+into/of）]；考試[C][（+in/on）]
sentences: A close examination of the butterfly showed that it had four wings. 仔細察看蝴蝶發現它有兩對翅膀。
The teacher gave us an examination in history. 教師對我們進行了歷史考試。
The examination of all the witnesses took a week. 對證人的訊問進行了一個星期。

other_types: 過去式：examined   過去分詞：examined   現在分詞：examining
part_of_speech: vt.: 檢查；細查；診察；審問；盤問[（+on）]
vi.: 檢查，調查
sentences: The doctor examined the boy and found there was nothing the matter with him. 醫生檢查了男孩的身體發現他是健康的。
The lawyer examined the witness. 律師訊問了證人。
The teacher examined the students in physics. 教師考學生物理。

other_types: 過去式：excelled   過去分詞：excelled   現在分詞：excelling
part_of_speech: vt.: 勝過，優於[（+in/at）]
vi.: 突出；勝過他人[（+in/at）]
sentences: She excels the rest of the class in English. 她的英文在班上勝過任何同學。
He excels at volleyball. 他擅長打排球。

part_of_speech: adj.: 出色的；傑出的；優等的[Z]
sentences: He is excellent in mathematics. 他的數學非常好。
Of course she is an excellent doctor. 當然她是位傑出的醫生。

part_of_speech: n.: 遠足；短途旅行[C]；遠足隊，遊覽團[C]
sentences: We are planning for our excursion next week. 我們正在為下週的遠足作準備。
We took the weekend excursion to the seashore. 週末我們去海濱遊玩了。
Your comments are an excursion from the major theme. 你的話偏離了主題。
excursion from the major theme 偏離主題

part_of_speech: adj.: 執行的；實施的；經營管理的；行政上的；行政部門的
n.: 執行者；行政官；高級官員[C]；經理；業務主管[C]
sentences: He is on the executive committee. 他是該執行委員會委員。
The US Constitution vests the executive power in the President. 美國憲法將行政權賦予總統。
The President of the U.S. is the chief executive. 美國總統是最高行政官。
The CEO is usually the top executive of a company. 總經理通常是一家公司的最高主管。

other_types: 過去式：exhibited   過去分詞：exhibited   現在分詞：exhibiting
part_of_speech: vt.: 展示，陳列；表示，顯出
vi.: 舉辦展示會；展出產品（或作品等）
n.[C]: 展示品，陳列品；【律】證據，證件，物證
sentences: Why don't you exhibit his portrait? 你為什麼不展出他的畫像？
She exhibited no fear in the face of danger. 她面對危險毫無懼色。
Do not touch the exhibits. 不要觸摸展示品。
This week there's an exhibit of Chinese paintings at the art gallery. 本星期在美術館舉辦中國畫展。

other_types: 過去式：expanded   過去分詞：expanded   現在分詞：expanding
part_of_speech: vt.: 展開，張開（帆，翅等）；使膨脹；使擴張
vi.: 展開，張開；擴張；發展；增長
sentences: The eagle expanded its wings. 老鷹展開翅膀。
He is thinking of expanding his business. 他正考慮擴展他的生意。
They have expanded my view on the question. 他們已更充分地闡明了我對這個問題的觀點。
In ten years the city's population expanded by 12%. 十年之中，該城人口增加了百分之十二。
Water expands when it freezes. 水結冰時體積膨脹。
A tire expands when you pump air into it. 輪胎打了氣就會脹大。
My father expanded a little when he had had a drink, and started to talk more freely. 我父親小酌之後，就變得開朗可親些，話也說得多了。
Her face expanded in a smile. 她笑逐顏開。

part_of_speech: n.: 擴展；擴張；膨脹[U]；擴大物[C]
sentences: The new factory is large, to allow room for expansion. 新工廠很大，有地方可以擴展。
The suburbs are an expansion of cities. 郊區是城市的延伸。

other_types: 過去式：expected   過去分詞：expected   現在分詞：expecting
part_of_speech: vt.: 預計……可能發生（或來到）；預料；預期[+（that）][+to-v][O2]；期待；等待；盼望
vi.: 期待；預期；（用進行式）懷孕，懷胎
sentences: He expected to finish the work by March. 他預期三月份完成這項工作。
We expected that you would succeed. 我們預計你會成功的。
That's just what we expected. 那正是我們所期望的。
I'll expect you for supper at six o'clock. 我六點等你吃晚飯。
Don't expect too much of him. 別對他期望過高。
I expect you to be punctual. 我要求你準時。
I expect you are right. 我想你是對的。
Mary is expecting. 瑪麗懷孕了。

part_of_speech: n.: 期待；預期[U][C]；期望，預期的事物[P1]
sentences: The dog wagged its tail in expectation of a bone. 那條狗搖著尾巴，巴望吃肉骨頭。
The reward fell short of our expectations. 獎勵不符我們的希望。
a young artist with great expectations 有遠大前程的青年藝術家

part_of_speech: n.: 消費；支出；用光[U][（+on）]；支出額；經費[U][C]
sentences: Training a dog requires the expenditure of time and effort. 訓練一條狗需化時間和精力。
My expenditures this week amount to $100. 這星期我花了一百元錢。

part_of_speech: n.: 費用；價錢；支出；消耗[S]；開支；經費[P]
sentences: I don't think we can afford the expense. 我認為我們負擔不了這個費用。
He said the office expenses were too big. 他認為辦公室的花費太大了。

other_types: 比較級：more expensive   最高級：most expensive
part_of_speech: adj.: 高價的；昂貴的；花錢的[+to-v]
sentences: Your dress must have been expensive. 你的衣服一定很貴。
It is expensive to stay in that hotel. 住那家旅館很貴。

part_of_speech: n.: 經驗，體驗[U][（+of/in）]；經歷，閱歷[C]
vt.: 經歷；體驗；感受；遭受
sentences: She had no experience of life at all. 她毫無生活經驗。
Have you had any experience of teaching English? 你有過教英語的經驗嗎？
Please tell us about your experiences in Africa. 請跟我們談談你在非洲的經歷。
I had a rather odd experience the other day. 前些天我有過一次相當奇怪的經歷。
The city experienced over 2,000 such incidents last year. 去年這座城市發生過二千次以上這類事件。
He experienced a pang of sadness. 他感到一陣悲痛。

other_types: 比較級：more experienced   最高級：most experienced
part_of_speech: adj.: 有經驗的；老練的；熟練的[（+in/at）]；experience的動詞過去式、過去分詞
sentences: He is very experienced in/at repairing cars. 他修車很有經驗。
She is an experienced cook. 她是個經驗豐富的廚師。

part_of_speech: n.: 實驗；試驗[C][U][（+on）]
vi.: 進行實驗，試驗[（+on/with）]
sentences: Some people learn by experiment and others learn by experience. 一些人透過實驗學習，另一些人則從經驗中學習。
He is experimenting with drugs to cure hepatitis. 他正在試驗治療肝炎的藥。
Have they ever experimented on a large number of patients? 他們可曾在大批病人身上實驗過？

part_of_speech: n.[U: 勘查；探測；探索；探究；調查；研究
sentences: Spain began the exploration of the New World. 西班牙開始了對新世界的探索。
a full exploration of all the possibilities 對各種可能性的充分調查研究

other_types: 過去式：explored   過去分詞：explored   現在分詞：exploring
part_of_speech: vt.: 探測；探勘；在……探險；探究，探索
vi.: 探索；考察；探勘；探險
sentences: They explored this desert region in 1923. 他們於一九二三年在這荒漠地區探險。
The conference explored the possibility of closer trade links. 大會探討了在貿易上進一步加強聯繫的可能性。

other_types: 過去式：expressed   過去分詞：expressed   現在分詞：expressing
part_of_speech: vt.: 表達，陳述；表示[+wh-]；特快發送，快運；快遞
n.: 快車[C]；快遞；快運[U]
adj.: 快遞的，快運的；明確的，明白表示的
adv.: 用快遞；由直達快車；特意地；專門地
sentences: Really, I hardly know how to express my gratitude. 我真不知道如何表達我的感激之情。
The doctor expressed poison from her wound. 醫生把毒液從她的傷口擠了出來。
Please send this parcel by express delivery. 請用快遞寄送這個包裹。
The doctor gave express orders that the patient was to have no visitors. 醫生明確囑咐，那個病人不可會客。
We took an express bus home. 我們乘特快公車回家。
They painted the house for the express purpose of selling it. 他們專為賣房而油漆房子。
Please send the parcel express. 請以快遞方式寄這個包裹。

other_types: 過去式：extended   過去分詞：extended   現在分詞：extending
part_of_speech: vt.: 延長，延伸；擴大，擴展；伸，伸出
vi.: 伸展；擴大；延續
sentences: Can't you extend your visit for a few days? 你們訪問的時間不能延長幾天嗎？
He extended his hand in greeting. 他伸出手來表示歡迎。
I would like to extend a warm welcome to our visitors. 我想對我們的來訪者表示熱烈的歡迎。
The tourist season extends from May till October. 旅遊季節從五月延續到十月。

part_of_speech: n.: 伸展；伸長；擴大[U][（+of）]；延長；延期；緩期[U][C]
sentences: the extension of our foreign trade 擴大我們的對外貿易
We had hoped for the extension of the deadline to the end of the week. 我們曾希望把最後期限延至週末。
We built an extension to our house. 我們擴建了我家的房屋。

part_of_speech: adj.: 外面的，外部的；外界的，外來的
n.: 外形，外觀；形式；外表狀況[P]
sentences: They did it in response to external pressures. 他們這麼做是迫於外界的壓力。
She sets great store by external politeness. 她很注重表面的虛禮。
This medicine is for external use only. 這種藥僅限於外用。
Our external trade has expanded during recent years. 我國的對外貿易近幾年來有所發展。
It is unwise to judge people by externals. 以貌取人是不明智的。

part_of_speech: n.: 能力；技能[U][S1][（+in/with）]；容易，簡易[U]
sentences: He has great facility in learning languages. 他很有學習語言的才能。
She had no cooking facilities in the room. 她房間裡沒有燒煮設備。
The offender was sent to a correctional facility. 罪犯被送到教養院。
He writes with facility. 他寫作流利。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 因素；要素[（+in）]；係數；【數】因子，商；【生】遺傳因子，基因
vt.: 分解……的因子；把……分解成[（+into）]；把……作為因素計入[（+into/in）]
vi.: 做代理商
sentences: He analyzed the various factors. 他分析了各種因素。
2 and 5 are factors of 10. 二和五是十的因子。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 工廠，製造廠；（商行在國外的）代理處
sentences: They are factory workers. 他們是工廠工人。

other_types: 過去式：failed   過去分詞：failed   現在分詞：failing
part_of_speech: n.[C]: 不及格
vi.: 失敗；不及格
vt.: 失敗；不能；忘記[Y][+to-v]；沒有通過（考試），評定（學生）不及格
sentences: a fail in math 數學不及格
Our plan has failed. 我們的計畫失敗了。
He failed in everything he tried. 他做一切事情都失敗了。
She failed in the examination. 她這次考試不及格。
The engine failed. 引擎出故障了。
His hearing is failing. 他的聽覺在衰退。
Many small banks failed during the recession. 許多小銀行在經濟衰退期破了產。
The crops failed for two years running. 農作物連續兩年歉收。
He did very well, but failed to break the record. 他做得很出色，但未破記錄。
The professor failed almost half of the class. 該教授給班上幾乎一半人評了不及格。
George failed history last semester. 喬治上學期歷史考試不及格。
His courage failed him. 他失去了勇氣。
His friends failed him when he needed their help most. 當他最需要幫助的時候，他的朋友們卻辜負了他。

part_of_speech: n.: 失敗[U][（+in）]；失敗者；不及格者；失敗的嘗試（或經驗）[C]
sentences: He was doomed to failure. 他注定要失敗。
The new restaurant was a failure and soon closed. 那家新飯店經營無方，不久便關了門。
Failure to obey orders on a ship is mutiny. 在船上不執行命令就是嘩變。
The drought caused crop failure. 乾旱造成農作物歉收。
She died of (a) heart failure. 她死於心臟衰竭。
There were many bank failures during the depression. 經濟蕭條時期許多銀行破產。
He was upset by his failure in the exam. 他因考試不及格而感到沮喪。

part_of_speech: adj.: 公正的；公平的；誠實的；尚可的，一般的；相當的[Z]
adv.: 公平地，公正地；正面地，直接地
n.: 【舊】女人；美女；情人；美好的事物
sentences: That's a fair comment. 那是公正的評價。
His knowledge of English is fair. 他的英語尚可。
She had fair hair and skin. 她有金色的頭髮，白皙的皮膚。
The weather will be fair today. 今天天氣會很晴朗。
I trusted his fair promises. 我輕信了他那些花言巧語的允諾。
It's a fair miracle. 這簡直是奇蹟。
You must play fair. 你必須公平行事。
The ball hit him fair in the head. 球不偏不倚正中他的頭部。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有名的；著名的[（+for）]；fame的動詞過去式、過去分詞
sentences: a famed holiday resort 著名的度假勝地
This area is famed for its natural beauty. 這地區以其大自然的美景而著名。

part_of_speech: n.: （交通工具的）票價，車（船）費[C]；（計程車等的）乘客[C]
vi.: 過活；遭遇；進展[Q]；吃，進食
sentences: She didn't have enough money for the bus fare. 她的錢不夠付車費。
The taxi-driver stopped to pick up a fare. 計程車司機停下車來搭載一名乘客。
He fared better in the second test. 他第二次考試頗有進步。
They fared simply. 他們吃得很簡單。

part_of_speech: n.: 缺點，毛病，缺陷[C]；錯誤[C]
vt.: （通常用於疑問句或否定句）挑……的毛病；找出……的缺點
vi.: 弄錯，出差錯；【地】產生斷層
sentences: Every man has his faults. 人無聖賢，孰能無過。
The teacher found many faults in spelling and grammar in my composition. 老師在我作文中發現許多拼寫和文法錯誤。
The fault is entirely mine. 責任全在於我。
It's no fault of hers. 這不是她的過錯。
It was impossible to fault her performance. 她的演出無懈可擊。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有缺點的；不完美的
sentences: We traced the trouble to a faulty transformer. 經追查，我們發現問題出在一臺有缺陷的變壓器上。

part_of_speech: n.: 幫助；善意的行為；恩惠[C]；贊成，贊同[U]
vt.: 支持，擁護；贊同；偏愛；偏袒
sentences: You did me a great favor. 你幫了我一個大忙。
They will look with favor on your proposal. 他們將會贊同你的建議。
A mother shouldn't show too much favor to one of her children. 做母親的不應過分偏愛某一個孩子。
We favor John's plan. 我們贊成約翰的計畫。
The mother favored her eldest son. 母親偏袒大兒子。
The weather favored our voyage. 天氣對我們的航行有利。
She favored him with a charming smile. 她賜給他迷人的一笑。

part_of_speech: n.: 傳真機；傳真通信
vt.: 傳真（文字或圖片）
n.[C]: 特徵，特色[（+of）]；（眼，口，鼻等）臉的一部分
vt.: 以……為特色；是……的特色；（電影）由……主演
vi.: 起重要作用；作為主要角色[（+in）]
sentences: This is a key feature of our society. 這是我們社會的一個主要特點。
He could recall her features very distinctly. 他能夠清晰地回想起她的容貌。
The local newspaper ran a feature on child labor. 地方報紙登載一篇有關童工的特寫。
The feature begins at half past ten. 電影正片十點半開始。
The new movie features two of my favorite actors. 這部新片由我最喜愛的兩位演員主演。
The museum's exhibit features paintings of colonial times. 博物館的展覽品特別介紹殖民時代的繪畫。
Economic issues featured very largely in the Prime Minister's speech. 首相的講話中很大一部分涉及經濟問題。

part_of_speech: n.: （付給律師，醫生等的）酬金，服務費[C]；費用（如學費，會費，入場費等）[C]
vt.: 付費（或小帳）給；【英】聘用
sentences: I'm afraid I can't afford the doctor's fee. 恐怕我付不起給醫生的酬金。
They charge a small registration fee. 他們收一點註冊費。
She feed the waiter. 她付給侍者小費。

part_of_speech: n.: 【電子】【生】回饋；反饋；（信息等的）返回；反饋的信息；（新心理療法）一個人對另一個人言行的反應
n.: 原野；田地；牧場[C]；運動場，田賽場地；礦區，井田；（飛機）場，（戰）場；（廣闊的一大片）地[C]
vt.: 【棒】【板】接（球）；截（球）；守（球）；派……上場比賽
vi.: 【棒】【板】擔任外野手
sentences: They were working in the cotton fields. 他們在棉田裡幹活。
He made a fortune in the gold fields of South Africa. 他在南非的金礦區發了大財。
He is a prominent scholar in the field of linguistics. 他是語言學領域的傑出學者。
As geologists, we work in the field most of the time. 作為地質學家，我們大部分時間在野外工作。
It shows the presence of a magnetic field. 這表明有磁場存在。
He fielded the ball smartly. 他巧妙地將球接住。
Italy fielded a strong team for the World Cup. 義大利派了一支強隊角逐世界杯。
The Minister had to field some tricky questions from the reporters. 部長不得不巧妙地回答記者的一些難以對付的問題。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 外形；體形；人影；體態；風姿
vt.: 計算；認為，以為；估計[Y][+（that）]；料到
vi.: 出現；露頭角；扮演角色[（+as/in）]；做算術，計算
sentences: I saw a figure in the darkness. 我看到暗處有一個人影。
She has an attractive figure. 她有迷人的曲線。
She has a slender figure. 她身材苗條。
He has become a figure known to everyone. 他已成了一個知名人物。
Where did you get those figures? 你從哪兒得到那些數字的？
His work now commands huge figures. 他的作品現在值大價錢。
Our textbook has many figures to help explain the lessons. 我們的教科書有許多圖表幫助解釋課文。
Please help me to figure out my income tax. 請幫我算一下我的所得稅。
How do you figure that? 你如何料到的？
I figure that you'd want your coffee. 我想你要喝咖啡了。
John figured as chief guest at the party. 約翰在這次聚會上是主賓。
The book keeper figured well. 這位簿記員長於計算。
That doesn't figure! 那沒道理！

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 文件夾，公文箱；訂存的文件（或卡片等）
vt.: 把……歸檔[（+away）]；提出（申請等）；提起（訴訟等）
vi.: 排成縱隊行進[Q]；提出申請；提起訴訟[（+for）]
sentences: He read all the files on the case. 他閱讀了有關這個案件的全部卷宗。
A file of passengers were coming down the steps. 旅客魚貫走下階梯。
She filed all her letters carefully. 她把她所有的信件仔細歸檔。
She has filed a suit against the college for sex discrimination. 她對那所大學提出性別歧視的訴訟。
They filed past the grave of the national hero. 他們排成縱隊走過那位民族英雄的墳墓。
She decided to file for divorce. 她決意起訴要求離婚。

part_of_speech: ph.: 發胖；填寫 (表格、申請書等)
sentences: Her cheeks began to fill out. 她的臉頰開始長出肉來。
He has to fill a form out. 他必須填好一張表格。

part_of_speech: n.: 財政；金融；財政學[U]；（對事業的）資金支援[U]
vt.: 供資金給；融資，為……籌措資金；賒貨給
vi.: 籌措資金
sentences: He got the position on the strength of his skill in finance. 他憑著自己的理財本領得到了這個職位。
The country's finances have improved. 這個國家財政狀況改善了。
Our project is adequately financed. 我們的工程資金充足。
We are financing for the housing project. 我們在為住宅計畫籌措資金。

part_of_speech: adj.: 財政的；金融的；金融界的
sentences: in financial difficulties 處於財政困難之中
The store was a financial failure and soon closed. 該店賠本，很快就關閉了。

part_of_speech: adj.: 穩固的；牢固的；結實的；堅定的，堅決的；堅挺的
adv.: 穩固地；牢固地
vt.: 使穩固；使牢固[（+up）]；使確定下來[（+up）]
vi.: 變牢固；變堅實；變牢固；變堅實
sentences: I don't think the chair is firm enough to stand on. 我覺得這椅子不夠穩固，不能站人。
My brother has a firm belief in the value of cold baths. 我的兄弟堅信洗冷水澡有益健康。
This wet ground is not firm enough to walk on. 這塊濕地不夠堅實，不能在上面走。
She holds firm to her belief in God. 她對上帝的信仰堅定不移。
We'll firm up the plan soon. 我們不久就要將這一方案確定下來。
The market is firming. 行情正在回升。

other_types: 過去式：fixed   過去分詞：fixed   現在分詞：fixing
part_of_speech: vt.: 使固定；縛緊，釘牢；牢記；確定；決定[（+up）][+wh-][+to-v]
vi.: 固定；變得穩定；（目光等）注視；【化】凝固
n.: 【口】困境；窘境[C]；【口】賄賂；受操縱的事[S]
sentences: Her image was fixed in his mind. 她的形象深深印在他的腦海裡。
Shall we fix a date for the picnic? 我們定一下野餐的時間好嗎？
We are going to have the TV fixed. 我們要請人把電視修好。
If you want to interview the Mayor, I can fix it. 如果你要採訪市長，我可以安排。
Let me fix you a drink. 讓我給你弄杯飲料。
Can they fix the election? 他們能操縱選舉嗎？
Tell him to behave, or I'll fix him. 告訴他規矩點，否則我要收拾他。
Her eyes fixed for a few minutes. 好幾分鐘她的眼睛一動也不動。
Give him a hand; he is in a bad fix. 拉他一把吧，他已陷入了困境。
The horse race was a fix. 這場賽馬有人操縱。
Can you get a fix on the submarine? 你能給潛水艇定位嗎？

other_types: 比較級：more flexible   最高級：most flexible
part_of_speech: adj.: 可彎曲的，易彎曲的；柔韌的；有彈性的；柔順的，溫順的
sentences: A piece of rubber hose is flexible. 橡皮管可以彎曲。
We need a foreign policy that is more flexible. 我們需要更有彈性的外交政策。

part_of_speech: n.: 飛翔，飛行[C][U]；（飛機的）班次；（某班次的）飛機；搭機旅行；飛機的航程[C]
vi.: （鳥等）成群飛行；（候鳥）遷徙
vt.: 射擊（飛禽）；使（鳥）驚起
sentences: He completed the flight in 25 hours and 50 minutes. 他用二十五小時五十分鐘飛完了全程。
Could you tell me what time Flight 212 arrives in New York City? 對不起，第二一二班機什麼時候到達紐約市？
I saw a flight of geese headed south for the winter. 我看到一群大雁南飛過冬去了。
They live two flights up. 他們住在兩段樓梯上面。
How I wish I could stop the flight of time! 我多麼希望能阻止光陰的飛逝！

part_of_speech: ph.: 空中服務人員

other_types: 過去式：fluctuated   過去分詞：fluctuated   現在分詞：fluctuating
part_of_speech: vi.: 波動，變動；動搖
sentences: He fluctuated between hope and despair. 他時而充滿希望時而失望。
The price of vegetables fluctuates according to the weather. 蔬菜價隨著天氣變化而波動。

part_of_speech: n.: 波動；變動；動搖[C][U]
sentences: fluctuations in policy 政策變動
climatic fluctuations 氣候變化

part_of_speech: n.: 焦點，焦距；聚光點[C]；調焦；聚焦[U]
vt.: 使聚焦[（+on）]；調節（鏡頭等）的焦距[（+on）]
vi.: 聚焦；調節焦距[（+on）]
sentences: He took out the binoculars and adjusted the focus. 他取出雙筒望遠鏡並調整了焦距。
The focus of this chapter is the American Revolution. 本章的重點是講美國獨立戰爭。
She always wants to be the focus of attention. 她老想成為人們注意的中心。
The focus of the earthquake is eighty miles from our city. 這次地震的震源在距我市八十英里的地方。
You can focus your telescope on that distant television tower. 你可以對著那座遠方的電視塔調節望遠鏡的鏡頭。
I can't focus my thoughts today. 今天我的思想集中不起來。
A defect of vision prevented him from focusing accurately. 視力上的缺陷使他不能準確對焦。
The beams of light moved across the sky and focused on the plane. 光束在空中移動，集中對準飛機。

part_of_speech: adj.: 專心的；集中精力的；focus的動詞過去式、過去分詞

other_types: 過去式：folded   過去分詞：folded   現在分詞：folding
part_of_speech: vt.: 摺疊；對摺[（+up）]；交疊，交叉；合攏
vi.: 可以摺疊；可以對摺[（+up）]；（事業等）失敗，垮臺，關閉[（+up）]
n.[C]: 摺疊；褶，褶痕；褶層
sentences: She folded up the letter and put it in her pocket. 她把信摺起來放進口袋。
Fold your arms and sit up straight! 兩臂交叉，坐直！
He folded the pills in a piece of paper. 他用紙包住藥丸。
Does this table fold? 這張桌子可以摺疊嗎？
The new restaurant folded up in less than a year. 這家餐廳不到一年就歇業了。
The paper tore easily along the fold. 按摺痕一撕，很容易紙就撕下來了。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 文件夾，文書夾，紙夾；摺疊式印刷品
n.: 力，力量；力氣[U]；武力，暴力[U]
vt.: 強迫，迫使[O2]；用力推進；強行攻佔；強行打開[O]
sentences: The moral force is on our side. 道義的力量在我們這一邊。
The robber used force to get into the house. 強盜使用暴力強行進入住宅。
What is the force of gravity at sea level? 海平面的地球引力多大？
He was a force behind these social changes. 他是推動這些社會變革的主力。
There is force in what he said. 他的話有說服力。
He writes with force. 他的文章很有說服力。
A U.N. peacekeeping force was sent to that country. 一支聯合國維持和平部隊被派往該國。
The policemen forced the criminals to give up their arms. 警察迫使罪犯放下武器。
We forced our way in. 我們擠了進去。
She forced a smile. 她強作笑容。

other_types: 動詞變化：forecast /  forecasted / forecast /  forecasted / forecasting
part_of_speech: vt.: 預測，預報[+（that）][+wh-]；預示；預言
vi.: 作預測，進行預報
n.: 預報，預測，預料[C][+（that）]
sentences: The teacher forecast that twenty of his pupils would pass the examination. 老師預測他有二十名學生能通過考試。
Such events may forecast war. 這類事件可能是戰爭的預兆。
Who can forecast the future? 誰能預言將來？
I listened to the weather forecast. 我聽了天氣預報。

part_of_speech: a.[Z]: 外國的；陌生的；不屬於本身的；不適合的[F][（+to）]
sentences: He likes collecting foreign stamps. 他喜歡收集外國郵票。
Deception was foreign to his nature. 欺騙和他的本性格格不入。
The oculist removed a foreign object from his eye. 眼科醫生從他眼中除去一個異物。

other_types: 動詞變化：forgot / forgotten /  forgot / forgetting
part_of_speech: vt.: 忘記[+to-v][+v-ing][+（that）][+wh-]；忘記帶（或買等）
vi.: 忘記[（+about）]
sentences: I forgot posting the letter. 我忘了信已寄出。
Don't forget to post the letter. 別忘了去寄信。
I forgot my keys. 我忘了帶鑰匙了。
Let's forget our disagreements. 我們不要再提我們之間的爭吵了。
Don't forget the waiter. 不要忘了給侍者小費。
If we can't get any financial backing, we might as well forget the whole thing. 如果得不到經濟上的支持，我們還是放棄整個計畫好。
I forgot about the food cooking on the stove. 我忘記爐子上做的飯了。

part_of_speech: a.[(: 健忘的；不注意的；疏忽的
sentences: I am so forgetful I often leave my keys at home. 我這麼健忘，老把鑰匙忘在家裡。
He tends to be forgetful of his manners. 他往往不注意禮節。

part_of_speech: n.: 形狀；外形[C][U]；種類，類型[C][（+of）]
vt.: 形成；構成；塑造；構（詞）；造（句）；組織；成立
vi.: （物體）成形；被形成；排（隊），列（隊）[Q]
sentences: Churches are often built in the form of a cross. 教堂常常建成十字形。
It was a form of blackmail. 那是一種訛詐。
He adopted the prose form. 他採用散文形式。
If she is in form, she can win the match easily. 如果她競技狀態良好，她可以輕易贏得這場比賽。
To apply for a job, you must fill out a form. 申請工作要填表。
We shook hands as a matter of form. 我們照例握握手。
It is very bad form to insist on talking about oneself. 一味講自己如何如何是很不禮貌的。
The boy is in the fourth form. 這男孩上四年級。
The design is formed with triangles. 該圖案由若干三角形組成。
We formed a club. 我們成立了一個俱樂部。
He forms the habit of getting up early. 他養成早起的習慣。
The boys formed a line. 男孩們排成一行。
Clouds are forming on the top of the hill. 山頂上形成了雲。
The girls formed into three lines. 女孩子排成三行。
An idea formed in her mind. 她腦子裡產生了一個主意。

other_types: 過去式：forwarded   過去分詞：forwarded   現在分詞：forwarding
part_of_speech: adv.: 向前；向將來；今後
adj.: 前面的[Z][B]；早的；提前的；早熟的
n.: 前鋒
vt.: 轉交[（+to）]；發送，遞送[（+to）][O1]
sentences: He hurried forward to meet her. 他趕緊走上前去迎接她。
They never met from that day forward. 他們從那天以後再也未能相見。
The meeting had been put forward an hour. 會議提前一小時舉行。
He put forward a new view. 他提出了一種新見解。
We can see the forward part of the ship. 我們可以看見船的前部。
The spring flowers are rather forward this year. 今年春天的花兒開得相當早。
She made a forward remark. 她講了一句冒昧的話。
He's always forward with help. 他總是樂於助人。
Would you please forward this letter to his new address? 請你把這封信轉寄到他的新地址。
The goods will be forwarded to your house. 這些貨將發送到你家裡。
He tried to forward his father's plan. 他努力想促成父親的計畫。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有基礎的；found的動詞過去式、過去分詞
sentences: The criticisms are founded on facts as well as convictions. 這些批評既是基於堅定的信念，又是有一定事實根據的。

part_of_speech: adj.: 坦白的；直率的；真誠的[（+with）]
vt.: 免費郵寄；蓋免費遞寄郵戳於（郵件）
n.: 免費遞送的章；免費遞送的郵件
sentences: I'll be frank with you. 坦白跟你說吧。
He offered a frank apology to her for hurting her feelings. 他因傷害了她的感情而真誠地向她道歉。
franked envelopes 蓋有郵資已付字樣的信封

part_of_speech: adv.: 率直地；坦白地；確實；坦率地說
n.: 燃料[C][U]；刺激因素[U][（+for/of）]
vt.: 對……供給燃料；給……加油；激起；刺激
vi.: 加燃料；加油[（+up）]
sentences: They are trying to find a cleaner fuel for cars. 他們正試圖找一種更乾淨的汽車燃料。
The boiler is fueled by coal. 鍋爐以煤作燃料。
His rude remarks fueled her anger. 他粗魯的言詞使她怒上加怒。

other_types: 過去式：fulfilled   過去分詞：fulfilled   現在分詞：fulfilling
part_of_speech: vt.: 執行（命令等）；服從；履行（諾言等）；完成（任務等）；實現
sentences: The doctor's instructions must be fulfilled exactly. 必須一絲不苟地遵照醫囑去辦。
He always fulfills his promises. 他總是履行自己的諾言。
The company should be able to fulfill our requirements. 公司應該能夠滿足我們的要求。
These illustrations fulfill the text. 這些插圖使正文臻於完整。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 功能，作用，官能；職務，職責
vi.: （機器等）工作，運行；起作用[（+as）]
sentences: The teacher did not explain its grammatical function. 老師沒有解釋它的文法功能。
What is his function on the committee? 他在委員會裡擔任什麼職務？
I attended many social functions while working abroad. 我在國外工作期間出席了許多社交會。
The refrigerator is not functioning well. 冰箱有點問題。
The sofa functions as a bed at night. 這沙發在夜裡可以當床。

part_of_speech: adj.: 機能的；職務上的；在起作用的
n.: 籌款
adj.: 募款的
n.[U]: 傢俱；（工廠等的）設備
sentences: Some articles of furniture were lost when we moved. 我們搬家時有幾件傢俱丟失了。

other_types: 過去式：furthered   過去分詞：furthered   現在分詞：furthering
part_of_speech: adj.: 更遠的；較遠的；另外的；進一步的；深一層的
adv.: 更遠地；進一步地；深一層地
vt.: 促進；助長；推動；far的形容詞或副詞比較級
sentences: Do you need further help? 你還需要幫忙嗎？
We will help you further. 我們會進一步幫助你的。
The house is not big enough for us; and further, it is too far from the town. 這房子對我們來說太小了；再者，它離城也太遠。
He did his best to further the interests of his state. 他竭盡所能增進他那個州的利益。

part_of_speech: n.: 姿勢；手勢[C][U]；姿態，表示[C]
vi.: 做手勢，用動作示意[Q]
vt.: 用手勢（或動作）表示[O]
sentences: He raised his hands in a gesture of despair. 他舉起雙手表示絕望。
We hold a party for our new colleagues as a gesture of friendship. 我們為新同事舉辦了一個聚會，以示友善。
Handshake is a gesture of friendship. 握手是一種友好的表示。
She was gesturing so excitedly that I knew something was wrong. 她如此激動地打著手勢，我就知道出了問題。
I gestured the child over. 我朝孩子打手勢叫他過來。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: （賽跑等的）終點；（旅行的）目的地；目的，目標
vi.: （足球等）攻門；射門得分
sentences: They reached the goal of their journey. 他們到達了旅程的終點。
My goal in life is to help others. 我的人生目標是幫助他人。
The ball missed the goal by a few inches. 球差幾英寸沒進門。

part_of_speech: n.[K]: 商品；貨物；動產
sentences: He buys and sells leather goods. 他買賣皮貨。
Our neighbors sold their household goods before they moved out. 我們的鄰居在搬家前把家用品先賣掉。

part_of_speech: adv.: 逐步地，漸漸地
sentences: We began to know each other gradually. 我們開始漸漸地相互熟悉起來。

part_of_speech: n.: 不滿，不平；抱怨，牢騷[C][（+against）]
sentences: my family's grievance against Jonathan 我們家對喬納森的不滿
A committee was set up to look into the workers' grievances. 已成立一專門委員會調查工人們的申訴。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 烤架；燒烤的肉類食物
vt.: （用烤架）烤（魚、肉等）；【口】拷問，盤問（犯人等）
vi.: 被炙烤
sentences: Put the hamburgers on the grill. 把漢堡牛排放到烤架上。
At the police station, she was grilled for twenty-four hours. 她在警察局被拷問了二十四小時。
He's grilling out there in the midday sun. 他在正午的陽光下受炙烤。

part_of_speech: n.: 生長，成長；發育[U]；增長；增大；發展[U][S1]
sentences: Exercise and good food are important to the proper growth of a child. 運動和營養好的食物對孩子的正常發育十分重要。
The rate of overall industrial growth was above eight percent. 工業總增長率超過百分之八。
These are fruits of my own growth. 這些是我自己栽培的水果。
A thick growth of weeds covered the yard. 庭院長滿濃密的野草。

part_of_speech: n.: 保證；商品保證；保證書[C][U][+that]；起保證作用的事物[C][（+of）][+that]
vt.: 保證；擔保[+to-v][+（that）][O1][O8]；包，管保[+（that）]
sentences: The TV set has a year's guarantee. 這架電視機有一年的保修期。
You have my guarantee that I'll finish the job on time. 我向你保證按時完成工作。
A diploma is no guarantee of efficiency. 持有文憑不能保證工作效率一定高。
I can offer my land as a guarantee. 我可拿出我的地產作抵押品。
Perfect satisfaction is guaranteed to our customers. 保證我們的顧客完全滿意。
The policy guarantees us against all loss. 這種保險契約保障我們免受任何損失。

other_types: 過去式：haggled   過去分詞：haggled   現在分詞：haggling
part_of_speech: n.: 爭論；論價，討價還價
vt.: 亂劈，亂砍
vi.: （在價格、條件等方面）爭論不休；亂劈，亂砍
sentences: They've been haggling over the amount of the rent for a week. 他們為了房租的問題已經爭論了一個星期。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 柄，把手；柄狀物；可乘之機，把柄，口實
vt.: 觸，摸；拿；弄；搬動；操作；操縱；指揮；管理
vi.: 操作起來；（車子等）開起來[Q]
sentences: I turned the handle and opened the door. 我轉了轉拉手，把門打開。
Don't let your conduct give any handle for gossip. 別讓你的行為成為人家說三道四的話柄。
Do not handle the exhibits. 請勿觸摸展品。
He knows how to handle the machine. 他會操作這臺機器。
I didn't know how to handle these people. 我不知道如何對付這些人。
She asked me to handle the business for her. 她叫我替她做生意。

part_of_speech: adj.: 【口】手邊的；近便的[（+for）]；便利的；便於使用的
sentences: The school is close to our houses, so it is quite handy for the children. 學校離我們家很近，所以孩子們上學很方便。
Is there a restaurant handy? 附近有飯店嗎？
A vacuum cleaner is a handy household tool. 吸塵器是一種使用方便的家庭用具。
Henry is never very handy at fixing things. 亨利修東西總有點笨手笨腳。
He is handy with words. 他善於辭令。
This new motorcycle is really handy in city traffic. 這部新摩托車在市區的交通中很便利。

part_of_speech: n.[C,U]: 港灣，海港；避難所，躲藏處，避風港
vt.: 庇護；藏匿；收養（動物等）；心懷，懷有
vi.: （船）入港停泊；避入安全地；躲藏；居住；生存
sentences: During the gale the ships stayed in the harbor. 刮大風時船隻停泊在港內。
New York is a big harbor. 紐約是個巨大的海港。
He is accused of harboring an escaped convict. 他被指控窩藏逃犯。
Your eyes were glued on her all the time. Were you harboring any evil thoughts? 你一直目不轉睛地看著她，是否心中抱有邪惡的念頭？
He still harbors a grudge against me. 他對我仍懷有怨恨。
Crabs harbor in holes. 蟹躲藏在洞裡。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有害的[（+to）]
sentences: Smoking is harmful to health. 吸菸有害健康。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有危險的；冒險的
sentences: That was a hazardous journey. 那是個危險的旅程。
Smoking is hazardous to your health. 抽菸有礙你的健康。

part_of_speech: ph.: 總公司；總部；（銀行）總行
n.[M: （軍，警的）司令部，總部，總署；司令部（全體指揮）人員；（公司，機關等的）總部，總公司，總局
sentences: The soldier reported to headquarters. 這個士兵向司令部作了報告。
Brussels, which is the headquarters of the Common Market, is an attractive city. 歐洲共同市場的總部所在地布魯塞爾是座美麗的城市。

other_types: 過去式：hesitated   過去分詞：hesitated   現在分詞：hesitating
part_of_speech: vi.: 躊躇；猶豫；說話吞吞吐吐
vt.: 有疑慮，不願意[Y][+to-v]
sentences: Don't hesitate about that. Do it at once. 對於那件事不要再猶豫了。馬上去做吧。
He did not hesitate to ask her to sit beside him. 他毫不猶豫地請她坐在他身旁。

part_of_speech: n.[U: 躊躇，猶豫；含糊
sentences: Without any hesitation, he jumped into the river to save the drowning child. 他毫不猶豫地跳下河去救溺水的孩子。

other_types: 動詞變化：hid / hidden /  hid / hiding
part_of_speech: vt.: 把……藏起來，隱藏[（+from）]；隱瞞[（+from）]
vi.: 躲藏，隱藏
n.: （觀察野獸活動的）隱密場所[C]
sentences: His words had a hidden meaning. 他話中有話。
Where did you hide it? 你把它藏到哪裡去了？
My husband never hides anything from me. 我丈夫從不對我隱瞞什麼。
Lies can not hide facts. 謊言掩蓋不了事實。
I ran swiftly up the stairs and hid behind my bed. 我快速跑上樓，躲在我的床後。

part_of_speech: vt.: 用強光照射；照亮；（繪畫等中）用強光突出（某部分）
n.[C: 強光（效果）；（畫等的）最明亮部分；最突出（或最精彩）的部分；最重要（或最有趣）的事情[（+of）]
sentences: Several lit candles highlighted the faces. 幾支點燃的蠟燭照亮了眾人的面孔。
His speech highlighted the need for educational reform. 他的演講強調了教育改革的必要性。
Grain highlighted U.S.-Russian trade last year. 去年美俄貿易以穀物為主。
You need to put the highlight in now. 現在你需要把強光部分畫出來。
Her performance was the highlight of the show. 她的表演是那場演出中最精彩的部分。

part_of_speech: adv.: 非常，很，高度地；（地位、等級、評價等）高
sentences: They are highly skilled workers. 他們是技術很好的工人。
Dogs have a highly developed sense of smell. 狗有著高度發達的嗅覺。
He speaks very highly of you. 他對你評價很高。
He is highly paid. 他薪水優厚。

other_types: 過去式：hiked   過去分詞：hiked   現在分詞：hiking
part_of_speech: vi.: 徒步旅行，健行；遠足；【口】向上挪動[（+up）]
vt.: 【口】（猛地）拉，舉，提；【美】【口】（尤指急劇地）提高（物價等）
n.[C]: 徒步旅行，遠足；【美】【口】（數量的）增加；（物價等的）上漲
sentences: The boy scouts hiked out to the forest. 童子軍步行去森林。
He hiked up a sack of grain on his shoulder. 他把一袋糧食舉上肩。
We are going on a four-mile hike to the lake. 我們步行四英里去湖邊。
The government announced a 300 per cent hike in bread prices. 政府宣布麵包漲價三倍。

other_types: 過去式：hired   過去分詞：hired   現在分詞：hiring
part_of_speech: vt.: 租，租借；僱，僱用
n.[U]: 租用，僱用；租金；工錢
sentences: They hired a big hall. 他們租了一間大廳。
We hired a driver to take us on a tour of the city. 我們僱用了一個司機帶我們遊覽這個城市。
These cars are for hire. 這些車子供租用。

other_types: 過去式：held   過去分詞：held   現在分詞：holding
part_of_speech: vt.: 握著；抓住；夾住；托住；支承
vi.: 持續，保持；頂住，支持
n.: 抓住，握住；握法[C][U][（+of/on）]；可手攀（或腳踏）的東西，支撐點[C]
sentences: He held a knife in his hand. 他手裡握著一把刀。
The roof was held up by pillars. 屋頂由柱子支撐著。
She held herself erect. 她挺直了身子。
The highjackers held two women hostage. 劫機者扣留兩名婦女作人質。
The ship held an easterly course. 船繼續向東航行。
Jim was able to hold back his anger and avoid a fight. 吉姆忍住了怒氣，避免了一場鬥毆。
He held this office for ten years. 他擔任這一職務有十年。
He holds much property in the town. 他在鎮上擁有很多地產。
The box can hold all my clothes. 這箱子能裝下我的全部衣服。
She holds the same view. 她持有同樣的看法。
They will hold a meeting to discuss this problem tomorrow. 他們明天將開會討論這個問題。
I hope this beautiful weather will hold. 我希望這種好天氣將持續下去。
The dike held during the flood. 洪水期間河堤沒有崩潰。
My decision still holds. 我的決定仍然有效。
He lost hold of the rope and fell to the ground. 他沒有抓住繩子，摔到地上。
He couldn't find a hold on the cliff. 他在懸崖上找不到一個可以站住腳的地方。
He's got a good hold of his subject. 他很好地掌握了自己的學科。
It is time to put love on hold. 該是把愛情暫時擱下的時候了。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 主人，東道主；旅館老板
vt.: 作……主人（或東道主），主辦，主持；以主人身分招待
sentences: Yesterday we were hosts to a few friends. 昨天我們接待了幾位朋友。
It remains unknown which country will host the international tennis tournament. 現在仍不知道哪個國家主辦國際網球錦標賽。
We attended a dinner party hosted by the president of the company. 我們出席了公司總裁舉辦的宴會。

part_of_speech: n.: 認出；識別；鑑定；確認[U]；身分證明；身分證[U][C]
sentences: the identification of criminals by their fingerprints 憑指紋確認罪犯
I used my driver's license as identification. 我用駕駛執照作為身分證明。
The candidate's identification with organized crimes cost him the election. 那位候選人因與集團犯罪有關聯而落選。

other_types: 過去式：identified   過去分詞：identified   現在分詞：identifying
part_of_speech: vt.: 確認；識別；鑑定，驗明[（+as）]；視……（與……）為同一事物[（+with）]
vi.: （與……）認同；一致；感同身受[（+with）]
sentences: She identified him as her attacker. 她認出他就是襲擊她的人。
I cannot identify this signature. 我識別不出這是誰的簽字。
Never identify wealth with happiness. 千萬不要把財富和幸福等同起來。
The politician refused to identify himself with the Administration's foreign policy. 那位政治家拒不支持政府的外交政策。
I identified with the heroine of the novel. 我與小說中的那個女主人公感同身受。

part_of_speech: adj.: 虛構的；幻想的；有想像力的；富於想像的；有創造力的
sentences: Fairy tales are imaginative. 神仙故事是幻想出來的。
The mind of the storyteller has great imaginative powers. 講故事人的頭腦極富想像力。
imaginative writers 富有想像力的作家

part_of_speech: a.[Z]: 立即的，即刻的；目前的，當前的[B]
sentences: Mr. Shaw made no immediate answer. 蕭先生沒有立即回答。
We must do something to meet the refugees' immediate needs. 我們必須設法滿足難民眼下的需求。
Our immediate concern was to prevent the fire from spreading to other buildings. 我們的當務之急是阻止火勢向其他建築物蔓延。
Is there a gas station in the immediate area? 附近有加油站嗎？
The evidence has no immediate bearing on the case. 該證據與本案無直接關係。

part_of_speech: adv.: 直接地；接近地；立即，即刻，馬上
conj.: 【主英】一……（就……）
sentences: the parties immediately involved in the case 與案件有直接牽連的各方
The airplane was immediately overhead. 飛機幾乎就在正上方。
If you hear an alarm, leave the building immediately. 要是聽見警報，馬上離開大樓。
June comes immediately after May. 五月一過便是六月。
Return immediately you are done. 事情一做完就回來。

other_types: 過去式：impacted   過去分詞：impacted   現在分詞：impacting
part_of_speech: vt.: 壓緊；擠滿；衝擊，撞擊，碰撞
vi.: 衝擊，撞擊，碰撞；產生影響[（+on）]
sentences: The war impacted the area with refugees. 戰爭使那個地區擠滿難民。
It is obvious how bad movies will impact on children. 壞電影對兒童會產生什麼影響是顯而易見的。

other_types: 比較級：more impatient   最高級：most impatient
part_of_speech: adj.: 無耐心的，不耐煩的；無法忍受的[（+of/at/with）]；切盼的，急欲的[F][（+for）][+to-v]
sentences: He was very impatient with students who could not follow him. 他對聽不懂他講課的學生很不耐心。
Philip was impatient to learn the news. 菲利浦急於想知道這個消息。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 工具；器具；用具[P1]；裝備；傢俱[P1]
sentences: The store supplies agricultural implements. 這商店供應農具。

other_types: 過去式：implied   過去分詞：implied   現在分詞：implying
part_of_speech: vt.: 暗指；暗示；意味著[+（that）]；必然包含；必需
sentences: Her silence implied consent. 她的沉默意味著同意。
Rights imply duties. 權利必然包含義務。

part_of_speech: n.: 印象[C][U][（+on）]；模糊的觀念；感想[C][+that]
sentences: The new teacher made a good impression on the students. 新教師給學生留下了一個好印象。
I have the impression that I've seen that man before. 我覺得我以前見過那個人。
The robber left an impression of his feet in the mud. 強盜在爛泥裡留下了他的腳印。
My advice seemed to make little impression on him. 我的忠告似乎對他不起作用。

part_of_speech: adj.: 不合適的，不適當的；不合標準的；不規則的
sentences: Short trousers are improper at a dance. 舞會上不宜穿短褲。
That is an improper usage of the word. 那是這個字的一種不標準的用法。
an improper diagnosis of disease 對疾病的錯誤診斷
improper jokes 粗鄙的笑話

other_types: 過去式：improved   過去分詞：improved   現在分詞：improving
part_of_speech: vt.: 改進，改善；增進；提高（土地，地產）的價值
vi.: 改善，變得更好；增加，提高
sentences: He put forward a plan for improving the rate of production. 他提出了一個提高生產率的計畫。
She improved her leisure by learning foreign languages. 她利用閒暇時間學習外語。
Their working conditions are improving. 他們的工作條件正在改善。
The price of steel improved. 鋼材價格提高了。

part_of_speech: n.: 改進，改善；增進[U][C][（+in）]；改進處，改善處[C]
sentences: I cannot see any improvement in your writing. 我看不出你在寫作方面有什麼改進。
Painting the room yellow is a great improvement. 把這房間漆成黃色確實好多了。
This composition is a great improvement on the one you wrote last week. 這篇作文比你上星期寫的那篇進步了許多。

part_of_speech: n.: 刺激；鼓勵；動機[U][C][（+to）][+to-v]
adj.: 刺激的；鼓勵的，獎勵的
sentences: The child has no incentive to study harder because his parents cannot afford to send him to college. 這孩子沒有努力學習的動力，因為他父母供不起他上大學。
incentive payments 獎金

part_of_speech: adj.: 傾向的；傾斜的

other_types: 過去式：included   過去分詞：included   現在分詞：including
part_of_speech: vt.: 包括，包含[W][+v-ing]；算入，包含於……裡面
sentences: The price includes both house and furniture. 價錢包括房子和傢俱。
I include him among my friends. 我把他當作朋友。

part_of_speech: n.: 包括；包含；內含物
n.: 收入；收益；所得[C][U]
sentences: Tony lives beyond his income. 湯尼的花費超出其收入。
People on fixed incomes are hurt by price increases. [C] 收入固定的人受物價上漲之害最深。

part_of_speech: n.: 不便；麻煩，打擾[U]；不便之處；麻煩事[C]
vt.: 給……造成不便；麻煩，打擾
sentences: The delay caused great inconvenience. 這一耽擱造成很大不便。
Not having a computer is an inconvenience. 沒有電腦是很不方便的事。
I hope it won't inconvenience you too much. 我希望此事不會給你帶來過多的不便。

other_types: 過去式：increased   過去分詞：increased   現在分詞：increasing
part_of_speech: vt.: 增大；增加；增強
vi.: 增大；增加；增強；增殖
sentences: Travel increases one's knowledge of the world. 旅遊增進人對世界的了解。
Foreign investments there increased five times. 那裡的外國投資增加了五倍。
These flowers will increase every year. 這些花會年復一年越長越多。

other_types: 過去式：indicated   過去分詞：indicated   現在分詞：indicating
part_of_speech: vt.: 指示；指出[+（that）][+wh-]；表明；象徵；暗示[+（that）][+wh-]
vi.: （人，車）亮起指示燈表示轉向
sentences: The light above the elevator indicated that the elevator was then at the fifteenth floor. 電梯上方的燈指示那時電梯在十五樓。
His hesitation indicates unwillingness. 他的猶豫表明不願意。

part_of_speech: n.: 指示；指點；表示[U][（+of）]；徵兆；跡象；暗示[C][U][（+of）][+that]
sentences: This map gives no indication of the heights of the hills. 這張地圖沒有標出這些山的高度。
There are indications that the weather is changing. 有好些跡象顯示天氣要變了。
The speedometer indication was 45 miles. 速度計讀數是四十五英里。

part_of_speech: adj.: 個人的，個體的[B]；個別的，單獨的[B]
n.[C]: 個人；個體；【口】（常與形容詞連用）……人
sentences: The director of the factory felt no individual responsibility for the deficit. 廠長個人不覺得應對工廠虧損負責。
Students can apply for individual tuition. 學生可以申請個別授課。
The model has an individual way of dressing. 這個模特兒有著獨特的穿衣方式。
Exceptions can not be made for individuals. 對個人不能有例外。

part_of_speech: adv.: 作為個人，單獨地；逐個地；分別地；獨特地；與眾不同地
sentences: The principal knew all the students individually. 校長認識每個學生。
Individually, the children are quite nice, but in a group they're badly behaved. 這些孩子單獨呆著時都挺不錯，可是聚在一起就沒規沒矩了。
People differ individually. 人各有別。

part_of_speech: adj.: 經驗不足的，不熟練的[（+at/in）]
sentences: an inexperienced driver 不熟練的司機
He was inexperienced in business. 他在商業方面缺乏經驗。

other_types: 過去式：inferred   過去分詞：inferred   現在分詞：inferring
part_of_speech: vt.: 推斷，推論；猜想[（+from）][+（that）]；意味著；暗示；表明
vi.: 作出推論
sentences: I infer that my proposal has been accepted. 我推測我的建議已被接受。
People inferred that so able a governor would make a good president. 人們推定，如此能幹的州長會成為一名好總統的。
Ragged clothing infers poverty. 衣衫襤褸意味著貧困。

other_types: 過去式：inflated   過去分詞：inflated   現在分詞：inflating
part_of_speech: vt.【書】: 使充氣；使膨脹[（+with）]；使得意，使驕傲[（+with）]
vi.【書】: 充氣；膨脹；擴大；得意，自傲
sentences: Fred inflated the football. 弗雷德給足球打了氣。
He is inflated with pride. 他趾高氣揚。
Clothing has inflated in price. 服裝漲價了。

part_of_speech: n.: 通貨膨脹[U][C]；充氣；膨脹[U]
sentences: The government did nothing to curb inflation. 政府沒有採取措施遏制通貨膨脹。
air inflation 充氣

part_of_speech: n.: 影響，作用[C][U][（+on/upon）]；影響力；勢力，權勢[U][（+over/with）]
vt.: 影響，感化；左右[O2]
sentences: The influence of climate on crops are self-evident. 氣候對農作物的影響是不證自明的。
Mr. Smith is a man of influence in this town. 史密斯先生是這個鎮上有權勢的人物。
I don't want to influence you. You must decide for yourself. 我不想影響你。你必須自行決定。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有影響的；有權勢的
sentences: Influential friends helped him to get a good job. 有權勢的朋友們幫他弄到一份美差。
an influential newspaper 有影響的報紙

part_of_speech: n.: 報告；消息；報導；情報資料；資訊[U][（+about/on）]；詢問處；詢問處職員[C]
sentences: The book contains much useful information. 這本書包含了許多有用的資料。
We received information that you had arrived. 我們得到了你已抵達的消息。

other_types: 動詞變化：input /  inputted / input /  inputted / inputting
part_of_speech: n.: 投入；輸入
vt.: 將（資料等）輸入電腦
n.: 詢問，打聽；質詢[C][U][（+about/into）]；調查[C][（+into）]
sentences: Make your inquiries at the office. 請去辦公室詢問。
They held an inquiry into the incident. 他們對這一事件展開調查。
scientific inquiry 科學探索
The bank clerk answered all my inquiries. 銀行職員回答了我提出的所有問題。

other_types: 過去式：installed   過去分詞：installed   現在分詞：installing
part_of_speech: vt.: 任命，使就職[（+in）]；安裝，設置
sentences: He has been installed in his new office. 他已就任新職。
He's going to install an air-conditioner in the house. 他要在這屋子裡裝冷氣機。

part_of_speech: n.: 就任，就職；就職典禮[U][C]；安裝，設置[U]
sentences: the installation of a new mayor 新市長的就職
The installation of the shower only took a few minutes. 安裝淋浴器只花了幾分鐘時間。
a heating installation 暖器設備
American nuclear installations in Europe 美國在歐洲的核設施

part_of_speech: n.: 保險；保險契約[U][（+against）]；保險業[U]
sentences: I found a job selling insurance. 我找到一份推銷保險的工作。
She works in insurance. 她從事保險業。
He has $100,000 life insurance, which his wife will receive if he dies first. 他有十萬美元的人壽保險，如果他先去世，他的妻子將得到這筆錢。
I bought some new locks as an additional insurance against burglary. 我買了一些新鎖具以進一步防止盜竊。
The insurance on my house is very high. 我的房屋保險費很高。

other_types: 過去式：insured   過去分詞：insured   現在分詞：insuring
part_of_speech: vt.: 為……投保；接受保險[H][（+against）]；【美】保證，確保[+（that）][O1]
sentences: Insure your baggage before you leave home. 離家前先給行李保險。
More care would insure you against making so many mistakes. 多加注意就能保證你不犯這麼多的錯誤了。

other_types: 過去式：intended   過去分詞：intended   現在分詞：intending
part_of_speech: vt.: 想要；打算[+to-v][+v-ing][+（that）][O2]；打算使……（成為）；（為……而）準備[H][（+for/as）][O2]
sentences: He intends his son to manage the company. 他打算讓他兒子經營該公司。
I intend studying abroad. 我打算出國留學。
That trap is intended for you. 那個圈套是為你而設的。

part_of_speech: n.: 意圖，意向，目的[C][U][（+of）][+to-v]；【口】求婚意圖[P][（+towards）]
sentences: His good intentions were repaid by good results. 他的善意得到了善報。
It wasn't my intention to fool you. 我不想騙你。
The intention of the provision is clear. 那條款的含義是清楚的。

part_of_speech: adv.: 專心地，專注地；熱切地，熱心地
sentences: He was examining the stamps intently. 他正在聚精會神地細看郵票。

other_types: 過去式：interned   過去分詞：interned   現在分詞：interning
part_of_speech: vt.: （尤指戰時）拘留；軟禁
vi.: 做實習醫師（或實習教師、實習生）
n.: 實習醫師；實習教師；實習生
a.[Z]: 內的，內部的；內在的，固有的，本質的
n.: 本質，本性[P]；內部器官，內臟[P]
sentences: I talked to him on the internal telephone. 我在內部電話上與他交談。
There was a rapid increase in internal trade. 國內貿易迅速增長。
The driver received internal injuries in the accident. 司機在事故中受了內傷。

part_of_speech: adj.: 國際性的，國際間的
n.: 國際運動比賽[C]；參加國際運動比賽的選手[C]
sentences: Several international celebrities were present at the statesman's memorial service. 好幾位國際知名人士出席了這位政治家的追悼儀式。

part_of_speech: n.: 實習醫師的地位

other_types: 過去式：interrupted   過去分詞：interrupted   現在分詞：interrupting
part_of_speech: vt.: 打斷（講話或講話人）；中斷；遮斷；阻礙
vi.: 打斷；打擾
sentences: I don't want to interrupt you. Go on with your story. 我不想打斷你。請把你的故事講下去。
The war interrupted the trade between the two countries. 戰爭使兩國間的貿易中斷了。
Go on. I don't want to interrupt. 說下去，我不想打斷你說話。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 接見，會見；（記者的）採訪，訪談；訪談錄
vt.: 接見，會見；訪問，採訪；對……進行面談，面試
sentences: He asked for an interview with the president. 他要求與校長會晤。
Don't be late for your interview, or you won't get the job. 面試不要遲到，否則你就得不到工作了。
We are now going to interview the Minister of Education. 我們現在就去採訪教育部長。
She has interviewed most of the applicants for the job. 她已和大部分申請這份工作的人面談過。

part_of_speech: adj.: 非常貴重的，無價的；無法估價的[（+for/to）]
sentences: His advice has been invaluable to the success of the project. 他的建議對這一工程的成功起了無法估量的作用。
invaluable jewels 極為貴重的寶石

other_types: 過去式：invented   過去分詞：invented   現在分詞：inventing
part_of_speech: vt.: 發明，創造；捏造，虛構
sentences: He invented a new type of stethoscope. 他發明了一種新型聽診器。
We must invent an excuse for being late. 我們必須編一個遲到的藉口。

part_of_speech: n.: 發明，創造[U]；發明物，創作品[C]
sentences: No one person can take credit for the invention of writing. 沒有一個人可以說是他單獨發明了寫字。
The machine was his own invention. 這臺機器是他自己發明的。
An author must have invention to think up new ideas for stories. 作家必須具有為故事構思新意的創造力。
That rumor was the old gossip's own invention. 那個謠言是那個愛說閒話的老傢伙自己編出來的。

part_of_speech: n.: 存貨清單；存貨盤存（報表）；財產目錄[C][U]；清單上開列的貨品；存貨[C][U]
vt.: 編制（詳細目錄等）；把……登入目錄；盤存
sentences: The store was closed for inventory all week. 那家商店因盤貨暫停營業一星期。
make an inventory 開清單
reduce (an) inventory by having a sale 作一次賤賣以減少存貨
inventory one's stock once a month 每月清點一次存貨

other_types: 過去式：invested   過去分詞：invested   現在分詞：investing
part_of_speech: vt.: 投（資）[（+in）]；耗費，投入（時間，金錢等）[（+in）]
vi.: 投資，入股[（+in）]；【口】花錢買[（+in）]
sentences: He invested all his money in real estate. 他把錢全部投資房地產。
He invested a lot of time in trying to help retarded children. 他把大量時間化在設法幫助弱智兒童上。
The trade union is invested with the power to call a strike. 工會被授於號召罷工的權力。
The ancient castle was invested with an air of mystery. 這座古堡充滿神祕的氣氛。
He invested heavily in the cotton business. 他在棉花生意上投入巨資。

other_types: 過去式：investigated   過去分詞：investigated   現在分詞：investigating
part_of_speech: vt.: 調查，研究
vi.: 調查，研究[（+into）]
sentences: The detective was sent to investigate the crime. 那位偵探被派去調查該罪行。
The principal promised to investigate into that affair. 校長答應去調查那件事情。

part_of_speech: n.: 研究；調查[C][U][（+on/of/into）]
sentences: The investigation into the accident was carried out by two policemen. 兩名警察對這一事故展開調查。

part_of_speech: n.: 投資；投資額；投資物[U][C][（+in）]；（精力，時間等的）投入[U]
sentences: He made a large investment in the business enterprise. 他對那個企業作了大量投資。
His investments amount to five million dollars. 他的投資額達五百萬元。

other_types: 過去式：invited   過去分詞：invited   現在分詞：inviting
part_of_speech: vt.: 邀請；招待[（+to）][O2]；請求；徵求[O2]
sentences: He invited several of his friends to the show. 他邀請了幾個朋友去看表演。
After his lecture the visiting professor invited questions. 訪問教授作完講座就請大家提問題。
Recklessness invites disaster. 莽撞招致災難。

other_types: 過去式：invoiced   過去分詞：invoiced   現在分詞：invoicing
part_of_speech: n.: 發票，發貨單
vt.: 開……的發票；開發票給；將……列入清單

other_types: 過去式：isolated   過去分詞：isolated   現在分詞：isolating
part_of_speech: vt.[H]: 使孤立；使脫離；把（傳染病患者等）隔離
vi.: 孤立；隔離；脫離
sentences: Several villages have been isolated by lack of buses. 由於缺少公車，有幾個村子顯得很偏僻。
Sufferers from the infectious disease are isolated. 感染到這種傳染病的人被隔離起來。

other_types: 過去式：issued   過去分詞：issued   現在分詞：issuing
part_of_speech: vt.: 發行；發布；發給，配給[O][（+to）]，核發
vi.: 出來[（+forth）]；流出[（+from）]
n.: 問題；爭論；爭議[C]；發行（物）；一次發行量；（報刊）期號[C]
sentences: The post office issued the stamps last week. 上星期郵局發行了這些郵票。
Who issued the travel documents? 誰核發這些旅遊證件的？
Lava issued from the volcano. 熔岩從火山口流出來。
A strange noise issues from the next room. 隔壁房間裡傳出奇怪的響聲。
His difficulties issue from his lack of knowledge. 他遇到的困難是由缺乏知識造成的。
A new coinage issued. 一種新硬幣發行了。
They have published a lot of new books on international issues. 他們已經出版了很多論述國際問題的新書。
There's an article about Jamaica in this issue. 在這一期裡有一篇關於牙買加的文章。
He died without issue. 他身後無子女。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 項目；品目；條款；細目；（新聞等的）一則，一條，一項
adv.: 【舊】（逐條介紹細目時用）又，同前
sentences: She checked the items in the bill. 她檢查了帳單上的帳目。
There was an item in yesterday's paper about the return of the hostages. 昨天的報上有一條關於放回人質的新聞。

other_types: 過去式：itemized   過去分詞：itemized   現在分詞：itemizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 分條列述；詳細列舉
n.[C]: 旅程；路線；旅行計畫
adj.: 旅行的；旅程的；路線的
sentences: He has some more places to visit on his itinerary. 他在旅途中還有幾個地方要遊覽。
Leave your itinerary so that we can reach you in case of emergency. 請把你的旅行計畫留下來，以便我們在遇到急事時和你取得聯繫。
He kept a lively itinerary of the trip. 他保留著那次旅行中寫的生動日記。
an itinerary map 路線圖

other_types: 比較級：more jealous   最高級：most jealous
part_of_speech: adj.: 妒忌的[（+of）]；吃醋的
sentences: He was jealous of his friend's reputation. 他妒忌朋友的聲譽。
Why is he so jealous? 他為何這麼會妒忌？
If other men spoke to her intimately he was immediately jealous. 一見到別的男人跟她親熱地交談，他便會醋勁大發。
We are jealous of our hard-won freedom. 我們珍惜得來不易的自由。

other_types: 過去式：jeopardized   過去分詞：jeopardized   現在分詞：jeopardizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 使瀕於危險境地；冒……的危險；危及
sentences: If you are rude to the boss, it may jeopardize your chances of success. 如果你對老板沒有禮貌，那也許會危及你事業的成功。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 危險，風險，危難；【律】（被告處於被判罪或受處罰的）危險境地
sentences: The villagers' lives were in jeopardy during the blizzard. 暴風雪肆虐期間，村民們的生命處於危險之中。

part_of_speech: adj.: 失業的；（關於）失業者的

other_types: 過去式：joined   過去分詞：joined   現在分詞：joining
part_of_speech: vt.: 連結；使結合[（+to/together/up）]；與……會合；與……交接
vi.: 會合；相遇；參加；同……一起[（+in）]
n.: 接合點；接連處[C]
sentences: He joined the two pieces of wood together with glue. 他用膠水將這兩塊木料黏在一起。
This path joins the highway up ahead. 這條路在前面與公路相接。
Will you join us for dinner? 你和我們一起吃晚飯好嗎？
I'll persuade him to join our club. 我將勸他加入我們的俱樂部。
The two houses join each other. 這兩棟房子相互毗連。
After a few days on shore the sailor joined his ship. 在岸上待了幾天後，水手回到了他的船上。
Where do the two rivers join? 這兩條河在什麼地方匯合？
He never joined in the usual sports of the boys. 他從不參加孩子們的一般體育活動。
The two estates join at the foot of the hill. 這兩處房地產在山腳下相毗連。
The joins can hardly be seen. 接縫幾乎看不出來。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 接頭，接縫；接合點；【解】關節
vt.: 連接，接合；在關節處分開；把（肉等）切成大塊
adj.: 連接的；聯合的，共同的
sentences: He suffers from arthritis in his leg joints. 他的腿有關節炎。
The pipe was rusted at the joint. 管子的接合處生鏽了。
Take a seat, have a cigarette or a joint and I will be back in three minutes. 請坐，抽根香菸或大麻煙，我三分鐘內就回來。
By their joint efforts they managed to complete the project on time. 他們透過共同努力總算按時完成了計畫。
We have opened a joint account at the bank. 我們在銀行開了一個共有的帳戶。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 日報；雜誌；期刊；日記；日誌
sentences: Professor King often contributes to the medical journal. 金教授常為那個醫學刊物撰稿。
Father keeps a journal of his activities. 我父親有記錄每天活動的習慣。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 旅行[（+to）]；旅程，行程
vi.: 旅行[Q]
sentences: Two days later, they resumed their journey. 兩天以後，他們繼續旅行。
It is one day's journey to get to the seaside. 到海濱是一天的行程。
He journeyed frequently to Paris and other places. 他常到巴黎及別的地方去。

other_types: 過去式：judged   過去分詞：judged   現在分詞：judging
part_of_speech: vt.: 審判；判決[O2][O8][O9]；裁判；評定；裁決
vi.: 審判；評判；裁決
n.[C]: 法官，推事；裁判員
sentences: Who will judge the case? 誰將審判這個案子？
You can't judge a book by its cover. 你不能根據封面來評價一本書。
He is going to judge the first race. 他將擔任第一場比賽的裁判。
We must judge whether he is guilty. 我們必須判定他是否有罪。
Will you judge at the Flower Show? 你將在花展上當評審嗎？
The prisoner was taken before the judge. 囚犯被提審。
He was one of the judges at the horse race. 他是賽馬會上的裁判員之一。
He is no judge in such matters. 他在這些事上是外行。

part_of_speech: n.: 正義；公平；正當的理由；合法[U]；司法，審判[U]
sentences: All men should be treated with justice. 人人都應受到公平待遇。
Those who break the law are subjected to justice. 違法者要受到法律制裁。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 證明為正當；辯護；辯解；正當的理由；藉口
sentences: What can be said in justification of what he had done? 能說些什麼來為他做下的事辯護呢？
There is no justification for his absence. 他沒有理由缺席。

other_types: 過去式：justified   過去分詞：justified   現在分詞：justifying
part_of_speech: vt.: 證明……是正當的；為……辯護；是……的正當理由[+v-ing]；證明……無罪；開釋
vi.: 證明合法；辯解；【印】排整齊；整理版面
sentences: The editors are justified in refusing your work. 那些編輯有充分的理由拒絕你的作品。
How can you justify your rude behaviour? 你如何解釋你的粗魯行為呢？

part_of_speech: adj.: 熱心的，熱衷的，深切的[（+on）][+to-v]；渴望的，極想的[F][（+on）][+to-v]
sentences: Mrs. Miller is very keen on art. 米勒太太對藝術很感興趣。
She is very keen to visit Canada. 她渴望訪問加拿大。
His eyes were still keen. 他的目光依然敏銳。
He handed me a knife with a keen edge. 他遞給我一把鋒利的刀。

other_types: 過去式：kept   過去分詞：kept   現在分詞：keeping
part_of_speech: vt.: （長期或永久）持有，保有；（一時）擁有；保管
vi.: 保持著某一狀態[Q][L]；（食物）保持不壞
n.: 生活費，生計[U]；【史】要塞；堡壘中最強固的部分[C]
sentences: I kept it all the time to remind me of you. 我一直保存著它，以此喚起我對你的記憶。
Please keep the watch for me while I go swimming. 我去游泳，請代我保管這表。
We keep food in a refrigerator. 我們把食物存放在冰箱裡。
Those toys kept the children amused. 那些玩具使孩子們玩得很開心。
She kept the child quiet. 她讓孩子別作聲。
Mother keeps the house. 母親料理家務。
Everyone must keep the law. 每個人都必須守法。
Robbie couldn't keep the child from yelling. 羅比沒法使孩子不大叫大嚷。
Mary keeps a diary. 瑪麗天天記日記。
He needs more money to keep his wife and children. 他需要更多的錢來撫養妻子兒女。
She keeps a maid. 她僱一個女佣人。
They kept a small hotel in the town. 他們在城裡開了一家小旅店。
He has kept goal for our team. 他一直是我們隊的守門員。
They keep Christmas as well as Spring Festival in their house. 他們家既過春節，也過耶誕節。
Please keep quiet. 請保持安靜。
Will this food keep in hot weather? 這種食品在熱天能經久不壞嗎？
The child kept asking me questions. 這孩子老是問我問題。
Sorry to disturb you, but this problem won't keep. 對不起，打擾你了，可是這個問題急待處理。
Just where she kept in Boston is unknown to history. 她在波士頓到底住在什麼地方，歷史上無人知曉。

other_types: 過去式：knocked   過去分詞：knocked   現在分詞：knocking
part_of_speech: vi.: 相撞，碰擊[（+against）]；敲，擊，打[（+on/at）]
vt.: 敲，擊，打[O]；擊（撞）成……[O][O8]
n.[C]: 敲；擊，打；【口】不幸；挫折；艱苦
sentences: His legs knocked against the chair. 他的兩條腿撞到了椅子。
He knocked at the door and entered. 他敲了敲門便走進去了。
The falling bottle knocked him on the head. 跌落的瓶子砸在他的頭上。
The blow knocked her senseless. 那一擊把她打昏了。
The critic knocked her latest novel. 那位批評家貶損她最新的那部小說。
When I fell I got a terrible knock on the head. 我摔倒時頭撞得很厲害。
We have to take certain knocks in life. 我們在一生中總得遭受某些挫折。

other_types: 過去式：knew   過去分詞：known   現在分詞：knowing
part_of_speech: vt.: 知道；了解；懂得[O2][+（that）][+wh-]；認識；熟悉
vi.[W]: 知道；了解，懂得[（+about/of）]
sentences: I knew she was against us. 我知道她反對我們。
We have known each other for many years. 我們相互認識多年了。
I know right from wrong. 我能辨別是非。
I have known hunger and hardships. 我經歷過飢餓和困苦。
I have never known him to lie. 我從沒有聽說過他撒謊。
He knows five languages. 他精通五種語言。
There is one or two things I'd like to know about. 有一兩件事我很想知道。

part_of_speech: n.: 知識，學識，學問[U][S][（+of）]；知道，了解；消息[U]
sentences: A little knowledge is a dangerous thing. 一知半解是很危險的事。
My knowledge of Mr. Reed is not very great. 我對理德先生的了解不是很多。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有知識的，博學的；有見識的[（+on/about）]
sentences: John is very knowledgeable about classical music. 約翰對古典音樂有豐富的知識。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 貼紙；標籤；商標；標記，符號
vt.: 貼標籤於；用籤條標明[O8][O9]；把……稱為，把……列為，把……歸類為[O8][O9][（+as）]
sentences: All the sale items had special labels. 所有減價品都有特殊標籤。
Tom has been given the label of playboy by his friends. 湯姆被他的朋友們稱為花花公子。
We labelled the box before we sent it by train. 在送上火車前，我們給箱子貼上了標籤。
These people are often labeled as work-shy. 這些人常被歸入「怕工作」的一類。
The boy was labeled a troublemaker. 這男孩被人稱作搗蛋鬼。

part_of_speech: n.: 勞動[U]；勞工，勞方[U][G]
vi.: 勞動；艱苦地幹活；努力；盡力爭取[（+at/for/over）]
vt.: 過分詳盡闡述；【古】耕作
adj.: 勞工的；工會的；（常大寫）（英國或英聯邦國家）工黨的
sentences: All wealth comes ultimately from human labor. 一切財富歸根到底來源於人類的勞動。
The country is short of skilled labor. 這個國家缺乏熟練工人。
The woman is in labor. 這位婦女在分娩。
He is satisfied with your labors. 他對你幹的活兒很滿意。
She labored ten years on that book. 那本書她足足寫了十年。
He labored in the mines for 30 years. 他在礦場裡辛勤工作了三十年。
The editor labored over the manuscript till early morning. 編輯辛辛苦苦修改稿件直到清晨。
The train labored up the hill. 火車艱難地向山坡上行駛。
Don't labor the point; we all know what you mean. 這一點不用多講了；我們都知道你的意思。

other_types: 過去式：lacked   過去分詞：lacked   現在分詞：lacking
part_of_speech: vt. : 缺少；沒有；需要
vi.: 缺少；不足；沒有[（+for）]
n.: 欠缺；不足；沒有[U][S1][（+of）]；缺少的東西；需要的東西[C]
sentences: I don't seem to lack anything. 我好像什麼也不缺。
They lacked for nothing. 他們什麼都不缺少。
He can not buy it because of his lack of money. 他因缺錢買不起這個。
Water is a lack of this region. 這個地區缺水。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 房東；（旅館，家庭公寓等的）主人，老板；地主
sentences: Do you pay your landlord a fixed charge for heating? 你是不是付給你的房東固定的取暖費？
Local landlords drove them off their plots. 當地的地主將他們從他們的土地上趕走。

part_of_speech: n.: 【電腦】筆記型電腦；膝上型輕便電腦
sentences: Laptop is suitable for use on planes. 膝上型電腦適合飛機上使用。

other_types: 過去式：launched   過去分詞：launched   現在分詞：launching
part_of_speech: vt.: 使（船）下水；發射；投擲；使升空
vi.: 開始；積極投入；猛力展開[（+into）]；（船）下水；出海；起飛
n.[t: （船的）下水；發射；發行；投放市場
sentences: The new ship was launched today. 新船今天下水了。
The coach taught us how to launch a javelin. 教練教我們投標槍。
The miners launched a strike. 礦工發動了一場罷工。
We launched a new project. 我們開始發起一個新計劃。
Father and his partner launched into a new business. 父親與他的合夥人開辦了一家新商號。
Our ship launched for Boston. 我們的船啟航駛往波士頓。
the launch of a rocket 火箭的發射

part_of_speech: n.: 法，法律[the S]；（個別的）法律，法規[C][（+against）]
sentences: That is against the law. 那是違反法律的。
The Congress passed a new bankruptcy law. 國會通過了一項新的破產法。
Do you know the laws of the game? 你知道這項比賽的規則嗎？
He is interested in the laws of nature. 他對自然界法則很有興趣。
He studies law. 他研究法學。
He plans to enter the law. 他打算做律師。
I'll take him to law. 我將與他對簿公堂。
The law arrived on the scene of murder. 警察來到謀殺現場。

part_of_speech: ph.: 解僱; 停止使用；停止騷擾
sentences: One of the leading works in the district has been laid off because of the strike. 該區一家主要工廠因罷工而停了產。
500 men were laid off work when the factory closed after the fire. 工廠失火關閉後, 有500人被解僱。
Lay me off, can't you? 請別打擾我行不行？
Lay off him! can't you see he's badly hurt? 別碰他!你沒看見他傷得很厲害嗎?

part_of_speech: n.: 漏洞，裂縫[C]；（水，瓦斯等的）漏出；漏出物；漏電[C]
vt.: 使滲漏；洩漏（祕密等）[（+out/to）]
vi.: 漏，滲[（+out）]；（消息等）洩漏出去[（+out）]
sentences: The rain dripped down from a leak in the roof. 雨水從屋頂的裂縫中滴漏下來。
I can smell a leak of gas. 我嗅到洩漏的瓦斯。
The leak of information was officially inspired. 這一情報的洩漏是官方授意的。
The car is leaking oil. 這汽車在漏油。
He denied that he had leaked the news to the press. 他否認曾將這則消息洩漏給新聞界。
The faucet is leaking. 水龍頭在漏水。
Your secret appears to have leaked out. 看來你的祕密已經洩漏出去了。

other_types: 動詞變化：leaned /  leant / leaned /  leant / leaning
part_of_speech: vi.: 傾斜；傾身，屈身
vt.: 使傾斜；把……靠在（某種東西上）[O][（+on/upon/against）]
n.: 傾斜；傾向[S]
sentences: They came to Pisa and saw the leaning tower. 他們來到了比薩也看到了斜塔。
She leaned down to hear the child. 她彎下身子聽孩子說話。
Mr. Ford went to his window and leaned out. 福特先生走向窗口，把身子探出窗外。
She leaned lightly against his shoulder. 她輕輕地靠在他的肩上。
We lean on our friends when we are in trouble. 我們遇到困難時依靠朋友幫助。
He leans politically towards conservation. 他在政治上傾向於保守主義。
Lean your head on my shoulder. 把你的頭靠在我的肩膀上。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 租約，租契；租賃；租賃權
vt.: 出租（土地等）[（+out）]；租得（土地等）[（+from）]；長期租用
vi.: 出租
sentences: The lease on this house expires at the end of the year. 這房子的租約年底到期。
He leased his apartment to his friend. 他將他的房間租給他的朋友。
As we don't have money to buy a new house, we have to lease one. 因為我們沒有錢買一棟新房，所以我們只好長期租用。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 閒暇，空暇時間；悠閒，安逸
adj.: 空閒的；業餘的；有閒的，不以工作為生的
sentences: I have no leisure for playing cards. 我沒有閒暇玩牌。
What do you usually do in your leisure time? 你通常在空閒時間做些什麼？
the leisure class 有閒階級

other_types: 過去式：lent   過去分詞：lent   現在分詞：lending
part_of_speech: vt.: 把……借給[O1]；貸（款）
vi.: 貸款
sentences: Who lent you the bike? 誰借給你這輛自行車？
Could you lend me your dictionary? 你能把字典借給我嗎？
He used to lend money at an extremely high rate of interest. 他過去經常放高利貸。
The appropriate use of dialect lent the novel great charm. 方言的適當運用給這本小說增添了極大的魅力。

part_of_speech: n.: 傾向[U][（+to）]；責任，義務[U][C][（+for）][+to-v]
sentences: my liability to bad colds 我容易得重感冒
He admitted his liability for the accident. 他承認自己對這起事故應負責任。
Lack of education was a liability in getting a job. 缺少教育對找工作不利。
Heavy liabilities forced the company into bankruptcy. 沉重的債務迫使公司破產。
Our company thinks that he is an asset rather than a liability. 我們公司認為，他是個資產而不是個累贅。

part_of_speech: n.: 許可，特許[U]；許可證；執照，牌照[C][+to-v]
vt.: 許可，准許；發許可證給[O2][（+for）]
sentences: We are applying for a license to sell wine. 我們正申請執照賣酒。
We must make a distinction between freedom and license. 我們必須把自由和放縱區分開來。
The restaurant is not licensed for selling spirits. 這家飯店沒有賣烈酒的許可證。

other_types: 過去式：lay   過去分詞：lain   現在分詞：lying
part_of_speech: vi.: （人，動物）躺，臥；（東西）被平放[Q]；呈……狀態，置於[L]
n.: 位置；狀態[S1]；棲息處[C]
sentences: His hat and gloves were lying on the table. 他的帽子和手套都放在桌上。
He lay down for a rest. 他躺下休息一會。
