The whole city lay in ruins after the earthquake. 地震之後整個城市成了一片廢墟。
I have lain awake all night thinking of them. 我心裡想著他們，徹夜未眠。
The remedy lies in education. 補救的辦法在於教育。
Japan lies to the east of China. 日本在中國的東面。
The city lies before us. 城市展現在我們面前。
Here lies the king of England. 這裡葬著英國國王。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有限的，不多的[（+in/to）]；【美】（火車、巴士等）特快的
n.: 【美】（火車等的）特快車[C]；limit的動詞過去式、過去分詞
sentences: a man of limited ability 能力不強的人
limited in resources 資源有限
a limited express 特快車
limited monarchy 君主立憲政體

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 大型豪華轎車；大轎車；【美】（機場、車站等接送旅客的）小型巴士
sentences: a bulletproof limousine 一輛防彈大型豪華轎車
an airport limousine 機場小型巴士

part_of_speech: n.: 表；名冊；目錄[C]
vt.: 把……編列成表，把……編入目錄；列舉
sentences: His name was dropped from the list. 他的名字被從名單上除去了。
These names are to be listed in the catalog. 這些名字將列入目錄。
Mother listed the items she wanted to buy. 母親把她想買的東西列出清單。
The reasons are listed below. 理由列舉如下。

part_of_speech: n.: （總稱）家畜
n.: 借出；借出的東西[U][C]；貸款[C]
vt.: 【主美】借出，貸與[O1]
vi.: 【主美】借出
sentences: May we have the loan of your ladder? 我們可以借用一下你的梯子嗎？
The bank made a loan of ten thousand pounds to the factory. 銀行貸給那家工廠一萬英鎊。
He loaned me twenty dollars. 他借給我二十元。
The bank loaned to good customers. 銀行貸款給有信譽的顧客。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: （劇場，旅館等的）大廳；門廊；（英國下院的）會客室，休息室
vt.: 對（議員等）進行遊說（或疏通）[O2]；施加壓力（或影響）使（議案等）得以通過[（+through）]
vi.: 對議員遊說；從事幕後活動[（+for/against）]
sentences: I met him in a hotel lobby last Monday. 上星期一我在一家旅館的休息廳見到他。
We lobbied the members of parliament. 我們對國會議員進行了遊說。
lobby a bill through the Senate 施加壓力使法案得以通過參議院
They lobbied on the environmental protection issue. 他們就環境保護問題在議員中進行了遊說。

part_of_speech: adj.: 地方性的；當地的，本地的；鄉土的，狹隘的
n.[C]: 當地居民，本地人[P]；【美】【口】（報紙上的）本地新聞；地方性節目
sentences: He works at the local post office. 他在本地的郵局工作。
Local conditions must be taken into account in mapping out the plan. 在制訂計畫時必須考慮當地的情況。
The doctor thinks local anesthesia will do for the operation. 醫生認為這次手術用局部麻醉就可以了。
Only the local train stops at my station. 我那個車站只有普通列車會停。
One of the locals showed me the way to the post office. 一位本地人給我指點去郵局的路。

other_types: 過去式：located   過去分詞：located   現在分詞：locating
part_of_speech: vt.: 確定……的地點（或範圍）；把……設置在[O]
vi.: 【美】【口】定居[Q]
sentences: The company located its branch office in the suburbs. 該公司把它的分公司設在郊區。
The museum is located on Main Street. 博物館位於梅茵街。
The police are trying to locate the missing man. 警方正設法查明那個失蹤者的下落。
After I retire I'm going to locate in California. 退休後我打算在加州定居。

part_of_speech: ph.: 【電腦】註冊, 登記(接通數據庫等作聯機存取)
ph.: 【電腦】登出(關閉數據庫等結束聯機存取)

other_types: 比較級：more loyal   最高級：most loyal
part_of_speech: adj.: 忠誠的，忠心的[（+to）]
sentences: She was loyal to her faith. 她忠於自己的信念。
He is loyal to his wife. 他對妻子很忠誠。

part_of_speech: n.: 【主英】行李[U]
sentences: They had left the luggage at the station. 他們將行李留在車站。

part_of_speech: adj.: 奢侈的；驕奢淫逸的；豪華的；非常舒適的；精選的
sentences: luxurious tastes 奢侈的愛好
They stayed in luxurious hotels. 他們住在豪華的旅館裡。

part_of_speech: n.: 奢侈，奢華[U]；奢侈品[C]
sentences: They live in luxury. 他們生活奢華。
A refrigerator was then a luxury. 那時候冰箱是種奢侈品。
She enjoyed the luxury of doing good. 她以行善為樂事。

other_types: 過去式：maintained   過去分詞：maintained   現在分詞：maintaining
part_of_speech: vt.: 維持；保持；使繼續；維修，保養
sentences: Ann and Mary maintained their friendship for the next thirty years. 安妮和瑪麗在此後的三十年中一直保持著她們之間的友誼。
Frank maintains his car very well. 法蘭克把自己的車子保養得很好。
He maintains that he once saw a UFO. 他堅持稱自己曾看見過飛碟。
Mr. Smith maintains his son at college. 史密斯先生供養念大學的兒子。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 維持，保持；維修，保養
sentences: The maintenance of law and order is of vital importance. 法律與秩序的維持是至關重要的。
Who is responsible for the building's maintenance? 誰負責這座大樓的保養事宜？
She worked hard to earn money for the maintenance of her family. 她賣力幹活為了掙錢養家糊口。

part_of_speech: adj.: （數量大小稱度等）較大的；較多的；較大範圍的；主要的，重要的；一流的[B]
n.[C]: 成年人，已到法定年齡者；重要人物；才能卓越者，地位優越者
vi.: [主美] 主修 [（+in）]
sentences: The major part of the audience was laughing. 大部分觀眾在笑。
The house needs major repairs. 這幢房子需要大修。
He is a major writer. 他是位大作家。
Her major subject is chemistry. 她的主修科目是化學。
Minor poets are legion; the majors are few and far between. 二三流的詩人不計其數；大詩人則寥寥無幾，多少年才出一個。
His major is chemistry. 他的主修科目是化學。
Physics was his major. 物理是他的主修科目。
Are most of you English majors? 你們大多數都是英語主修生嗎？
He is a mathematics major. 他是主修數學的學生。
the scale of C major C大調音階
MGM, Paramount, and Columbia are all majors in film industry. 米高梅、派拉蒙和哥倫比亞都是電影業的大公司。
What do you plan to major in? 你準備主修什麼科？
Alice majors in economics. 愛麗絲主修經濟學。

other_types: 過去式：managed   過去分詞：managed   現在分詞：managing
part_of_speech: vt.: 管理；經營；處理；控制；照管；駕馭
vi.: 管理；經營生意；處理事務；設法應付過去
sentences: He manages a hotel for his father. 他替他父親經營一家旅館。
She doesn't know how to manage her naughty children. 她不知道怎樣管好自己的頑皮孩子。
Can the child manage chopsticks now? 孩子會用筷子了嗎？
I couldn't manage 2 weeks' holiday this year. 今年我不能安排兩週的假期。
I can't manage another mouthful. 我一口也吃不下了。
How did you manage to get their approval? 你怎麼得到他們的同意的？
Who will manage while the boss is away? 老板不在時誰來管理？
He had such a great deal of work to do, but somehow he managed. 他手頭的工作實在太多，但他還是應付得來。

part_of_speech: adj.: 管理人的；經理的；管理方面的
adj.: 義務的；強制的；命令的；指令的
n.: 受託者；代理者
sentences: In many countries, it is mandatory for a young man aged 18 to enlist in the army, 在許多國家中，一個年輕男子到了十八歲就必須要去從軍。

sentences: There is not a mechanic or technician who hasn't had this problem. 沒有一個機工或技師不碰到這樣的問題。

part_of_speech: n.: 藥物治療；藥物

sentences: Why did the patient refuse to take the medicine? 那個病人為什麼不肯服藥？

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 會議；集會；會；參加者，與會者[the S][G]

sentences: apply for membership 申請入會

part_of_speech: n.: 【口】= memorandum

If this product is properly merchandised, it should sell very well. 這一產品如果促銷得當，該是很暢銷的。

part_of_speech: n.: 【古】【書】淺湖；池[C]
sentences: Sometimes on lonely mountain meres, I find a magic bark. 偶而在孤寂荒涼的山間小湖，我覓得一隻神奇的小帆船。

other_types: 過去式：merged   過去分詞：merged   現在分詞：merging
part_of_speech: vt.: 使（公司等）合併；使融合；使同化
vi.: （公司等）合併；融合；同化
sentences: It was decided that the two businesses should be merged. 人們決定應把這兩爿商店合併起來。
Our bank merged with theirs. 我們的銀行與他們的合併了。
The two lanes merge going into the tunnel. 兩條車道會合後引入隧道。

part_of_speech: n.: （公司等的）合併[C][U][（+between/of/with）]
sentences: There are rumors of a merger involving several major railroad companies. 據說幾家主要的鐵路公司要合併了。

part_of_speech: n.: 總英里數[U][C]；（平均每單位燃料的）行駛哩數[U][C]
sentences: a used car with a low mileage 行駛總哩數不多的二手車

The newspapers are getting a lot of mileage out of the accident. There's a new story about it every day. 報紙對那次事故大做文章，每天刊登一篇新的報導。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 百萬；百萬元（鎊，美元，法郎等）；無數[P]
adj.: 百萬的；數百萬的，無數的
sentences: He has millions of books. 他有許多許多書。

There are five million permanent residents in the city. 這個城市有五百萬常住居民。

part_of_speech: vt.: 誤聽；聽錯
vi.: 誤解所聽之言；聽錯

other_types: 過去式：misrepresented   過去分詞：misrepresented   現在分詞：misrepresenting

vi.: 虛偽陳述
n.[C]: 【電腦】顯示器；螢幕；（學校的）班長，級長
vt.: 監控；監聽；監測；監視
vi.: 監控；監聽；監測；監視
sentences: an attendance monitor 檢查學生出席情況的班長

The nurse monitored the patient's condition carefully. 護士很細心地監察病人的狀況。
It is said that the police monitored his phone calls during that period. 據說警方在那段時間監聽了他的電話。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 紀念碑，紀念塔，紀念館[（+to）]；歷史遺跡，遺址
sentences: This monument was erected in memory of F.D. Roosevelt. 這座碑是為紀念F.D.‧羅斯福而建立的。

Shakespeare's plays remain as monuments to his genius. 莎士比亞的戲劇是他天才的不朽著作。

part_of_speech: n.: 抵押[U][C]；抵押借款[C]
vt.: 抵押[（+to/for）]；【口】以……作擔保，把……許給[（+to）]
sentences: The bank refused to accept any mortgage on land. 銀行拒絕接受任何土地抵押。

The house was mortgaged to the bank for fifty thousand dollars. 這所房子抵押給銀行借得五萬元。
Faust mortgaged his soul to the devil. 浮士德將其靈魂獻給魔鬼。

other_types: 過去式：motivated   過去分詞：motivated   現在分詞：motivating
part_of_speech: vt.: 給……動機；刺激；激發
n.: 刺激；推動；積極性；幹勁
n.[C]: 餐巾；小毛巾
sentences: She handed him a napkin. 她遞給他一條餐巾。

part_of_speech: adj.: 狹的，狹窄的；範圍狹小的
vt.: 使變窄；限制；縮小（範圍等）[（+down）]

part_of_speech: n.: 鄰近地區[C]；近鄰，整個街坊[the S][G]

They live in good neighborhood with one another. 他們鄰里關係十分和睦。

part_of_speech: n.: 網眼織物[C][U]；網狀物；網狀系統[C]
vt.: 用網覆蓋；在廣播網（或電視網）聯播
sentences: They have developed marketing networks. 他們已經形成了一個銷售網路。
The President's speech was broadcast on a national television network. 總統演說由全國電視網聯播。
They have made a decision about which programmes are to be networked. 關於哪些節目將被聯播他們已作出了決定。

other_types: 過去式：nominated   過去分詞：nominated   現在分詞：nominating
part_of_speech: vt.: 提名[（+for/as）][O2]；任命，指定[（+to/as）][O2]
sentences: The President nominated him Ambassador to Russia. 總統提名他擔任駐俄國大使。
Trade Unions nominate representatives to public bodies. 工會指定駐公共機關的代表。

part_of_speech: n.: 提名；任命[C][U]；提名權；任命權[U]
sentences: Competition for the nomination was very keen. 爭取提名的競爭非常激烈。

part_of_speech: n.: 公告，通知，貼示[C]；警告；預先通知[U]
vt.: 注意，注意到[W][O3][+v-ing][+wh-][+（that）]；通知
vi.: 引起注意
sentences: They have received notice of a typhoon approaching. 他們已收到颱風即將來臨的預報。
His special talents attracted my notice. 他特殊的才幹引起了我的注意。
The new play received poor notices. 這齣新戲反應很差。
She didn't notice that I had entered the room. 她沒有看到我已經走進屋裡。
I noticed him winking at his brother. 我察覺他對他兄弟眨眼示意。
The plane was noticed to take off at six o'clock. 飛機接到通知六時起飛。
The incident was noticed in a magazine. 這一事件在一份雜誌裡述及。

other_types: 過去式：notified   過去分詞：notified   現在分詞：notifying
part_of_speech: vt.: 通知，告知；報告[（+of）][O2][+that]；【主英】公布
sentences: She notified us that she would accept the position. 她通知我們，她願意接受這份工作。
He notified the police of the incident. 他向警察報告了這個事件。
The sale was notified in the newspapers. 減價出售的公告刊登在報紙上。

part_of_speech: n.: 反對；異議；不喜歡[C][U][（+to/against）]；缺點[U][（+to）]
sentences: Nobody raised any objection to my doing it right now. 沒人反對我現在就做這件事。
I have no objection to their plan. 我不反對他們的計畫。
The chief objection to the essay is its inappropriate use of special jargons. 這篇文章的主要缺點是專門術語用得不當。
We have overcome every objection and completed the mission on time. 我們排除了各種障礙，並按時完成了任務。
Father's objection was that the trip was much too expensive. 父親的反對理由是，作這樣一次旅行費用太大。

other_types: 比較級：more objective   最高級：most objective
part_of_speech: adj.: 客觀存在的[Z]；客觀的，如實的，無偏見的
n.[C]: 目的，目標；（顯微鏡等的）物鏡
sentences: the objective reality 客觀現實
A judge must give an objective opinion. 評判員必須發表公正的意見。
an objective symptom 他覺症狀
A college education is my objective. 我的目標是獲得大學教育。

part_of_speech: n.: （道義上或法律上的）義務；責任[C][U][（+to）][+to-v]；恩惠[C][（+to/toward）]
sentences: We were under obligation to finish the work in a satisfactory way. 我們有義務圓滿地完成工作。
You are under no obligation to buy the house if you have not signed a purchase agreement. 如果你沒有簽訂購買合同，就不一定非買這房子不可。
I will take care that my obligations to you shall be amply repaid. 我一定會加倍報答您對我的恩惠。
The builder failed to fulfill the terms of his obligation. 營造商未能履行合同的條款。
The lawyer drew up a legal paper discharging him from all obligations. 律師擬定了一份法律文件，免除他所有的債務款項。

other_types: 過去式：obliged   過去分詞：obliged   現在分詞：obliging
part_of_speech: vt.: 使不得不，迫使[H][O2]；施恩於；答應……的請求
vi.: 施恩惠，幫忙
sentences: I was obliged to abandon that idea. 我不得不放棄那個想法。
The scandal obliged the minister to resign. 這一醜聞迫使部長辭職。
Please oblige me by turning down the radio. 勞您駕，請替我把收音機音量調低一些。
We're much obliged to you for your information. 我們很感謝你提供的消息。
Will you oblige with another song? 請再唱支歌，好嗎？

other_types: 過去式：obtained   過去分詞：obtained   現在分詞：obtaining
part_of_speech: vt.: 得到，獲得
vi.: 得到公認；通用；流行；存在
sentences: He failed to obtain a scholarship. 他沒有獲得獎學金。
They obtained a loan from the government. 他們從政府那裡得到一筆貸款。
Those conditions no longer obtain. 那些情形已不存在。
The custom still obtains in some areas. 某些地區仍保留著這一習俗。

part_of_speech: adv.: 明顯地；顯然地
sentences: One of the beds had obviously been slept in. 其中一張床明顯有人睡過。
Obviously I don't need to say how important this project is. 很顯然，我用不著多講這個工程是多麼重要。

part_of_speech: n.: 工作，職業[C]；消遣；日常事務[C][U]
sentences: He is a bus driver by occupation. 他的職業是公車司機。
He was bored for lack of occupation. 他因無所事事而感到厭煩。
The Japanese occupation of Taiwan lasted fifty-one years. 日本佔領臺灣達五十一年之久。
No one is yet in occupation of the house. 這所房子還沒有人住進去。

other_types: 過去式：occurred   過去分詞：occurred   現在分詞：occurring
part_of_speech: vi.: 發生；出現；存在；被發現[Q]
sentences: Earthquakes occur frequently in this area. 這一地區經常發生地震。
Do giraffes occur in Africa only? 長頸鹿是不是只在非洲才有？
It occurred to me to visit my teacher. 我想到要去看看我的老師。
It never occurred to me that he might be in trouble. 我怎麼也沒有想到他會遇上麻煩。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 軍官；公務員，官員；幹事，高級職員
vt.: 給……配備軍官（或高級船員）；指揮，統率
sentences: The officers live here, and the enlisted men over there. 軍官住在這裡，士兵住在那裡。
Bank officers are well-paid. 銀行高級職員薪金高。
A police officer came to our help when our car broke down on the way. 我們的汽車在路上出了毛病，一位警官幫了我們忙。
a first officer 大副
The army was officered by brave men. 這支軍隊是由勇敢的人指揮的。

part_of_speech: adj.: 官員的；公務上的；官方的，法定的；正式的
n.[C]: 官員，公務員；（公司，團體的）高層職員，幹事
sentences: The President's official duties include being Commander in Chief. 總統的職責包括擔任總司令。
Is the news official? 這消息是官方發布的嗎？
His official airs offended her. 他那付官架子令她十分不快。
The mayor is an elected official. 市長是選舉產生的官員。
He is an official at the local bank. 他是這家地方銀行的高級職員。

part_of_speech: adv.: 向前；在前面
adj.: 向前的，前進的[B]
sentences: The world is moving onward. 世界正向前發展。
Miss Weller hurried onward. 韋勒小姐匆匆向前走去。
The plane's onward movement was slowed by adverse winds. 飛機前進的速度因逆風而減慢。

other_types: 過去式：operated   過去分詞：operated   現在分詞：operating
part_of_speech: vi.: 作出，工作；運作；運轉；營業，營運[Q]
vt.: 操作；開動（機器等）；經營；管理
sentences: The machine is not operating properly. 機器運轉得不正常。
His company operates in several countries. 他的公司在幾個國家有業務活動。
The medicine operated quickly. 這藥很快起作用。
The surgeon operated on her for a tumor. 醫生為她的腫瘤開刀。
Who operates that machine? 那臺機器由誰操作？
The department store is well operated. 那家百貨公司經營得法。
He'll have to be operated for his tumors. 他的腫瘤得開刀。

part_of_speech: n.: 操作；運轉[U]；經營；營運[U]
sentences: The operation of this machine is simple. 這個機器的操作很簡單。
The operation of a railroad needs many men. 鐵路的營運需要很多人。
The operation of natural law is constant. 自然法則的作用是永恆的。
The rescue operation lasted three days. 救援活動持續了三天。
Her father underwent a major operation last week. 她父親上週動了一次大手術。
The general was in command of operations in the north. 將軍負責指揮北方的作戰行動。
He continued his operations in cotton futures. 他繼續進行棉花期貨交易。

part_of_speech: n.: 意見，見解；主張[C][U][（+of/on/about）]；評價[S]
sentences: Opinions differ on this matter. 對這件事各人看法不一。
Opinion is shifting in favor of the President's new policy. 輿論正轉向支持總統的新政策。

part_of_speech: n.: 機會；良機[C][U][（+of/for）][+to-v]
sentences: There may be an opportunity for you to see the chairman of the board tomorrow. 明天你也許有機會見到董事長。
Soon he had an opportunity of explaining that to her. 不久他便有了向她解釋那件事的機會。

part_of_speech: adj.: 樂觀的
n.: 順序，次序[U]；整齊，有條理[U]
vt.: 命令；指揮[O2][+（that）]；定購；叫（菜或飲料）[O1][（+for）]
vi.: 下命令，指揮；定購；點菜
sentences: The names are in alphabetical order. 名字按字母順序排列。
Things were in terrible order. 情況一團糟。
The young teacher can't keep order in her classroom. 那位年輕教師無法維持課堂秩序。
He gave orders that the job be done in three days. 他指示三天內完成這項工作。
The company received a large order for computers. 這家公司接到一份數量很大的電腦訂單。
The mayor ordered that free food be distributed. 市長命令發放免費食品。
The judge ordered the prisoner (to be) transferred to the county jail. 法官命令將這囚犯轉押縣監獄。
Please order me a copy. 請給我定購一本。

part_of_speech: n.: 組織，機構，團體[C]；組織工作；體制，編制[U][C]
sentences: It is a non-profit organization. 這是一個非營利性的組織。
He is engaged in the organization of a new club. 他正從事於組建一個新的俱樂部。
Efficiency depends on good organization. 高效率依賴於良好的組織。
The human body is a very complicated organization. 人體是一個非常複雜的有機體。

other_types: 過去式：organized   過去分詞：organized   現在分詞：organizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 組織；安排；把……組成工會
vi.: 組織工會；成立組織；形成有機體
sentences: We'll organize an oratorical contest. 我們將籌劃一次演說比賽。
They organized the truckers into a union. 他們把卡車司機組成工會。
The story is very well organized. 這個故事結構嚴謹。
He had trouble organizing himself as he aged. 他年事已高，很難高效率地工作。
Service workers also have the right to organize. 服務性行業人員也有權組織工會。

part_of_speech: adj.: 有組織的；有系統的；參加工會的
adj.: 最初的，本來的；原始的[Z][B]；有獨創性的；新穎的；奇特的
n.: 原物；原著；原畫；原版[C]；原著之語言；原文[the S]
sentences: The original price of the car was a bit too high. 這輛汽車的原價太高了一點。
He is an original dramatist. 他是個有獨創性的劇作家。
This is an original painting by Picasso. 這是一幅畢卡索的原作。
The original of this picture was nowhere to be found. 這幅畫的原作已無處尋覓。
He can read Shakespeare in the original. 他能讀莎士比亞作品的原文。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 外形；輪廓[（+of）]；略圖；素描[（+of）]
vt.: 畫出……的輪廓，畫……的略圖；概述，略述
sentences: The outline of Italy suggests a boot. 義大利的輪廓像一隻靴子。
Make an outline of the scene before you paint. 在上顏料之前先給此景畫一個素描。
These reports give an outline rather than the details. 這些報告只給了一個大綱，而沒有提供細節。
Outline a map of North America. 畫一幅北美的略圖。
He listened as I outlined my reasons. 他聽我扼要地敘述了我的理由。

part_of_speech: n.[S1]: 觀點，看法[（+on）]；展望，前景[（+for）]
vt.: 比……好看；用目光壓倒（對方）
vi.: 朝外看
sentences: The experience completely changed his outlook on life. 這一經歷徹底改變了他對生活的看法。
The economic outlook is bright. 經濟前景非常光明。
The room has a pleasant outlook. 這個房間外的景色宜人。
She is always on the outlook for a better opportunity. 她總是在留心尋找一個更好的機會。
His magnificent horse outlooked all the others in the race. 他那匹駿馬比參賽的其它所有的馬都要好看。

other_types: 比較級：more outstanding   最高級：most outstanding
part_of_speech: adj.: 凸出的；顯著的；傑出的；重要的
n.: 未償貸款；未清帳款[P]；outstand的動詞現在分詞、動名詞
sentences: outstanding ears 招風耳
She is an outstanding actress. 她是一個傑出的演員。
The outstanding debts must be paid by the end of the month. 未了的債務須在月底前償還。

part_of_speech: n.: 工作褲[P]；【英】工作服；防護服；（婦女，小孩，醫師，實驗室用的）罩衫[C]
adj.: 從頭到尾的，從一端到另一端的；總的，全部的，全面的
sentences: The laboratory worker in a white overall turned out to be the president's daughter. 那個穿白色罩衣的實驗室工作人員原來是總裁的女兒。
The overall length of the new bridge is 2,000 meters. 新橋全長兩千米。
The overall situation is worsening. 整體形勢在日益惡化。

part_of_speech: n.: 透支；透支數額
adv.: 在（或向）海外；在（或向）國外
adj.: （在）海外的；（在）國外的[Z][B]
sentences: an overseas market 國外市場

other_types: 過去式：overtimed   過去分詞：overtimed   現在分詞：overtiming
part_of_speech: vt.: 使超過時間
n.: 【美】概觀；概要；綜述

other_types: 過去式：owed   過去分詞：owed   現在分詞：owing
part_of_speech: vt.: 欠（債等）[（+to/for）][O1]；（應）感激[（+to）][O1]
vi.: 欠錢
sentences: I owe the landlord one hundred dollars./I owe one hundred dollars to the landlord. 我欠房東一百美元。
We owe a great deal to our parents. 我們深受父母之恩。
We owe to Newton the principle of gravitation. 我們全靠牛頓才知道引力的原理。
You owe yourself a holiday. 你應該給自己安排個假期。
I still owe for my car. 我還欠著買汽車的錢。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 包裹；包[（+of）]；包裝箱（盒，袋）
vt.: 把……打包；包裝[（+up）]
sentences: He undid the package. 他解開了那個包裹。
She is good at designing eye-catching packages. 她擅長設計花俏的包裝。
It is highly necessary to work out an emergency package. 制定一整套應急措施是非常必要的。
The cereal is packaged in plain boxes. 穀類食品用簡單的盒子包裝。

part_of_speech: ph.: 包辦旅行
n.[C]: 小包，包裹；（土地的）一塊，一片
vt.: 分；分配[（+out）]；把……包起來；捆紮[（+up）]
adj.: 部分的；兼職的
adv.: 【古】部分地
sentences: This parcel came in the mail today. 這個包裹是今天郵寄來的。
We bought two parcels of our neighbor's farm. 我們買了鄰居家農場的兩片地。
Their children were left to the ineffectual care of a parcel of servants. 他們的孩子留給了一幫佣人，得不到應有的照管。
The two big nations parceled out the little country between them. 這兩個大國把那個小國瓜分了。
She parceled some food for the boys to carry to their picnic. 她將一些食品包好給孩子們帶去野餐。
He was a jester and a parcel poet. 他是一個小丑，也是個業餘詩人。

part_of_speech: n.: 停車場[C]
sentences: Is there a parking lot nearby? 附近有停車場嗎？

part_of_speech: n.: 關係者；參與者
adj.: 參與的；有關係的
adv.: 特別，尤其；詳細地，詳盡地
sentences: I am particularly fond of her. 我特別喜歡她。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 乘客，旅客；【英】【口】（球隊等中）不積極的成員
sentences: This bus can carry 50 passengers. 這輛公車可載五十名乘客。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 專利；專利權；專利證書；專利品
adj.: 專利的；獲得專利的；有專利權的[B]；公開的；顯然的；明白的
vt.: 給予……專利權；取得……的專利權
sentences: Did you take out a patent on your design? 你是否取得一項設計的專利？
The first English patent for a typewriter was issued in 1714. 英國第一臺打字機專利證書是一七一四年頒發的。
a patent of intellectuality 知識分子的特徵
Try some of this new patent medicine. 試試這種新的專利藥物吧。
It was a patent impossibility. 這顯然是不可能。
The scientist patented her invention. 這位科學家得到她的發明的專利權。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 耐心；忍耐；耐性；毅力
sentences: She has reached the limit of her patience. 她已到了忍無可忍的地步。
Looking after children requires patience. 照料孩子需要耐心。

part_of_speech: n.: 支付，付款[U]；支付的款項（或實物）[C]
sentences: Full payment must be made before we get the new car. 我們在得到新汽車之前必須付清全部款項。
We made our last house payment today. 我們今天付了我們購房的最後一期款子。

other_types: 過去式：performed   過去分詞：performed   現在分詞：performing
part_of_speech: vt.: 履行；執行；完成；做；演出，表演，演奏
vi.: 演出，表演，演奏[（+on/at）]；（機器）運轉；（人）行動，表現[Q]
sentences: The young doctor performed the heart operation. 這位年輕醫生為病人做了心臟手術。
They always perform their duties faithfully. 他們總是忠實地履行自己的職責。
The students will perform an opera next Friday. 這些學生下星期五將演出歌劇。
The soloist had never performed in London before. 那位獨唱者過去從未在倫敦演出過。
Our team performed well in the match yesterday. 我隊在昨天的比賽中表現得很出色。

part_of_speech: n.: 演出；演奏；表演[C]；履行；實行；完成[U][（+of）]
sentences: The evening performance begins at 8 o'clock. 晚上的演出八點開始。
He failed completely in the performance of his duty. 他完全沒有履行他的職責。
The novel was rated a brilliant performance. 這部小說被認為是一部出色的作品。
Engineers will test the performance of the tires. 工程師們將測試這些輪胎的性能。

other_types: 比較級：more permanent   最高級：most permament
part_of_speech: adj.: 永久的，永恆的；永遠的；固定性的；常在的
n.: 【口】燙髮[C]
sentences: Nature is permanent. 自然是永恆的。
This is my permanent address. 這是我的固定地址。
She went to a beauty salon for a permanent. 她到美容院去燙了髮。

part_of_speech: n.: 允許，許可，同意[U][+to-v]
sentences: We have obtained permission from the directors to use some of our funds. 我們已得到董事的許可，可以動用部分資金。
You can't take photographs here without permission. 未經許可你們不能在此處拍照。

other_types: 過去式：permitted   過去分詞：permitted   現在分詞：permitting
part_of_speech: vt.: 允許，許可，准許[O1][+v-ing][O2]；（不用被動式，常用物做主詞）允許，容許
vi.: 允許，容許[（+of）]
sentences: They permitted her to leave. 他們允許她離開。
I don't think they would permit this. 我想他們不會准許這事。
These stores do not permit sales of alcoholic beverages. 這些商店不准出售含酒精飲料。
I will write another novel if my eyes permit. 如果我的視力許可，我還要再寫一本小說。
We'll discuss both questions if time permits. 如果時間允許，我們將把兩個問題都討論一下。

part_of_speech: adj.: 個人的，私人的[Z]；本人的，親自的[Z]
n.[C]: （報紙上的）人事消息欄；人稱代名詞
sentences: It's all a matter of personal taste. 這純粹是個人的興趣問題。
The plan was drawn up under the chief engineer's personal guidance. 這一方案是在總工程師的親自指導下制定的。
Frank is always making personal remarks about his cousin. 法蘭克老是對他表兄弟進行人身攻擊。
Our parents teach us personal tidiness. 我們的父母教育我們注意打扮整潔。

part_of_speech: n.[G]: （總稱）人員，員工；人事部門；人事課（或室等）[U]
sentences: All personnel of the company are eligible for the retirement plan. 公司所有員工都有資格參加這項退休計畫。
Please contact the personnel director for benefit information. 有關福利方面的情況請與人事課長聯繫。

other_types: 過去式：persuaded   過去分詞：persuaded   現在分詞：persuading
part_of_speech: vt.: 說服，勸服[（+into/out of）][O2]；使某人相信[（+of）][+that]
vi.: 被說服
sentences: She persuaded me into buying it. 她說服我買下了它。
The salesman persuaded us to buy his product. 那個推銷員說服了我們買他的產品。
How can I persuade you of my sincerity? 我怎樣才能使你相信我的誠意呢？
We worked hard to persuade them that we were genuinely interested in the project. 我們想盡辦法以使他們相信我們確實對這一計畫感興趣。
He persuades easily. 他很容易被說服。

other_types: 比較級：more pessimistic   最高級：most pessimistic
part_of_speech: adj.: 悲觀的；悲觀主義的
sentences: This is too pessimistic a view. 這一觀點太悲觀了。

part_of_speech: n.: 植物，農作物[C]；工廠；車間[C]
vt.: 栽種；播種[（+with）]；栽（贓）[（+on）]
sentences: These are perennial plants. 這些是多年生植物。
He works at a power plant. 他在發電廠工作。
We planted a lot of flowers in our garden. 我們在庭院裡種了很多花。
They have planted machine-guns at street crossings. 他們在十字路口設置了機槍。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 平臺，臺；講臺；戲臺
vt.: 把……放在臺上
vi.: （在臺上）演講
sentences: a helicopter landing platform 直升機升降平臺
The speaker mounted the platform. 演講者登上了講臺。
He was coming by train, so I waited on the platform. 他坐火車來，所以我在月臺上等。
She jumped off the platform while the bus was still moving. 公車還沒有停下，她就從門口跳了下去。
The candidate ran on a platform of better housing and equal rights for all. 那個候選人的政見是改善住屋，均等權利。

part_of_speech: adj.: 令人愉快的；舒適的；討人喜歡的；和藹可親的
sentences: The walk was very pleasant. 那次散步很愉快。
The new manager is a pleasant Chinese American. 新任經理是個和氣的美籍華人。

part_of_speech: n.: 犁[C]；似犁的工具；除雪機，剷雪機[C]
vt.: 犁，耕；用犁掘（畦），挖（溝，槽）
vi.: 犁地，耕地；可犁，可耕
sentences: Plows are still pulled by oxen in some countries. 在一些國家犁頭仍由牛拖拉。
Farmers now use tractors to plow their fields. 現今農民用牽引機耕地。
We plowed our way through the crowd. 我們用力從人群中擠過去。
Farmers plow in autumn or spring. 農民在秋天或春天犁地。
Our great ship plowed through the heavy waves. 我們的大船穿越洶湧的波浪航行。
We've plowed through all the documents related to the case. 我們費力地閱讀了所有有關此案的文件。

part_of_speech: ph.: 插上...的插頭以接通電源
sentences: Will you plug in the tape recorder for me? 請你替我把錄音機的插頭插上好嗎?

part_of_speech: n.: 尖，尖端，尖頭[C][（+of）]；（空間的）一點，處，地方，位置[C]
vt.: 把……指向，把……對準；瞄準[（+at/towards）]；指出[（+out）]
vi.: 指，指出，指明[（+at/to）]；指向，對準；朝向[Q][（+to/towards）]
sentences: Do you have a pencil with a sharper point? 你有尖一點的鉛筆嗎？
Dancing is not her strong point. 她不擅長跳舞。
In the game we got ten points while the Medical School got only three. 比賽中我們得了十分，而醫學院只得了三分。
He missed the whole point of my speech. 他完全沒抓住我演講的重點。
There is no point in complaining. They can't do anything to help you. 抱怨於事無補；他們沒辦法幫助你。
It's rude to point your fingers at people. 用手指指人是很不禮貌的。
He pointed out that they were mistaken. 他指出他們錯了。
She pointed the pencil for her sister. 她給妹妹削鉛筆。
He pointed at the book he wanted. 他指著他要的那一本書。
The hands of the clock now pointed to half past three. 這時鐘的指針指向三點半。

part_of_speech: adj.: 不尖的；不得要領的；無意義的
n.[C,U]: 政策，方針；策略，手段
sentences: One of the new government's policies is to cut taxes. 新政府的政策之一是減稅。
Honesty is the best policy. 誠實是上策。

other_types: 形變：politer, more polite,politest, most polite
part_of_speech: adj.: 有禮貌的，客氣的；殷勤的；斯文的，文雅的
sentences: He's always so polite to people. 他對人總是非常有禮貌。
polite society 上流社會
She is fond of polite literature. 她喜愛風雅文學。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 從事政治者，政治家；【貶】專搞黨派政治的人，政客
sentences: Politicians are busy near election time. 在接近選舉的時候政治家們都很忙。

part_of_speech: n.: 政治[U]；政治學[U]
sentences: Politics was one of his university subjects. 政治學是他大學的課程之一。
Einstein once said, Politics is much more difficult than physics. 愛因斯坦曾說，政治比物理更難。
I have no idea what her politics are. 我不知道她的政見如何。

part_of_speech: n.: 民意測驗，民調；民意測驗記錄[C]；投票，選舉[U][C]
vt.: 對……進行民意測驗；（候選人等）獲得（若干票數）
vi.: 投票[（+for）]
sentences: We are going to conduct a public opinion poll. 我們將進行民意測驗。
Women were excluded from the poll. 婦女被排斥，不讓參加選舉。
He was returned at the head of the poll. 他以得票最多而當選。
Few blacks went to the polls. 幾乎沒有黑人去投票選舉。
Your name is on the poll. 你的名字在選民冊上。
He scratched his grizzled poll. 他抓了抓他那頭髮花白的腦袋。
A majority of those polled were worried about inflation. 接受民意測驗中的大多數人擔心通貨膨脹。
He polled 54 percent of the votes. 他獲得百分之五十四的選票。
We polled the members about the change in rules. 我們就規則的變化請全體成員投票。

other_types: 過去式：polluted   過去分詞：polluted   現在分詞：polluting
part_of_speech: vt.: 汙染，弄髒；玷汙，敗壞
sentences: Garbage pollutes our rivers and lakes. 垃圾汙染我們的河川湖泊。
Our store never sells books which pollute the mind. 我們書店從不出售汙染心靈的書籍。

part_of_speech: adj.: 民眾的；大眾的[Z][B]；孚眾望的，得人心的，受歡迎的[（+with/among）]
sentences: Popular education is one of our major objectives. 民眾教育是我們的主要目標之一。
She is now a popular film star. 她現在是很受歡迎的影星。
Many young people love popular songs. 許多年輕人喜愛流行歌曲。
He writes for a journal of popular science. 他為一家大眾科學雜誌撰稿。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 普及，流行；大眾化；討人喜歡的特點；聲望[（+with/among）]
sentences: Golf has gained popularity among the wealthy in my country. 高爾夫球已在我國富有的人中流行起來。
the popularity of football 足球運動的普及
The comedian enjoyed great popularity during the 30's. 那位喜劇演員在三十年代非常走紅。

part_of_speech: n.: 位置，地點，方位[C]；恰當的位置[U]
vt.: 把……放在適當位置[O]；把（產品）打進市場
sentences: The bed used to be in this position. 床原來是放在這兒的。
He has a high position in society. 他社會地位很高。
He made a study of the position of the middle class in Britain. 他研究過英國中產階級的狀況。
What's your position on this problem? 你對這個問題持什麼態度？
She positioned the chairs round the dining table. 她在餐桌四周擺上椅子。

other_types: 過去式：postponed   過去分詞：postponed   現在分詞：postponing
part_of_speech: vt.: 使延期，延遲，延緩[（+to/until）][+v-ing]；把……放在次要地位
vi.: 延遲，延緩；（瘧疾等）延緩發作（或復發）
sentences: They postponed sending an answer to a request. 他們耽擱了對一項請求的答覆。
The concert has been postponed to Saturday. 音樂會延遲到星期六。
postpone private gain to the public welfare 把個人利益置於公眾福利之後

part_of_speech: n.: 延期；延緩
a.[Z]: 潛在的，可能的；【物】勢的，位的；電壓的
n.[U: 可能性；潛力，潛能[（+for）]；【物】勢，位；電勢，電位
sentences: The dispute has scared away potential investors. 這一爭端嚇走了潛在的投資者。
potential energy 勢能
She has acting potential, but she needs training. 她有表演潛力，但需要訓練。
A current of high potential is used in transmitting electric power over long distances. 高壓電流被用來遠距離輸送電力。

part_of_speech: n.: 權，政權；權力；勢力[S][（+over）]；職權；權限[C][U][+to-v]
vt.: 給……提供動力[H]
vi.: 【口】快速前進[Q]
adj.: 動力驅動的；權力的
sentences: The president has the power to veto bills. 總統有權否決議案。
She lost her power of speech. 她失去了說話的能力。
The shortage of power dimmed the streets. 由於電力不足，街道昏暗。
The world powers will meet in Paris this summer. 今夏世界上的大國將在巴黎聚會。
10 to the power of 3 is 1000. 十的三次方是一千。
The tractor is powered by a diesel engine. 這臺曳引機是用柴油機發動的。
power politics 權力政治
power lunch 權力午餐；巨擘午餐會

other_types: 比較級：more practical   最高級：most practical
part_of_speech: adj.: 實踐的，實際的；實用的，有實用價值的
sentences: Practical experience is often very important. 實際經驗往往是很重要的。
Your invention is very practical. 你的發明物很實用。
She was a simple, practical, hardworking woman. 她簡樸，實際，勤奮。
He gave sound and practical advice. 他提出了很好的，實際可行的建議。

part_of_speech: adv.: 【口】幾乎，差不多；實際上；事實上
sentences: The town was practically deserted. 該鎮幾乎已空無一人。
He is practically a dictator. 他實際上是個獨裁者。

other_types: 過去式：predicted   過去分詞：predicted   現在分詞：predicting
part_of_speech: vt.: 預言；預料；預報[+that][+wh-]
vi.: 作預言；作預料；作預報
sentences: He predicted that an earthquake was imminent. 他預言即將發生地震。
He predicted a good harvest. 他預言豐收。

other_types: 比較級：more predictable   最高級：most predictable
part_of_speech: adj.: 可預言的，可預料的；【貶】墨守陳規的
sentences: The outcome is not always predictable. 後果並非都可以預料。

other_types: 過去式：preferred   過去分詞：preferred   現在分詞：preferring
part_of_speech: vt.: 寧可，寧願（選擇）；更喜歡[+v-ing][+to-v][O2][+（that）]；【律】提出（控告等）
sentences: I prefer the quiet countryside to the noisy cities. 我喜歡安靜的鄉村勝過喧鬧的城市。
So you prefer living abroad? 那麼你是寧願旅居海外囉？
Police preferred charges against him for theft. 警方指控他有偷竊行為。
He preferred a charge against the robber. 他控告那名盜賊。

part_of_speech: n.: 更加的喜愛，偏愛[U][C][（+for）]；偏愛的事物（或人）[C]
sentences: A window seat is my preference. 我喜歡靠窗的座位。
We dress simply by preference. 我們僅憑個人偏愛選擇穿著。
Which is your preference, tea or coffee? 你喜歡喝哪一樣，茶還是咖啡？
Parents should not show preference for any one of their children. 父母不應流露出對任何一個孩子的偏心。
We give preference to applicants with some experience. 我們優先錄用有經驗的申請人。

part_of_speech: n.: 房宅（或辦公室）連全部建築及地基；生產場所，經營場址；premise的名詞複數

other_types: 過去式：prepared   過去分詞：prepared   現在分詞：preparing
part_of_speech: vt.: 準備；使……準備好[（+for）][O2]；籌備，籌劃[（+for）]
vi.: 準備，預備[（+for）][+to-v]
sentences: They prepared themselves for the worst. 他們作了最壞的打算。
When we arrived home, mother had already prepared dinner for us. 當我們到家時，母親已為我們準備好了晚餐。
I was preparing for bed when I heard a knock at the door. 我正準備睡覺時聽到有人敲門。

part_of_speech: adj.: 出席的，在場的[F]；現在的，當前的[B]
n.: 現在，目前[the S]；【文】現在時態[U][C]
sentences: How many people were present at the meeting? 到會的有多少人？
I'm not at all satisfied with the present situation. 我對目前的情況一點都不滿意。
There is no time like the present. 機不可失，時不再來。

part_of_speech: n.: 贈送；授予[U][C][（+of）]；贈送或授予的東西；禮物[C]
sentences: The presentation of prizes will begin at three o'clock. 頒獎儀式將在三點開始。
the presentation of evidence 提供證據
a theatrical presentation of Othello 戲劇《奧賽羅》的上演

other_types: 過去式：pressed   過去分詞：pressed   現在分詞：pressing
part_of_speech: vt.: 按，壓，擠；壓碎，壓破；榨出
vi.: 擠向前，奮力前進[Q]；緊迫
n.: 報刊；新聞界；記者們；通訊社[the S][G]；新聞輿論；報刊評論[S]
sentences: Press this button to start the engine. 按此鈕發動引擎。
He was pressing his jacket. 他在燙外套。
She pressed the frightened child to her heart. 她把受了驚嚇的孩子摟在懷裡。
He pressed her to come with him. 他強迫她跟他走。
Many people pressed forward to shake hands with him. 許多人擠向前和他握手。
Time presses and we must get back to work. 時間緊迫，我們得回去上班了。
The power of the press is very great. 新聞報刊的力量是極大的。
The government's new policy received a good press. 政府的新政策受到新聞輿論的好評。
I'll give my suit a press. 我要把西裝燙一燙。

other_types: 過去式：prevented   過去分詞：prevented   現在分詞：preventing
part_of_speech: vt.: 防止，預防；阻止；制止；妨礙[（+from）]
vi.: 妨礙；阻止
sentences: Vitamin C is supposed to prevent colds. 維他命C被認為能預防感冒。
Who prevents their plans from being carried out? 誰阻止他們的計畫，不讓實施？
Of course I can't prevent your going. 當然，我不能阻止你去。

part_of_speech: n.: 預防，防止；阻止，妨礙[U]；【罕】預防方法；預防藥
sentences: the prevention of fire 預防火災

part_of_speech: n.: 價格，價錢[C]；代價[S][（+of/for）]
vt.: 給……定價；給……標價[O][H]；【口】問……的價格
sentences: Prices keep going up. 物價持續上漲。
The country paid a heavy price for her independence. 該國為獨立付出了沉重的代價。
The watch was priced at $200. 這只手錶標價二百美元。

part_of_speech: adj.: 貴重的，無價的；稀世之珍的；【口】極為有趣的；極為荒唐的
sentences: We saw priceless paintings at the museum. 我們在博物館看到貴重的名畫。
Fred is a priceless fool. 弗蘭特是個大傻瓜。

part_of_speech: adj.: 主要的，首要的，最重要的[B]；資本的，本金的
n.: 校長；社長；首長[C]；資本，本金[S]
sentences: Drinking is a principal cause of traffic accidents. 酗酒是交通事故的主要原因。
The school principal read the honor roll list. 校長宣讀優秀生名單。
The interest on a principal of $10,000 or above is 0.2 percent higher. 本金一萬元以上的利息高百分之零點二。

part_of_speech: n.: 原則；原理[C]；主義；信條[C]
sentences: I take this seriously. It's a matter of principle. 我對此很認真。這是原則問題。
The two machines work on the same principle. 這兩部機器的工作原理是一樣的。
He is a man of high principle. 他是節操高尚的人。

part_of_speech: n.: （時間等方面的）在先，居前[U]；優先，重點；優先權；先取權[U][（+over）]
sentences: Safety has high priority in factories. 工廠裡安全至關重要。
Road building is a top priority. 築路是最優先考慮的事。

part_of_speech: adj.: 個人的，私人的；私下的，非公開的，祕密的
n.: 士兵，列兵[C]；陰部[P]
sentences: That's my private view. 那是我個人的觀點。
I wish to have a private talk with you. 我希望私下和你談談。
If you go to a private hospital you must pay. 如果你去一家私立醫院就診，你得付費。
The president is paying a private visit to his neighboring country. 總統正在對鄰國作非官方的訪問。
She's a very private person. 她是個很孤僻的人。
Let me speak to him in private. 讓我私下和他談談。

part_of_speech: n.: 可能性，或然性[U][S1][（+of）][+that]；或有的事；可能的結果[C]
sentences: The probability of making a mistake increases when you are tired. 你累的時候犯錯誤的可能性就會增加。
A surprise test is a strong probability. 突然考試很有可能。

part_of_speech: adv.: 大概，或許，很可能
sentences: He will probably refuse the offer. 他很可能會拒絕這一提議。

part_of_speech: adj.: 試用的；實習中的；緩刑中的
n.[C]: 過程，進程；步驟；程序；工序；製作法
adj.: 經過特殊加工的；處理過的；照相板的
vt.: 加工；處理，辦理；用電腦處理
sentences: I will tell you, sooner or later, all the complicated process. 我早晚要將整個複雜過程告訴你。
They are using a new process to make glass. 他們正在用一種新方法製造玻璃。
Processed foods are available in that store. 在那家商店可買到加工過的食品。
Supermarkets sell many vegetables that have been processed. 超級市場出售許多已經加工過的蔬菜。
The information is being processed. 信息正在處理中。

part_of_speech: n.: （尤指受過良好教育或專門訓練者，如律師，醫生，教師的）職業[C]；同業，同行[the S][G]
sentences: She intends to make teaching her profession. 她打算以教書為業。
The teaching profession claim that they are badly paid. 教師同業們聲稱待遇太差。
He is a leading member of the medical profession. 他是醫療業中首屈一指的醫生。
She did not believe in his professions of love. 她不相信他的愛情表白是真的。

other_types: 比較級：more professional   最高級：most professional
part_of_speech: adj.: 職業（上）的；從事特定專業的[Z][B]；職業性的，非業餘性的[Z][B]
n.[C]: 職業選手；專家，內行
sentences: a highly professional administrator 一位非常內行的管理人員
He is a professional complainer. 他是一個發牢騷專家。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 側面（像），側影；輪廓，外形；外觀；形象
vt.: 給……畫側面像；給……作剖面圖；描（或顯）出……的輪廓
sentences: a television profile of Ernest Hemingway 一段歐內斯特‧海明威的電視簡介
The old trees were profiled against the pale sky. 蒼天映襯出老樹的輪廓。

part_of_speech: n.: 利潤，盈利；收益，紅利[C][U]；利益，益處；得益[U]
vt.: 有益於
vi.: 有益，有利；得益，獲益[（+by/from）]
sentences: He made a profit of fifty thousand US dollars on his house. 他賣掉房子獲利五萬美元。
We gained a lot of profit from your advice. 我們從你的建議中獲益匪淺。
Telling lies won't profit you. 撒謊對你無益。
He learned to profit by his mistakes. 他學會了從自己的錯誤中獲益。
We profit from the work of the specialist. 我們從專家的工作中得到益處。

part_of_speech: n.: 有利；有益；【經】收益性；利益率

other_types: 比較級：more profitable   最高級：most profitable
part_of_speech: adj.: 有利的，贏利的；有益的；有用的
sentences: The farm is a highly profitable business. 該農場是一個贏利頗豐的企業。

other_types: 過去式：progressed   過去分詞：progressed   現在分詞：progressing
part_of_speech: vi.: 前進；進行；上進，提高，進步
sentences: The building of the railroad is progressing. 鐵路正在建造中。
The boy has progressed in his studies. 這男孩學習方面有進步。

other_types: 比較級：more progressive   最高級：most progressive
part_of_speech: adj.: 進步的；先進的；革新的；向前進的；發展中的[Z]
n.[C]: 進步分子；革新主義者；【美】【史】（大寫）進步黨黨員
sentences: He was a progressive thinker. 他是個進步的思想家。

other_types: 過去式：prohibited   過去分詞：prohibited   現在分詞：prohibiting
part_of_speech: vt.: （以法令，規定等）禁止[（+from）]；妨礙，阻止；使不可能[（+from）][+v-ing]
sentences: Smoking is prohibited in the office building. 辦公樓內禁止抽菸。
The high cost of the machine prohibits its widespread use. 這機器價格昂貴，很難普及使用。

other_types: 過去式：projected   過去分詞：projected   現在分詞：projecting
part_of_speech: vt.: 計畫；企劃；投擲，發射，噴射[（+at/into）]
vi.: 突出，伸出[（+from/into）]；【心】投射
sentences: The government projected a tax decrease. 政府計畫降低稅收。
The fountain projects a stream of water. 噴泉噴出一股水。
They were delighted to see their holiday slides projected on a screen. 他們高興地看到他們度假的幻燈片在螢幕上放映出來。
He had projected himself as a reformer in the presidential campaign. 他在總統競選中曾以改革者的姿態出現。
Can you project our sales in the coming year? 你能預測我們來年的銷售情況嗎？
Nails that project from the wall may tear your clothes. 牆上突出的釘子會撕破你的衣服的。

other_types: 過去式：promoted   過去分詞：promoted   現在分詞：promoting
part_of_speech: vt.: 晉升[H][（+to）][O9]；使（學生）升級[H][（+to）]
sentences: He certainly ought to be promoted. 他應該要晉升。
Pupils who pass the test will be promoted to the next higher grade. 通過考試的學生將升到高一個年級去。
The Prime Minister's visit will promote the cooperation between the two countries. 首相的訪問將促進兩國間的合作。
Promote a bill in Parliament. 促使議案在議會獲得通過。
Several bankers promoted the new company. 好幾個銀行家聯手創立了這個新公司。
Your job is to promote the new product. 你的工作是促銷這一新產品。

part_of_speech: n.: 提升，晉級[U][C]；促進，增進；發揚；提倡[U][（+of）]
sentences: They're planning a big promotion for their new washing powder. 他們正籌劃舉辦一次新款式洗衣粉的大促銷行動。

part_of_speech: adj.: 敏捷的，及時的，迅速的[（+in）][+to-v]；【商】（付款）即時的，即期的；（貨物）當場交的
adv.: 準時地；正（指時間）
vt.: 促使；激勵；慫恿[O2]；引起，激起
vi.: 提示；提詞
n.: 催促；提醒；【商】付款期限
sentences: He is prompt in paying his rent. 他付房租從不拖延。
The drowning child was saved by Dick's prompt action. 狄克的及時行動救了那個溺水的孩子。
They started at 7 o'clock prompt. 他們在七點鐘準時出發。
He was prompted by patriotism. 他為愛國心所激勵。
His curiosity prompted him to ask questions. 他的好奇心驅使他發問。
She needed to be prompted three times. 她要別人提示三次。
He had to be given a prompt. 他不得不要人提詞。

part_of_speech: adv.: 敏捷地；迅速地；立即地；準時地，正好
sentences: He promptly forgot all about it. 他馬上把這事兒忘得一乾二淨。

other_types: 副詞比較級：more properly   最高級：most properly
part_of_speech: adv.: 恰當地；正確地；有禮貌地；體面地
sentences: That is not, properly speaking, a dictionary, but a grammar. 嚴格說來；那不是一本詞典，而是一本語法書。
An honest man is properly indignant at the offer of a bribe. 一個誠實的人對行賄理所當然感到憤慨。

part_of_speech: n.: 財產，資產；所有物[U]；房產，地產，房地產[C][U]
sentences: This small house is my only property. 這所小房子是我的唯一財產。
He has several properties in this street. 他在這條街上有幾筆地產。
With the city developing rapidly, property in the center is becoming more expensive. 這個城市發展迅速，市中心的房地產愈來愈貴。
He is studying the medicinal properties of wild plants. 他正在研究野生植物的藥物特性。
There is no property in the seashore. 海岸非任何人私有。

other_types: 過去式：protected   過去分詞：protected   現在分詞：protecting
part_of_speech: vt.: 保護，防護[（+against/from）]；【經】（藉著對進口商品徵收關稅或設限等）保護（本國產業）
sentences: May God protect you from harm. 願上帝保佑你免受傷害。
Wearing dark glasses can protect your eyes from the sun. 戴墨鏡可以保護眼睛不受陽光刺激。
The insurance policy protects you against injury. 如遭傷害，這保險單保證償付你的損失。

part_of_speech: n.: 保護，防護；警戒[U][（+against/from）]；防護物[C][（+against/from）]
sentences: The construction workers wore metal helmets for protection. 建築工人為了防護而帶金屬頭盔。
A thin jacket is a poor protection against cold. 一件單薄的夾克衫不足以禦寒。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: （公眾的）注意，名聲；宣傳，宣揚
sentences: The new project gained publicity through papers. 這項新工程透過報紙得到廣泛宣傳。
The company has launched a campaign of publicity for a new car. 公司為它的新型汽車大作宣傳。
His job is producing publicity for the child welfare organizations. 他的任務是為兒童福利組織撰寫宣傳材料。
in the publicity of the streets 在街上大庭廣眾之前

other_types: 過去式：publicized   過去分詞：publicized   現在分詞：publicizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 宣傳；公布；廣告

other_types: 過去式：purchased   過去分詞：purchased   現在分詞：purchasing
part_of_speech: vt.: 買，購買；贏得，獲得，努力取得
n.: 買，購買[U][C]；所購之物[C]
sentences: He purchased this stamp at an auction. 他在拍賣會中購得這枚郵票。
We treasure this dearly purchased victory. 我們珍惜這次以慘重的代價換來的勝利。
He worked all summer to save money for the purchase of a piano. 他工作了一整個夏天，為的是存錢買架鋼琴。
He filled the car with his purchases. 他把買的東西裝滿車子。
He got a purchase on a branch until we came to his rescue. 他緊緊抓住一根樹枝直到我們把他救下來。

part_of_speech: n.: 目的，意圖[C]；用途；效用，效果[C]
vt.: 【書】意圖；決意；打算[+to-v][+v-ing][+that]
sentences: What is the purpose of his visit? 他來訪的目的是什麼？
The purpose of a trap is to catch and hold animals. 陷阱是用來捕捉野獸的。
He purposes to visit Taipei. 他打算訪問臺北。

other_types: 過去式：pursued   過去分詞：pursued   現在分詞：pursuing
part_of_speech: vt.: 追趕；追蹤；追捕；（疾病等）糾纏；跟隨
vi.: 追趕[（+after）]；繼續進行
sentences: The policemen pursued the bank robbers. 警察追趕搶劫銀行的罪犯。
He has been pursued by misfortune. 他厄運連連。
She pursued the goal of perfection in her art. 她的目標是追求藝術上的完美境界。
He has set his heart on pursuing his studies abroad. 他下決心到國外求學。
The police are pursuing after a fugitive. 警察在追捕一名逃犯。

part_of_speech: n.: 賦予（或取得）資格[U]；資格，能力[P][（+for）][+to-v]
sentences: She passed her qualification for the Olympic gymnastic competition. 她獲得了奧林皮克體操比賽的資格。
What are the qualifications for an airline pilot? 當一名民航飛機駕駛員要具備哪些條件？
a secretarial qualification 擔任祕書的資格證明
They accepted my plan without qualifications of any kind. 他們毫無保留地接受了我的計畫。
The qualification of his policy as conservative is justified. 把他的政策稱為保守主義是有道理的。

other_types: 比較級：more qualified   最高級：most qualified
part_of_speech: adj.: 具備必要條件的；合格的；勝任的[+to-v]；有限制的；有保留的
sentences: She is qualified to do the job. 她能勝任這一工作。
Their reaction was one of qualified praise. 他們的反應是一種有保留的稱讚。

other_types: 過去式：qualified   過去分詞：qualified   現在分詞：qualifying
part_of_speech: vt.: 使具有資格，使合格[（+as/for）][O2]；限制，限定
vi.: 取得資格；具備合格條件[（+as/for）]
sentences: I am a qualified doctor, who will not hurt you. 我是一個合格的醫生，不會傷害你的。
Two years of experience qualified him for a promotion. 兩年的資歷使他有資格獲得升遷。
Qualify your statement that dogs are loyal by adding usually. 將你說的狗是忠誠的這句話修正一下，加上通常二字。
In blue pencils, the adjective blue qualifies the noun pencils. 在藍鉛筆中形容詞藍修飾名詞鉛筆。
I qualify it as a plot. 我說它是一個陰謀。
Can you qualify yourself for the job? 你能證明你自己有能力擔任這一工作嗎？
He qualified in London as a teacher of English overseas. 他在倫敦取得海外英語教師的資格。

part_of_speech: n.: （調查情況用的）問卷；（意見）調查表[C]
sentences: It took me quite a while to fill out the questionnaire. 填寫那份問卷花了我好長一段時間。

part_of_speech: n.: 引用，引證[U]；引文；語錄[C]
sentences: The quotation of very long passages should be avoided. 應該避免摘引非常長的段落。
From what author does this quotation come? 這一引文出自哪位作者？

other_types: 過去式：quoted   過去分詞：quoted   現在分詞：quoting
part_of_speech: vt.: 引用；引述[O1]；把……放在引號內
vi.: 引用；引證[（+from）]；報價[（+for）]
n.[C]: 【口】引語，引文[（+from）]；引號[P]
sentences: The judge quoted various cases in support of his opinion. 法官引證了各種案例來支持他的判決理由。
She asked the reporter not to quote her remark. 她要求記者不要引述她的話。
The dialogue in old books is not quoted. 舊書裡的對話不加引號。
The heavy oil was quoted at $17 per barrel. 重油報價為每桶十七美元。
He quoted 2,000 dollars for repairing the door. 他要價兩仟元修那扇門。
The minister quoted from the Bible. 牧師引用《聖經》的語句。
This is a quote from the Bible. 這是引自《聖經》的語句。
He put these words in quotes. 他把這些話放在引號裡。
We accepted his quote. 我們接受了他的報價。

other_types: 過去式：raised   過去分詞：raised   現在分詞：raising
part_of_speech: vt.: 舉起，抬起；增加；提高；提升[（+to）]
n.: 【美】加薪；加薪額[C]；提高，舉，升
sentences: He raised his glass and said: Your health, Carl. 他舉起了杯子說道：祝你健康，卡爾。
The landlord raised my rent. 房東提高了我的租金。
They are going to raise funds for the school buildings. 他們將為蓋校舍籌集資金。
The baby was raised on soya-bean milk. 這孩子是用豆漿餵養大的。
None of them raised any objection. 他們誰也沒提出反對意見。
They raised a monument to the national hero. 他們為那位民族英雄樹了紀念碑。
I am going to ask the boss for a raise. 我要找老板要求加薪。

part_of_speech: n.: 排，行；一系列[C]；山脈[C]
vt.: 排列，將……排成行[O]；使並列；使進入行列
vi.: 平行；列成一行；綿亙，延伸
sentences: The library has ranges of books in perfect order. 這個圖書館的書一排一排放得井井有條。
The houses are sold out within this price range. 在這個價位範圍之內的房子已售完。
The company sells new cars with a wide range of prices. 該公司銷售價格差異很大的各種新車子。
What is the range of this telescope? 這架望遠鏡的有效距離多大？
This store sells a wide range of TV sets. 這家商店出售各種型號的彩色電視機。
The range of this plant is East Asia. 這種植物的產地在東亞。
She takes her dog for a range every afternoon. 她每天下午牽著狗閒逛。
The cards were ranged in alphabetical order. 卡片以字母順序排列。
They were ranged against us. 他們站在反對我們的一邊。
We ranged the woods looking for a place to set up our tents. 我們在樹林裡東走西跑，找個地方搭帳篷。
The shabby houses used to range along the road. 過去這路邊破敗的房子排成行。
The road ranges westward from the lake. 這條路由湖邊向西延伸。
The temperature ranges between 30 and 40 degrees centigrade. 溫度在攝氏三十度與四十度之間。

part_of_speech: adj.: 稀有的，罕見的；傑出的，珍貴的
sentences: These flowers are very rare in this country. 這些花在該國很少見。
Gold is a rare metal. 金子是貴重金屬。
The higher you climb up the mountain, the rarer the air is. 越往山上爬，空氣越稀薄。
Edison had rare powers as an inventor. 愛迪生具有罕見的發明天才。

part_of_speech: n.: 比例，率；比率[C]；速度，速率[the S]
vt.: 對……估價；對……評價[O]；認為；列為[O][O8][O9]
vi.: 被評價，被列入等級[（+as）]；【口】受歡迎，受推崇[（+with）]
sentences: The unemployment rate is rising in that country. 那個國家的失業率正在上升。
The car was going at the rate of 60 miles an hour. 汽車以每小時六十英里的速度行駛。
The room rates at this motel range from $30 to $50 per day. 這個汽車旅館的房價每天從三十美元到五十美元不等。
She gave her children a first-rate education. 她給她的孩子一流的教育。
How do you rate our chances of success? 你估計我們成功的可能性有多大？
He was rated one of the richest men in Texas. 他被認為是德州最富有的人之一。
That hotel doesn't rate five stars at all. 那家旅館根本夠不上五星級。
Hong Kong rates as one of the biggest trade centers in the world. 香港是世界上最大的貿易中心之一。
The overseas teacher rates with her Chinese colleagues. 那位外籍教師很受中國同事的歡迎。

other_types: 比較級：more rational   最高級：most rational
part_of_speech: adj.: 理性的，有理性的；明事理的；基於理性的，合理的
n.[C]: 合理的事物；【數】有理數
sentences: Panic destroys rational thought. 驚慌摧毀理性思考。
That's a rational decision. 那是個合理的決定。

part_of_speech: ph.: 原料

other_types: 過去式：reached   過去分詞：reached   現在分詞：reaching
part_of_speech: vt.: 抵達，到達；達到；伸出（手）；伸手及到，夠到
vi.: 伸出手（或腳）[Q]；達到，及到；延伸[W]
n.: （手、能力、智力、影響等）可及之範圍[U][（+of）]；手臂長度[S]
sentences: When will they reach Los Angeles? 他們什麼時候抵達洛杉磯？
He reached his hand out for the book I offered him. 他伸出手來接我給他的書。
We tried to reach them by cable. 我們試著用電報跟他們聯絡。
She reached up and picked a pear off a branch. 她抬起手從一根枝上摘下一顆梨。
The speaker's voice couldn't reach to the back of the auditorium. 演講人的聲音禮堂後排聽不見。
The insecticide was put out of the child's reach. 殺蟲劑放在孩子拿不到的地方。
the upper reaches of the river 河的上游地區

other_types: 過去式：realized   過去分詞：realized   現在分詞：realizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 領悟，了解，認識到[+（that）][+wh-]；實現；使成為事實
vi.: 變賣產業為現錢
sentences: I realized what he meant. 我明白了他的意思。
Does he realize his mistake yet? 他意識到他的錯誤了嗎？
Her wish to become a movie star was finally realized. 她當電影明星的願望終於實現了。

other_types: 過去式：rearranged   過去分詞：rearranged   現在分詞：rearranging
part_of_speech: vt.: 重新整理；重新布置；重新排列

other_types: 比較級：more reasonable   最高級：most reasonable
part_of_speech: adj.: 通情達理的，講道理的；合理的，正當的；適當的
sentences: Our mother was always very reasonable. 我們的母親總是非常通情達理。

other_types: 副詞比較級：more reasonably   最高級：most reasonably
part_of_speech: adv.: 明辨道理地，合理地；有理性地；相當地，適度地
sentences: I'm reasonably broad across the shoulders. 我的肩膀相當寬。

part_of_speech: n.: 收到，接到[U]；收據，收條[C]
vt.: 【主美】出具……的收據；承認收到；在……上註明收訖字樣
sentences: We are awaiting the receipt of further information. 我們正等待接獲進一步的消息。
I paid the bill but he neglected to give me a receipt. 我付了帳單，但他忘了給我收據。
Box-office receipts amounted to over a million. 票房收入超過了一百萬。
Pay the bill and ask the grocer to receipt it. 付帳之後請食品雜貨商注明收訖。

other_types: 過去式：received   過去分詞：received   現在分詞：receiving
part_of_speech: vt.: 收到，接到；得到，受到，遭受
vi.: 收到；得到；接收；會客，接待
sentences: I've just received a telegram. 我剛收到一份電報。
They received the support of the workers. 他們得到工人們的支持。
His speech was well received. 他的演講很受歡迎。
They received us most cordially. 他們熱忱地接待了我們。
It is more blessed to give than to receive. 施比受更有福。
Mr. Reed receives on Thursday afternoons. 里得先生星期四下午接見客人。

part_of_speech: adj.: 新近的，最近的；近來的；近代的；（大寫）【地】全新世的，全新統的
n.: （大寫）全新世；全新統[the S]
sentences: This is a recent period in history. 這是歷史上近代的一段時期。
The house is a recent purchase. 這房子是最近買的。

part_of_speech: n.: 接待，接見；歡迎[S1]；接待會；歡迎會；宴會[C]
sentences: Jim had an enthusiastic reception when he returned home. 吉姆回家時受到了熱情的接待。
Our school gave a reception to our new principal. 我們學校為新校長舉行了歡迎會。
Her calm reception of the bad news surprised her friends. 她聽到壞消息鎮定自若，令她的朋友們驚奇。
Leave your key at reception. 把你房門的鑰匙留在接待處。
Reception improved because of the new antenna. 接受效果因有新天線而得到改善。

part_of_speech: adj.: 善於接受的；能容納的
n.[C]: 【醫】處方（符號R）；烹飪法；食譜；（糕餅等的）製作法[（+for）]
sentences: I'd like to have your recipe for cookies. 你能不能告訴我製作小甜餅的方法。
He thinks the one recipe for success lies in hard work. 他認為成功的唯一訣竅在於勤奮。

other_types: 過去式：recognized   過去分詞：recognized   現在分詞：recognizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 認出，識別；認識[（+as）]；正式承認；認可，認定[（+as）]
vi.: 承認，確認；【律】具結
sentences: The policeman recognized her as a pickpocket. 警察認出她是個扒手。
He looked at the envelope and recognized Jenny's handwriting immediately. 他看了看信封，馬上認出是珍妮的筆跡。
Many countries recognized the new government. 許多國家承認了新政府。
I recognized that I had made a mistake. 我認識到自己犯了一個錯誤。
The government recognized his outstanding service by giving him a medal. 政府為他頒贈勛章，以表彰他的卓著功績。
He will not recognize me any longer. 他不願再理睬我了。
You should wait till the chairman recognizes you. 你應該等到主席准許後才能發言。

other_types: 過去式：recommended   過去分詞：recommended   現在分詞：recommending
part_of_speech: vt.: 推薦，介紹[（+as/for）][O1]；建議，勸告[O2][+v-ing][+that]
vi.: 推薦；提出建議
sentences: Can you recommend me some new books on this subject? 你能推薦一些有關這個學科的新書給我嗎？
I recommend you to comply with safety regulations. 我勸你遵守安全規則。
His proposal has much to recommend it. 他的建議有不少可取之處。
I recommended my child to her care. 我把孩子托付給她照顧。

part_of_speech: n.: 推薦[U]；推薦信，介紹信[C]
sentences: He gave her the job on her uncle's recommendation. 經她叔父介紹，他讓她擔任了這工作。
Will you write a recommendation for me? 你替我寫封推薦信好嗎？
act on one's recommendations 按某人的建議辦

other_types: 過去式：recruited   過去分詞：recruited   現在分詞：recruiting
part_of_speech: vt.: 徵募（新兵）；吸收（新成員）；（增加人員）充實（部隊等）
vi.: 招募新兵；招收新成員；【罕】得到補充
n.[C]: 新兵；新手；【美】復員士兵
sentences: Our club has recruited 30 new members this year. 今年我們俱樂部吸收了三十名新會員。
America recruited her population with new settlers from Europe. 美國透過歐洲新移民增加人口。
Most of the teachers there are recruited from abroad. 那裡的大部分教師是從海外僱來的。
Before sailing, we recruited our provisions. 開船前，我們補充了給養。
The rest and the drink recruited him. 休息和喝水使他恢復了體力。
His job was to recruit for the army. 他的工作是為陸軍募兵。
He came to the seaside to recruit. 他來到海濱休養。
New recruits are trained at the boot camp. 新兵在新兵訓練營接受訓練。
Our music club needs new recruits. 我們的音樂俱樂部需要新成員。

part_of_speech: n.: 徵募新兵；補充

other_types: 過去式：reduced   過去分詞：reduced   現在分詞：reducing
part_of_speech: vt.: 減少；縮小；降低；使處於（某種狀態）；使化為，使變為[（+to）]
vi.: 減少；縮小；降低；減輕體重，減肥
sentences: He is trying to reduce expenses. 他正試圖減少開支。
The fire reduced the paintings to ashes. 大火將這些畫作燒成了灰燼。
Poverty reduced him to begging. 貧窮迫使他行乞。
The officer was reduced to the ranks. 這軍官被降為士兵。
Finally the chair reduced all the questions to one. 最後主席把所有的問題歸納為一個。
The cancer victim was reduced to skin and bones. 那個癌症患者瘦得皮包骨。
It is easy to reduce if you watch your diet. 你如果注意飲食，減肥並不難。

part_of_speech: n.: 減少；削減[U][C][（+in）]；縮小[U][C][（+in）]
sentences: reduction of household expenses 家用開支的削減
reduction of an embassy to a liaison office 大使館降級為聯絡處
reduction to ashes 化為灰燼

other_types: 比較級：more redundant   最高級：most redundant
part_of_speech: adj.: 多餘的，過剩的；累贅的，冗長的
sentences: Skills which have been made redundant by technological advance. 由於技術進步而變得多餘的技術。

part_of_speech: n.: 冰箱，雪櫃；冷藏室；冷凍庫[C]
sentences: Brody reached into the refrigerator and pulled out a beer. 布羅迪把手伸進冰箱，拿出一罐啤酒。

part_of_speech: n.: 退還；償還[U]；退款；償還金額[C]
sentences: She took the faulty radio back to the shop and demanded a refund. 她將有毛病的收音機拿回商店去要求退款。

part_of_speech: adj.: 可退還的；可償還的
sentences: The deposit is refundable. 保證金可以歸還。

part_of_speech: n.: 拒絕[U][C][+to-v]；優先購買權，優先取捨權[U][the S]
sentences: He shook his head in refusal. 他搖頭表示拒絕。
We will give you (the) first refusal of the lot if we sell it. 如果我們賣這塊地我們會給你優先購買權。

other_types: 過去式：refused   過去分詞：refused   現在分詞：refusing
part_of_speech: vt.: 拒絕；拒受；拒給；不准[O1]；拒不；不肯，不願[Y][+to-v]
vi.: 拒絕；（馬）不肯越過障礙物
sentences: He refused my offer of help. 他拒絕了我的幫助。
The engine refused to start. 引擎怎麼也發動不起來。
Martin refused to discuss the matter. 馬丁拒絕討論此事。
It never occurred to me that you would refuse. 我從未想到你會拒絕。

part_of_speech: prep.: 關於；就……而論；regard的動詞現在分詞、動名詞
sentences: He knew nothing regarding the case. 關於這個案子他一無所知。

part_of_speech: adj.: 不注意的，不留心的；不關心的
adv.: 【口】不顧一切地；不管怎樣地；無論如何
sentences: I'll take the job regardless of the pay. 不管報酬多少我都要這份工作。
We tried to discourage him from going out in the storm, but he went regardless. 我們試圖阻攔他不要在暴風雨中外出，但他還是不顧一切地出去了。

part_of_speech: adj.: 地區的，局部的；整個地區的
sentences: Most regional committees meet four times a year. 大部分地區委員會每年開會四次。

part_of_speech: n.: 登記，註冊[U]；登記簿，花名冊[C]
vt.: 登記，註冊，申報；（計器等）標示，指示；記錄
vi.: 登記，註冊；【口】（常用在否定句中）留下印象
sentences: No register of his death was found. 沒有查到他的死亡記錄。
That note is in the upper register of this instrument. 那個音在該樂器的高音部。
Official documents are written in formal register. 官方文件是以正式語體寫成的。
Waldo went to the city hall to register the birth of his son. 沃爾多去市政廳為他兒子作出生登記。
The thermometer registered 70 degrees. 溫度計顯示七十度。
Her face registered surprise. 她臉上露出了驚異之色。
Thousands joined the march to register their opposition to the cuts in education. 數千人參加遊行表示反對削減教育經費。
I want this letter registered. 我想掛號郵寄這封信。
I registered at a hotel near the train station. 我在靠近火車站的一家旅館登記住宿。
I told them I would be leaving, but I don't think it registered. 我告訴過他們我要走，但我想他們並未留意。

part_of_speech: n.: 登記，註冊，掛號[U]；登記項目，記錄事項[C]
sentences: The registration of students for the course will begin on Thursday morning. 學生登記上這門課將於星期四上午開始。

other_types: 過去式：regretted   過去分詞：regretted   現在分詞：regretting
part_of_speech: vt.: 懊悔；因……而遺憾[+v-ing][+that]；痛惜；哀悼；思念
vi.: 感到後悔；感到抱歉；遺憾
n.: 懊悔，悔恨；抱歉，遺憾[U][C][（+at/for）]；哀悼，悲歎[U][（+over）]
sentences: I regret that you see it like that. 你這樣看待這件事，我很遺憾。
I believe you will regret leaving Paris. 我相信你會為離開巴黎而後悔的。
I regret his death. 我對他的逝世痛惜不已。
I regret to say that I am unable to help you. 很抱歉，我愛莫能助。
Those who have not bought insurance are now regretting. 那些沒有買保險的人現在後悔了。
Shelley had no regrets for his actions. 雪萊對他的行為一點都不感到後悔。
He felt no shame and no regret. 他既不感到羞愧也不感到遺憾。
He expressed regret over the death of your father. 他對你父親的逝世表示哀悼。
Tommy sent his regrets. 湯米寄來了他的謝絕函。
Please accept my regrets at having to refuse. 懇辭，謹致歉意。

part_of_speech: adj.: 規則的，有規律的；固定的；正常的；定期的，定時的
n.[C]: 正規兵；（球隊的）正式隊員
adv.: 【口】按時地；經常地；【口】十分，非常
sentences: He's got no regular job. 他沒有固定的工作。
Everything seemed quite regular when the fire broke out. 起火的當時，一切似乎都很正常。
He made a regular visit to his parents. 他定期看望父母親。
Laura was one of his regular customers. 羅拉是他的老顧客之一。
Do you want regular or king size? 你要一般尺寸的還是特大尺寸的？
He is a handsome young man with regular features. 他是個五官端正的英俊青年。
Look is a regular verb, but see is an irregular verb. 看是規則變化動詞，而看見是不規則變化動詞。
a regular rascal 十足的無賴
His brother is a regular guy. 他兄弟是個受歡迎的人。
The barman gave free drinks to the regulars at Christmas. 耶誕節酒吧男侍者免費給老顧客酒喝。

part_of_speech: adv.: 有規律地；定期地
sentences: We meet regularly to discuss business. 我們定期會面討論事務。

other_types: 過去式：regulated   過去分詞：regulated   現在分詞：regulating
part_of_speech: vt.: 管理；控制；為……制訂規章；校準；調整，調節
sentences: Private schools regulate the behavior of students. 私立學校規範學生行為。
Thermostats can be used to regulate the temperature of a room. 恆溫器可用來調節室內溫度。
Regulating your habits is conducive to good health. 使生活習慣規律化有益於健康。

other_types: 過去式：rehearsed   過去分詞：rehearsed   現在分詞：rehearsing
part_of_speech: vt.: 排練，排演；給……排練
vi.: 排練，排演；練習；演習
sentences: They are rehearsing a new play. 他們在排練一齣新戲。
The children rehearsed all the happenings of the day to their father. 孩子們向他們的父親講述了一天中的全部事情。
The actors were rehearsing in the theater. 演員們正在劇場裡排練。

other_types: 過去式：rejected   過去分詞：rejected   現在分詞：rejecting
part_of_speech: vt.: 拒絕，抵制；去除，丟棄
sentences: The plan was rejected. 該計畫遭拒絕。
The board rejected all our ideas. 董事會拒絕了我們的所有想法。
All apples with soft spots were rejected. 所有帶軟斑點的蘋果都被剔除。
The prisoner's plea for pardon was rejected. 該犯的赦免請求被駁回了。
The patient's body rejected the heart transplant. 病人的身體排斥移植的心臟。

other_types: 過去式：relaxed   過去分詞：relaxed   現在分詞：relaxing
part_of_speech: vt.: 使鬆弛，使鬆懈，放鬆；緩和；放寬；減輕
vi.: 鬆弛，鬆懈，放鬆；緩和；放寬；減輕
sentences: He lagged far behind his classmates because he had relaxed his efforts. 他因為放鬆了努力，故遠遠落後於班裡同學。
The judge relaxed the rules. 法官放寬了規則。
She relaxed her mind by listening to music. 她聽聽音樂使大腦得到休息。
His muscles relaxed. 他的肌肉放鬆了。
The heat did not relax until midnight. 直到半夜，炎熱才緩解。
His manner relaxed. 他變得隨和了。
He took a glass of beer and relaxed after a day's work. 一天工作下來，他喝杯啤酒輕鬆一下。

part_of_speech: n.: 鬆弛，放鬆[U][（+of/in）]；緩和，放寬，減輕[U][（+of/in）]
sentences: There must be no relaxation in our high standards. 我們堅持高標準，絕不容許有些微放鬆。

other_types: 過去式：released   過去分詞：released   現在分詞：releasing
part_of_speech: vt.: 釋放，解放[（+from）]；放鬆，鬆開；發射，投擲
n.: 釋放，解放；豁免；赦免[U][（+from）]；發行，發表；發行的書（或電影等），（發布的）通訊稿，新聞稿[U][C]
sentences: Release the dog. He has been chained up for hours. 放開這條狗。它已被拴了好幾小時了。
He quickly released her hand. 他很快地放開了她的手。
This releases them from personal responsibility. 這免除了他們的個人責任。
A new movie is to be released tonight. 今晚要發行一部新電影。
He released his claim to the property. 他放棄了對財產的要求。
After my examination I had a feeling of release. 考試之後，我感到如釋重負。
The prisoner was questioned before his release. 囚犯被釋放之前受到了審問。
The film is scheduled for release next month. 該片定於下月發行。
You can't use these files without obtaining a release. 你得不到特許證就不能使用這些檔案。
He pressed the release to open the box. 他按下開啟裝置打開了箱子。

other_types: 比較級：more relevant   最高級：most relevant
part_of_speech: a.[(: 有關的；切題的；恰當的；有意義的；關係重大的
sentences: His nationality isn't relevant to whether he is a good lawyer. 他的國籍跟他是不是一個好律師不相關。

other_types: 過去式：remained   過去分詞：remained   現在分詞：remaining
part_of_speech: vi.[W]: 剩下，餘留；繼續存在
sentences: A few pears remain on the trees. 樹上尚留有幾顆梨子。
Little of the original architecture remains. 原先的建築物幾乎片瓦不留。
She remained in her office all afternoon. 她整個下午沒有離開辦公室。
This room remains cool all summer. 這個房間整個夏天保持涼爽。
She remained silent all night. 她整個晚上沉默不語。
Several problems remain to be solved. 有好幾個問題尚待解決。
The decision remains with the general manager. 還得由總經理作決定。

other_types: 比較級：more remarkable   最高級：most remarkable
part_of_speech: adj.: 值得注意的；非凡的；卓越的[（+for）]
sentences: He is a remarkable linguist. 他是一位傑出的語言學家。

other_types: 過去式：reminded   過去分詞：reminded   現在分詞：reminding
part_of_speech: vt.: 提醒；使想起，使記起[（+of）][O2][+that][（+about）]
sentences: I reminded Gerald of his promise. 我提醒吉羅德他曾許下的諾言。
The story reminds me of an experience I once had. 這個故事使我想起我的一次親身經歷。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 提醒者，提醒物，令人回憶的東西；提示，幫助記憶的記號
sentences: I've had another reminder from the library. 我又收到圖書館的催促還書的來函。

part_of_speech: n.: 匯寄[U]；匯款；匯款額[C]
sentences: Your last month's salary will be paid by remittance. 最後一個月的薪水將透過匯寄的方式付給你。
He sends regular remittances to his parents. 他定期匯款給他父母。

other_types: 過去式：removed   過去分詞：removed   現在分詞：removing
part_of_speech: vt.: 移動，搬開；調動[（+from/to）]；脫掉；去掉，消除[（+from）]
vi.: 遷移，搬家[（+from/to）]；【書】離開
n.[C]: 距離，間隔；一步之差[（+from）]；移動；遷移，搬家
sentences: Students removed several desks to another classroom. 學生們把幾張書桌搬到另外一間教室。
She removed the painting to another wall. 她把畫搬到另一面牆上。
She saw he had removed his glasses. 她看到他摘下了他的眼鏡。
He was removed from the post. 他被解僱了。
The corrupt official was removed from office. 這個貪官被罷了職。
The manager's office has removed to another building. 經理的辦公室已搬到另外一幢大樓裡。
Your action seems several removes from reality. 你的行動似乎有些脫離實際。

part_of_speech: n.: 酬報，酬勞；償還，賠償[U]；酬金；薪資；賠償金[C]
sentences: He received a generous remuneration for his services. 他收到一筆豐厚的勞務酬金。

other_types: 過去式：renovated   過去分詞：renovated   現在分詞：renovating
part_of_speech: vt.: 更新；重做；修理；改善
n.: 更新；修理；恢復活力

other_types: 過去式：rented   過去分詞：rented   現在分詞：renting
part_of_speech: n.: 租金，租費[C][U]；出租的財產（指房，地產等）
vt.: 租用，租入[（+from）]；租出[（+to/out）]
vi.: 出租[（+at/for）]
sentences: I've got to pay my rent this morning. 今天上午我必須付房租。
They rented a cabin for their vacation. 他們為度假租了一間小屋。
I have rented the house out to a very nice family. 我把房子出租給了一戶很好的人家。
This house rents for US$ 800 a month. 這間屋子月租八百美元。
This farm rents for $1,500 a year. 這農場以每年一千五百美金出租。

other_types: 過去式：repaired   過去分詞：repaired   現在分詞：repairing
part_of_speech: vt.: 修理；修補；補救；糾正
n.: 修理；修補[U]；修理工作；修補工作[P]
sentences: The roof should be repaired soon. 這屋頂應及早整修。
He had his car repaired yesterday. 昨天他把車子送去修好了。
Tom tried to repair his mistake. 湯姆努力糾正自己的錯誤。
It took a long time for him to repair his health. 他過了好長時間才恢復健康。
The road is badly in need of repair. 這路急需修理。
Repairs must be done to the house before we move in. 在我們搬進去之前，房屋必須整修。
This suit has several repairs. 這套衣服有幾處修補過的地方。
That building was out of repair. 那幢大樓年久失修。

part_of_speech: n.: 付還；報恩；報復
adj.: 反覆的；嘮叨的

other_types: 過去式：replaced   過去分詞：replaced   現在分詞：replacing
part_of_speech: vt.: 把……放回（原處）；取代；以……代替[（+with/by）]
sentences: She replaced the receiver. 她將聽筒放了回去。
The brakes have to be replaced. 煞車需要更換。
Electric lights have replaced candles. 電燈已經取代了蠟燭。
I will replace the cup I broke. 我願用一個新杯子賠還我打碎的一隻。

part_of_speech: n.: 代替，取代；更換；接替[U]；歸還；賠還[U]
sentences: We need a replacement for the secretary who left. 我們需要一個人代替已離職的祕書。

other_types: 過去式：reported   過去分詞：reported   現在分詞：reporting
part_of_speech: vt.: 報告[（+to）][+v-ing][+that]；報導；記述，描述[O2][O8][O9][+that]
vi.: 報告；報導[（+on/from）]；寫報導，當記者[（+for）]
n.: 報告；報告書[C]；報導；通訊[C]
sentences: He reported that he had seen her. 他報告說他見到她了。
He reported seeing her. 他報告說他見到她了。
It is reported that twenty men were killed in the clash. 據報導，在這次衝突中有二十人被打死。
Two passengers were reported (to be) seriously injured. 據報導有兩位旅客受重傷。
He was reported to the police for speeding. 他超速被人檢舉。
He reported on the whole event to the vice premier. 他把整個事件向副總理作了匯報。
She failed to report for duty on the date indicated. 她沒有在指定日期報到上班。
I never believe idle reports. 我從來不信捕風捉影的傳聞。
My son got an excellent report last semester. 我兒子上學期成績出色。
Rifle reports could be heard in the distance. 聽得見遠處傳來的步槍聲。

other_types: 過去式：represented   過去分詞：represented   現在分詞：representing
part_of_speech: vt.: 描繪，（抽象地）表現；象徵；表示
vi.: 代表，代理；提出異議；提出抗議
sentences: This picture represents a scene at King Arthur's court. 這幅畫描繪了亞瑟王宮庭的一個場面。
The dove represents peace. 鴿子象徵和平。
They said that they represented the committee. 他們說他們代表該委員會。
All the different races of the country were represented at the parade. 遊行中有該國各種族的代表。
The museum had several paintings representing the artist's early style. 博物館中有幾幅畫家早期風格的代表作。
He represented the plan as practical. 他聲稱計畫切實可行。
Each child will represent an animal at the party. 聚會時，每個孩子將扮演一種動物。

other_types: 比較級：more representative   最高級：most representative
part_of_speech: a.[(: 代表性的，典型的；代表的，代理的；議會制的
n.[C]: 典型，代表物；代表，代理人
sentences: This case is representative of the attitudes of the police. 這個事例典型地反映了警方的態度。
representative government 代議政體
The tiger is a common representative of the cat family. 虎是一種普通的貓科動物。
She is the club's representative at the convention. 她是該俱樂部派來參加會議的代表。

part_of_speech: n.: 要求，請求[C][U][（+for）][+to-v][+that]；請求的事；（電臺等的）點播曲[C]
vt.: 要求，請求；請求給予[（+from/of）][+to-v][O2][+that]
sentences: Mr. Paine made a request that I should help him. 佩恩先生要求我幫助他。
It is my last request. I shall never ask you anything again. 這是我最後的請求。我再也不會向你提任何要求。
All my requests were granted. 我所請求的事情全都得到許可。
I requested him to come before ten. 我要求他十點以前來。
They requested financial support. 他們要求資助。

other_types: 過去式：required   過去分詞：required   現在分詞：requiring
part_of_speech: vt.: 需要[+v-ing][+that]；【書】要求，命令[（+of）][O2][+that]
sentences: The roof requires repairing. 屋頂需要修理了。
This project will require less money. 這項工程所需的投資較少。
The director required that we should work all night. 主任要求我們通宵工作。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 需要；必需品；要求；必要條件；規定[（+for）]
sentences: Food is a requirement of life. 食物是一項生活必需品。
He has filled all requirements for promotion. 他已具備晉升的一切條件。

part_of_speech: vt.: 重新安排……的時間；重新編排（時間表）；重新安排（國際債務的）支付方法（以減輕債務國的負擔）

other_types: 過去式：rescued   過去分詞：rescued   現在分詞：rescuing
part_of_speech: vt.: 援救；營救；挽救[（+from）]；【律】強行奪回（在押人犯或財物）
n.: 援救；營救[U][C]；【律】強行奪回
sentences: He rescued three children from the burning building. 他從失火的建築物內救出了三個孩子。
The life boat was sent out to rescue the sailors from the sinking ship. 救生船被派出去救沉船的水手。
Rescue was at hand. 救援近在咫尺。

other_types: 過去式：resembled   過去分詞：resembled   現在分詞：resembling
part_of_speech: vt.: 像，類似[W][（+in）]
sentences: She was not beautiful; she did not resemble her mother. 她不漂亮；她不像她的母親。

part_of_speech: n.: 保留（意見）；異議[C][U]；（公共）專用地；禁獵區；自然保護區；【美】【加】保留（給印第安人居住的）區域[C]
sentences: They accepted the proposal without reservation. 他們無保留地接受了這個建議。
There are a lot of Indian reservations in Arizona. 亞利桑那州有許多印第安保留區。
Most Indians live on reservations established by the Federal Government. 大部分印第安人生活在聯邦政府建立的保留地上。
We have made reservations for three rooms at the hotel. 我們已在這個旅館預訂了三個房間。

other_types: 過去式：reserved   過去分詞：reserved   現在分詞：reserving
part_of_speech: vt.: 儲備，保存；保留[（+for）]；預約，預訂
n.: 儲備（物）；儲備金；保留（物）；儲藏量[C][U][（+of）]；保留地；保護區；禁獵區[C]
sentences: These seats are reserved for special guests. 這些座位是為特別來賓保留的。
We will reserve the money; we may need it later. 我們將把這筆錢存起來，也許以後用得著。
They have reserved rooms at a hotel. 他們已預訂了旅館房間。
I have reserved a table at the restaurant. 我已在飯店預訂了一桌菜。
The court will reserve judgement. 法庭將延期判決。
The old man kept a large reserve of firewood for cold weather. 這位老人貯存了大量的柴薪以備天冷時用。
He spoke with reserve. 他說話謹慎。
The reserves were quickly mobilized during the war. 戰爭期間後備隊很快動員起來。

other_types: 過去式：resigned   過去分詞：resigned   現在分詞：resigning
part_of_speech: vt.: 放棄，辭去；把……託交給，委託[（+to/into）]
vi.: 辭職[（+from）]
sentences: The general resigned his commission. 將軍辭去了他的職務。
She resigned her children to the care of her sister. 她把孩子交給她妹妹照管。
He is resigned to his fate. 他聽天由命。
He resigned himself to his fate. 他聽天由命。
The simplest thing is for him to resign at once. 最簡單的做法就是他立即辭職。

other_types: 過去式：resisted   過去分詞：resisted   現在分詞：resisting
part_of_speech: vt.: 抵抗，反抗；抗拒；抗（酸），耐（熱等）
vi.: 抵抗，反抗，抗拒；（常用於否定句）忍耐，忍住
n.: 防染劑；抗蝕劑
sentences: The nation was unable to resist the invasion. 該國無力抵抗侵略。
This special coating is designed to resist rust. 這一特別的塗層旨在抗鏽。
A healthy body resists disease. 健康的身體能抵禦疾病。
I couldn't resist the temptation to tease Ollie. 我忍不住要逗奧利玩。
If the enemy continue to resist, wipe them out. 如果敵人繼續抵抗，就把他們消滅掉。

other_types: 過去式：resolved   過去分詞：resolved   現在分詞：resolving
part_of_speech: vt.: 解決，解答；消除（疑惑等）；決心，決定[+to-v][+（that）]
vi.: 決心，決定[（+on）]；決議，作出正式決定[Q][（+on/against）]
n.: 決心，決意[C][+to-v]；堅決，剛毅，果斷[U]
sentences: The letter resolved all our doubts. 這封信消除了我們的一切疑慮。
She resolved (that) she would never speak to him again. 她決心不再和他說話。
We resolved to visit Europe at least once a year. 我們決定至少每年訪問歐洲一次。
The Senate resolved to accept the President's budget proposals. 參議院通過決議接受總統的預算建議。
Some chemical compounds can be resolved by heat. 一些化學化合物可以透過加熱分解。
The interview resolved itself into a pleasant chat. 會見變成了愉快的閒聊。
He resolved on going abroad to study. 他決定到海外留學。
The Government resolved on a bold policy. 政府決定採取大膽的政策。
This chemical resolves when distilled at a high temperature. 這種化學品在高溫下蒸餾就會分解。
He made a firm resolve to give up gambling. 他下決心不再賭博。
George Washington was a man of great resolve. 喬治‧華盛頓是一個非常剛毅的人。

part_of_speech: n.: 敬重，尊敬[U][（+for）]；敬意，問候[P][（+to）]
vt.: 尊敬，敬重[（+for/as）]；尊重，重視
sentences: They treated me with respect. 他們對我很敬重。
Give my respects to your parents. 代我向你的父母親致意。
Some people have no respect for the speed limit and consequently are punished. 有些人全然不顧速限規定，結果受到處罰。
He is highly respected by everyone for his integrity. 他因清廉而深受大家的尊敬。
I respected their moral standards. 我尊重他們的道德標準。
We must respect the laws of a country we are in. 我們必須遵守所在國家的法律。
The two plans differ in one major respect. 這兩個計畫在一個主要方面有所不同。

part_of_speech: adj.: 值得尊敬的；名聲好的；體面的
n.: 可敬的人；正派的人[C][P1]
sentences: Our new neighbors are very respectable people. 我們的新鄰居是十分可敬的人。
It is not respectable to spit on the sidewalk. 在人行道上吐痰是不文雅的。
a respectable sum of money 相當數目的一筆錢

other_types: 比較級：more respectful   最高級：most respectful
part_of_speech: adj.: 恭敬的；尊敬人的，尊重人的
sentences: The woman kept a respectful silence. 那位婦人恭敬地保持著沉默。

other_types: 過去式：responded   過去分詞：responded   現在分詞：responding
part_of_speech: vi.: 作答，回答[（+to）]；作出反應；響應[（+to/by/with）]
vt.: 以……回答[+that]
n.: 【宗】（會眾對牧師的）應答，唱和；【建】壁聯
sentences: Has she responded to your letter? 她有沒有回過你的信？
The government has responded to pressure and dropped the proposal. 政府已在壓力下放棄了這一建議。
The patient is responding well to treatment. 病人對治療反應良好。
respond in damages 承擔賠償責任
He responded no to the first question. 他對第一個問題的回答是否定的。

part_of_speech: n.: 責任[U][（+for）]；責任感[U]
sentences: A little child does not feel much responsibility. 小孩子不感到有什麼責任。
He is completely lacking in responsibility. 他完全沒有責任感。
Keeping house is my responsibility. 管家是我的事。

other_types: 比較級：more responsible   最高級：most responsible
part_of_speech: adj.: 需負責任的，承擔責任的[F][（+for/to）]；作為原因的[F][（+for）]
sentences: Politicians are responsible to the voters. 政治家應對選民負責。
She is my child, and I am responsible for her. 她是我的孩子，我對她負責。
Heavy rains were responsible for the shortage of vegetables. 大雨是蔬菜短缺的原因。
Bad weather is responsible for the poor crop. 壞天氣是收成不好的原因。
We should give the job to a responsible person. 我們應將該工作委託給一個有責任心的人。
She holds a very responsible position within the company. 她在公司的責任重大。
Mr. March held a responsible position. 馬奇先生擔任過要職。

other_types: 過去式：restored   過去分詞：restored   現在分詞：restoring
part_of_speech: vt.: 恢復；使復原[（+to）]
sentences: The army was called in to restore law and order to the place. 軍隊被召來恢復該地治安。
The new manager's job is to restore the company to profitability. 新經理的任務是使公司扭虧為贏。
He was completely restored. 他已完全復元。
I wonder if this picture can be restored. 我很想知道這幅畫能否修復。
The stolen bike was restored to its owner. 被盜自行車歸還了失主。
Their attempt to restore the king failed. 他們想使國王復位的企圖失敗了。

other_types: 過去式：restructured   過去分詞：restructured   現在分詞：restructuring
part_of_speech: vi. : 改組；重建；調整

other_types: 過去式：resumed   過去分詞：resumed   現在分詞：resuming
part_of_speech: vt.: 重新開始，繼續[+v-ing]；恢復；重返；重新佔用
vi.: 重新開始，繼續
sentences: They proposed that he should resume his job as farmhand. 他們建議他應重新做農夫的工作。
Those standing may now resume their seats. 諸位站著的現在可以重新坐下了。
They won the battle and resumed lost territory. 他們打勝了這一仗並收復了失地。
He paused, drank a glass of his wine, reflected for a moment, and resumed. 他停下來，喝了一杯酒，想了一會兒，又繼續說了下去。

other_types: 過去式：retailed   過去分詞：retailed   現在分詞：retailing
part_of_speech: n.: 零售[U]
adj.: 零售的[B]
adv.: 以零售方式；以零售價格
vt.: 零售[（+at/for）]
vi.: 零售[（+at/for）]
sentences: He made the sweets himself and sold them by retail. 他自己製作糖果零賣。
The retail price of the dress is 60 dollars. 這衣服的零售價是六十元。
They didn't sell their goods retail. 他們不零售貨物。
He intends to retail textile goods. 他打算零售紡織品。
These books retailed at a dollar. 這些書零售價為一元。

other_types: 過去式：retired   過去分詞：retired   現在分詞：retiring
part_of_speech: vt.: 使退休；令退役；使退卻，撤回
vi.: 退休；退役；退出；退隱[（+from/to）]
n.: 退隱[U]；退兵信號[the S]
sentences: The company retired him as soon as he reached sixty. 他一到六十歲公司就讓他退休了。
The general decided to retire his troops from action. 將軍決定將他的部隊撤出戰鬥。
The government retires worn or torn bills from use. 政府將破損的鈔票收回作廢。
Mr. Weller retired last month and now lives at his ease. 韋勒先生上個月退休了，現在過著悠閒的生活。
She retired to the country. 她退隱到鄉下去了。
Our armies have retired to regroup for a fresh attack. 我們的軍隊後撤重新編隊準備發動新的進攻。
He retired to bed, but he did not sleep. 他就寢了，但睡不著。

part_of_speech: n.: 退休；退職；退役[U][（+from）]；退休的實例[C]
sentences: She took to painting after retirement. 她退休後愛上繪畫。
We've had two retirements in our office this year. 今年我們辦公室已有二人退休。
He lives in retirement, away from everyone. 他遠離大家隱居著。

other_types: 過去式：reviewed   過去分詞：reviewed   現在分詞：reviewing
part_of_speech: vt.: 再檢查，重新探討；複審；批評，評論
vi.: 寫評論，寫書評；複習功課，溫習功課
n.: 再檢查；複審[C][U]；批評，評論[U][C]
sentences: Superior courts may review decisions of lower courts. 高等法院可以複審下級法院的判決。
He promised to review the film in one of the evening papers. 他答應在一家晚報上評論這部電影。
Before falling asleep, she reviewed the day's happenings. 入睡以前，她回顧了一天所發生的事情。
The President reviewed the fleet. 總統檢閱了艦隊。
In preparing for the exam, John reviewed his notes. 約翰複習筆記準備考試。
The students are busy reviewing for a test. 學生忙著複習迎考。
These arrangements are subject to periodic review. 這些安排須定期檢查。
His new book got mixed reviews. 對他的新書的評論毀譽參半。
He writes reviews for The New Yorker. 他為《紐約人》撰寫評論文章。
A review of the troops will be held during the general's visit. 將軍訪問期間要舉行閱兵式。
Before the examinations we have a review of the term's work. 考試之前，我們複習一學期的功課。

other_types: 過去式：revised   過去分詞：revised   現在分詞：revising
part_of_speech: vt.: 修訂；校訂；修改，修正
vi.: 修訂；校訂；【主英】複習功課[（+for）]
n.[C]: 修訂；校訂；【印】再校樣，二校樣
sentences: The writer revised the manuscript. 作者訂正手稿。
He revised his story to make it shorter. 他修改了他的故事，把它縮短了。
The students are busy revising for the examination. 學生們忙於溫課迎考。

part_of_speech: adj.: 經過修訂（或校正）的；revise的動詞過去式、過去分詞
ph.: 立刻, 馬上
sentences: Now we must be off right away. It's eight already. 現在我們必須馬上離開, 已經八點了。
The principal wants to see you right away. 校長馬上要見你。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 競爭者，對手，敵手；匹敵者，可與之相比的人（或物）
adj.: 競爭的
vt.: 與……競爭；與……匹敵；比得上
vi.: 競爭
sentences: They are rivals for the same office. 他們是爭奪同一個職位的敵手。
His collection of stamps has few rivals in the world. 他搜集的郵票幾乎舉世無雙。
The rival companies tried to outsell one another. 相互競爭的公司試圖比對方銷售出更多的貨物。
The stores rival each other in beautiful window displays. 商店在櫥窗陳列方面互相比美。
She lived in many places, but she says nothing can rival the beauty of the Rocky Mountains. 她住過許多地方，但是她說洛基山的美無與倫比。
He soon rivaled the others in skill. 他在技術上不久便與其他人匹敵。

part_of_speech: n.: 路邊；路旁地帶[the S]
adj.: 路邊的，路旁的
sentences: The woman walked along the roadside. 那女人沿著路邊行走。

part_of_speech: adv.: 粗糙地；粗暴地
sentences: He treated me roughly. 他待我粗暴。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 路；路線；路程；航線[C]；【美】（報紙，郵件等的）遞送區域（或路線）；（商品推銷員的）固定推銷路線[C]
vt.: 按規定路線發送[O][（+through/by way of）]；給……定路線；安排……的程序
sentences: This is the shortest route from Boston to New York. 這是從波士頓到紐約的最短路線。
Twenty houses are on my paper route. 劃給我的送報地區有二十幢房子。
Our travel agent routed us through Italy. 我們的旅行社安排我們途經義大利。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: （機場的）跑道；（停車場的）車道，坡道；河床
sentences: The runway has been cleared for take-off. 跑道已經過清除，可以起飛。

part_of_speech: n.: 薪資，薪水[C][U]
vt.: 給……薪水[H]
sentences: He finally got a job in a company paying good salaries. 他終於在一家薪水高的公司裡找到一份工作。

part_of_speech: n.: 賣，出售[U][C]；銷售業務；營業；推銷[P]
sentences: These goods are entirely unfit for sale. 這些貨物完全不宜銷售。
Sales are down this month. 這個月的銷售額減少了。
There was no sale for black and white TV sets. 黑白電視機沒有銷路。
This camera is now on sale for 19 dollars only. 這種照相機現在廉價出售，只賣十九元。

other_types: 過去式：salvaged   過去分詞：salvaged   現在分詞：salvaging
part_of_speech: n.[U]: 海難救助；搶救；挽救；救助酬金
vt.: 救助；營救；搶救；挽救[（+from）]；打撈
sentences: We were unable to salvage anything when the factory burnt down. 當工廠燒毀時，我們沒有能搶救出任何東西。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 樣品，樣本；試用品；例子，實例
adj.: 樣品的；試樣的；作為例子的
vt.: 取……的樣品；抽樣檢查；品嚐；體驗
sentences: Our firm gives away free samples of cloth. 我們公司免費贈送布料樣品。
You'd better give a sample of your ability or skill. 你最好用實例示範你的能力或技巧。
He sent me a sample copy of the book. 他寄給我一本樣書。
His job is to sample products for defects. 他的工作是抽樣檢查產品的瑕疵。
Next he sampled the red wine. 接著他又品嚐了紅葡萄酒。
I spent a few days sampling the literature of social science. 我花了幾天時間瀏覽有關社會科學的文獻。

other_types: 比較級：more satisfactory   最高級：most satisfactory
part_of_speech: adj.: 令人滿意的；符合要求的；良好的；【宗】贖罪的
sentences: Of all the pens he tried, only one was satisfactory. 在他所試的筆中，只有一支是令人滿意的。

part_of_speech: adj.: 感到滿意的；令人滿意的；滿足的；清償了的
vt.: 動詞 satisfy 的過去式和過去分詞
vi.: 動詞 satisfy 的過去式和過去分詞；satisfy的動詞過去式、過去分詞
sentences: I will not be satisfied with playing only four rounds of mahjong. The minimum is eight rounds for me. 麻將只打四圈我是不能滿足的，至少得打個八圈。

other_types: 過去式：satisfied   過去分詞：satisfied   現在分詞：satisfying
part_of_speech: vt.: 使滿意，使高興；使滿足[H][（+with）]；滿足（需要，慾望等）
vi.: 令人滿意；令人滿足；【宗】（基督）替世人贖罪
sentences: That answer won't satisfy her. 那個回答不能令她滿意。
Our company will do everything to satisfy our customers. 我們公司將盡一切努力令顧客滿意。
You can't apply for the job until you have satisfied certain conditions. 符合某些條件前，你不能申請這個工作。
Are you satisfied that he is telling the truth? 你能否確信他是在講實話嗎？
Her remarks satisfied his doubts. 她的一番話消除了他的疑慮。
Both sides strove to satisfy the contract. 雙方都努力履行契約。

other_types: 過去式：saved   過去分詞：saved   現在分詞：saving
part_of_speech: vt.: 救，挽救[（+from）]；節省，省去；避免[O1][（+from）]
vi.: 儲蓄；積蓄[（+up/for）]；節省，節約
n.: 救球[C]
sentences: He saved me from drowning. 他救了我，使我免遭溺斃。
The doctor saved the child's life. 這位醫生挽救了孩子的生命。
The computer will save us a lot of time. 電腦將使我們省下許多時間。
These robots will save us a lot of labor. 這些機器人可以節省我們大量勞工。
He promised to save a room for me. 他答應給我留個房間。
We've been saving for five years to buy a house. 為了買房子，我們已儲蓄了五年。

part_of_speech: n.: （戲劇的）一場；（電影，電視的）一個鏡頭[C]；場面；事件[C]
sentences: What a fantastic mountain scene! 多麼迷人的山景！
The criminal fled the scene. 罪犯逃離了現場。
The scene of this play is set in Ireland. 這齣戲的場景是在愛爾蘭。
They made a scene of trifles. 他們為小事當眾吵鬧。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 風景，景色；【戲】舞臺布景
sentences: The mountain scenery is majestic. 這山景十分壯麗。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 表；清單；目錄；【美】時間表；課程表；（火車等的）時刻表
vt.: 將……列表（或清單等）；將……列入計畫（或時間）表
sentences: Have you got a schedule of postal charges? 你有沒有郵資價目表？
The teacher posted the schedule of classes. 教師將課程表公布出來了。
They have planned a tight schedule of travel. 他們安排了一個緊湊的旅行日程。
The delegation is scheduled to arrive tomorrow. 代表團定於明日到達。

other_types: 過去式：scrutinized   過去分詞：scrutinized   現在分詞：scrutinizing
part_of_speech: vt.: 詳細檢查；細看
vi.: 作詳細檢查；細閱
ph.: 【電腦】搜索引擎（指關鍵字搜尋演算法或是包括搜尋演算法的套裝軟體）

other_types: 比較級：more secluded   最高級：most secluded
part_of_speech: adj.: 與世隔絕的；隱退的，隱居的；隱蔽的，僻靜的
sentences: This is the quietest and most secluded area of the city. 這是全城最安靜最僻靜的地區。

part_of_speech: adj.: 書記的；祕書的；部長的
n.[C]: 祕書[（+to）]；（政府機關等的）祕書官，書記官
sentences: Mary is private secretary to the company chairman. 瑪麗是公司董事長的私人祕書。
He was the then secretary of Defense. 他是當時的國防部長。

other_types: 過去式：selected   過去分詞：selected   現在分詞：selecting
part_of_speech: vt.: 選擇，挑選，選拔[（+for/from）][O2]
vi.: 作出選擇，挑選
adj.: 挑選出來的；精選的[Z][B]；上等的，優等的，卓越的[Z]
n.[P]: 被挑選出來的人（或物）；優等品；精萃
sentences: Mr. Reed has been selected to represent us on the committee. 里德先生已作為我們的代表被選入委員會。
He selected a team for the special task. 他為這項特殊任務挑選了一組人馬。
A select group of their friends was invited to the wedding. 他們的經過挑選的一群朋友應邀參加婚禮。
She only stays at select hotels. 她只住一流旅館。
That college is very select. 那所學院入學要求十分嚴格。

part_of_speech: n.: 選擇；選拔[U]；被挑選出的人（或物）；精選品；選手[C]
sentences: It took her a long time to make the selection of this dress. 挑選這件連衣裙花了她很長的時間。
She was my selection. 她是我挑選出的人。
This volume contains selections from his early works. 該卷包含了他的早期作品文選。
selections from Faulkner 福克納選集

part_of_speech: adj.: 有選擇性的；有選擇能力的
n.[C]: （大學裡由教授指導的）研究班，研討班；（研究班的）專題討論會
sentences: The children's tutors were replaced by new teachers and students from the pedagogy seminaries. 孩子們的輔導員由新老師和教育學研究班的學生接替。
There is a seminar on international business opportunities this evening. 今晚有一個關於國際商務機會的專題討論會。
a seminar on environmental protection 關於環境保護問題的討論會

part_of_speech: adj.: 年長的，年紀較大的[（+to）]；地位較高的；年資較深的[（+to）]
n.[C]: 較年長者；前輩；上司；學長；資深人士
sentences: Bob is two years senior to me. 鮑伯比我大兩歲。
He is a senior member of the committee. 他是委員會中的資深委員。
His father was a senior officer at the bank. 他父親是那家銀行的高級職員。
John Parker, Sr. is the father of John Parker, Jr. 老約翰‧派克是小約翰‧派克的父親。
Her boyfriend is her senior by six years. 她的男朋友比她大六歲。
He was my senior at Yale by two years. 他是耶魯大學比我高兩級的學生。
The seniors defeated the juniors by 3-1. 四年級學生以三比一戰勝了三年級學生。

part_of_speech: adj.: 嚴重的；危急的；令人擔心的；嚴肅的，莊嚴的
sentences: His error is serious. 他的錯誤很嚴重。
He was kind and affectionate, but very serious. 他仁慈、親切，但非常嚴肅。
I was pretty serious in what I said at dinner. 我晚餐時說的話是當真的。
Getting married is a serious matter. 結婚是件大事。
The play was amusingly written, but its subject was a serious one. 劇本寫得風趣逗笑，但其主題則是嚴肅的。
He is not serious about literature. 他對文學不感興趣。

part_of_speech: n.: 服務；效勞；幫助[U][P1]；招待，服侍；服務態度[U]
vt.: 為……服務；檢修，維修，保養
