sentences: He died in the service of his country. 他為國捐軀。
That hotel is noted for its fine service. 那家旅館以服務優良著稱。
There is a good bus service into the city. 往市內的公車十分方便。
In a way good service sells our products. 良好的售後服務在某種程度上促進了我們產品的銷路。
We have the machines serviced regularly. 我們請人定期維修機器。

part_of_speech: a.[Z]: 幾個的，數個的[B]；【書】各不相同的，各自的[B]
pron.: 幾個，數個
sentences: He was seriously injured in the accident and died several days later. 他在那次事故中受了重傷，幾天後就死了。
Several have quit working. 有幾個人已經辭職了。
Several of the windows were broken. 有幾扇玻璃窗被砸碎了。

part_of_speech: n.: 形狀；樣子，外形[C][U]；（表現）形式；體現，具體化[U][C]
vt.: 使成形；塑造，製作[（+into/from/out of）]；形成
vi.: 【口】成形；成型；形成[（+up/into）]；成長，發展
sentences: The sculptor worked the clay into the shape of a woman. 雕刻家將泥土捏成一個婦女的形狀。
The writer's dreams find a shape in his novel. 作者的理想在他的小說中得到體現。
Athletes must stay in shape. 運動員一定要保持身體健康。
In the darkness, I saw a shape tiptoeing out. 在黑暗中，我看見有個身影悄悄走出去。
The potter shaped the clay into a vase. 陶工將泥土塑成花瓶。
Childhood experiences often play a big part in shaping one's character. 童年經歷在形成一個人的性格方面往往起重要作用。
The dress was shaped to her figure. 這件洋裝做得很適合她的身材。
Our vacation plans are shaping well. 我們的假期計畫進展順利。

part_of_speech: adj.: 鋒利的；尖的；陡的，急轉的
adv.: 整（指時刻）[Z]；銳利地；機警地；急劇地；突然地
n.[C]: 【音】升半音；升記號[#]；【口】騙子
vt.: 【音】把（音調）提高半音
vi.: 【音】升音演唱（或演奏）
sentences: You must be very careful with this sharp knife. 你用這把鋒利的刀子必須很小心。
The driver found the sharp left turn very difficult. 司機發現在那個左急轉彎，車子很難開。
She studied the young man with her sharp bright eyes. 她用明亮銳利的眼睛端詳這年輕男士。
That photograph is not sharp enough. 那張照片不夠清晰。
She's got a sharp tongue. 她說話很刻薄。
This cheese has a sharp flavor. 這種乳酪的味道很強烈。
a sharp businessman 精明的生意人
Uncle George's new car is really sharp. 喬治叔叔的新車實在設計優美。
You really look sharp in that new outfit. 你穿那套衣服看起來很帥。
The lecture started at three o'clock sharp. 演講於三點整開始。
He is singing sharp. 他唱得偏高一點。

other_types: 過去式：shifted   過去分詞：shifted   現在分詞：shifting
part_of_speech: vt.: 轉移；移動，搬移；替換，更換；變動，改變
vi.: 轉移；移動；變換，改變
n.[C]: 轉換；轉移；轉變[（+in）]；手段，辦法；權宜之計[P]
sentences: In August we shifted our furniture to Dublin. 八月時我們把傢俱搬到了都柏林。
A sunset like this shifted its tints every moment. 像這樣的日落時時刻刻在改變著色彩。
He always tries to shift the blame to someone else. 他總是試圖將過錯推卸給別人。
Should I shift gears before making a turn? 我拐彎之前該不該換擋？
No detergent can shift these stains. 任何清潔劑都不能除掉這些汙跡。
The boy shifted uncomfortably in his chair. 這男孩不舒服地在椅子裡動來動去。
He shifted hastily to a new subject. 他匆忙轉換一個新的話題。
The man went abroad, leaving his wife and children to shift for themselves. 那男人去了海外，留下妻子兒女自謀生計。
You have to shift as you drive around the corner. 你拐角時要換擋變速。
A sudden shift in weight caused the boat to turn over. 重量突然轉移使船翻了。
The lazy man tried every shift to avoid doing his work. 這懶漢採取各種手段迴避工作。
She works on the night shift. 她上夜班。
The night shift are arriving. 夜班工人正陸續來到。

other_types: 動詞變化：shone /  shined / shone /  shined / shining
part_of_speech: vi.: 發光；照耀；顯露；發亮
vt.: 把……的光投向，把……照向[O]；擦亮（shined; shined）
n.: 光，光亮；光澤；光彩[S]；磨光，擦亮[S]
sentences: The sun shone bright and warm. 陽光燦爛和煦。
The joy shone clear on his face. 他喜形於色。
He shines at golf. 他高爾夫球打得很出色。
He shone the flashlight on the water. 他用手電筒照了照水面。
Have you shined your boots? 你皮靴擦過沒有？
The waxed floor had a good shine. 打蠟地板閃閃發光。
Your shoes need a shine. 你的皮鞋要擦一擦。

part_of_speech: n.: 運輸；運送；裝運[C][U][（+from/to）]；運輸的貨物；裝載的貨物（量）[C][（+from/to/of）]
sentences: The blockade prevented shipments of foreign food from reaching our shores. 封鎖使國外食品不能運抵我們的海岸。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 運輸；運輸業；（總稱）船舶；船舶噸數
sentences: British shipping has decreased in recent years. 英國的船舶噸數近年來已經減少了。

part_of_speech: n.: 缺少，不足，匱乏[U][C]；不足額（或量）[C]
sentences: There is a shortage of salt in this country. 這個國家缺少鹽。
The total shortage was 500 tons. 短缺之總額為五百噸。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: （織機的）梭，梭子；（縫紉機的）擺梭；穿梭般來回的東西；（車輛、飛機等在兩地間的）短程穿梭運行；短程穿梭運輸線
vt.: 短程穿梭般運送[O]；使穿梭般來回移動
vi.: 短程穿梭般往返；穿梭般來回移動
sentences: The shuttle moves backwards and forwards through the warp. 梭子在經線中來回移動。
We shuttled the passengers to the city center by helicopter. 我們使用直升機往返不停地將旅客運送到市中心。

part_of_speech: n.: 觀光，遊覽[U]
adj.: 觀光的，遊覽的；sightsee的動詞現在分詞、動名詞
sentences: Some people like to lie on the beach, but I prefer sightseeing. 有些人喜歡躺在海灘上，而我則寧願去遊覽觀光。

other_types: 比較級：more significant   最高級：most significant
part_of_speech: adj.: 有意義的；意義（或意味）深長的；表示……的[+of]
n.[C: 有意義的事物；標誌，象徵
sentences: I noticed that there has been a significant change on you. 我注意到你身上發生了有意義的改變。
Smiles are significant of pleasure. 微笑表示愉快。
This is one of the most significant studies of the subject. 這是對該課題最重要的研究之一。

other_types: 過去式：simplified   過去分詞：simplified   現在分詞：simplifying
part_of_speech: vt.: 簡化，精簡；使單純；使平易
sentences: The subject is immensely complex, and hard to simplify. 這個題目非常複雜，並且很難簡化。

part_of_speech: n.: 處境，境遇[C]；形勢；情況；局面[C]
sentences: He is in a difficult situation. 他處境困難。
The economic situation is now different. 現在經濟形勢不同了。
The house has a beautiful situation on a hill. 房子座落在小山上，環境優美。

other_types: 過去式：slumped   過去分詞：slumped   現在分詞：slumping
part_of_speech: vi.: （突然或沉重地）倒下，陷落[Q][（+down）]；（物價等）下跌；（經濟等）衰落；（健康等）下降
vt.: 使倒下；使降低；使衰落
n.[C]: 暴跌；下降；不景氣；消沉，萎靡；衰退
sentences: The old man slumped down in a chair. 老人猛地倒在椅子裡。
Sales have slumped badly. 銷售量銳減。
This brought about a heavy slump in prices. 這引起物價猛跌。
There was a serious slump in the 1930s. 二十世紀三十年代發生過嚴重的經濟衰退。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 【電腦】軟體；（跟隨電子設備的）程式材料
sentences: My job is writing the software. 我的工作是寫軟體。

part_of_speech: adj.: 太陽的；日光的；源自太陽的；利用太陽光的
sentences: They accurately predicted solar eclipses. 他們精確地預告了日蝕。
a solar engine 太陽能發動機

other_types: 比較級：more spacious   最高級：most spacious
part_of_speech: adj.: 寬敞的；廣闊的，無邊無際的
sentences: We entered a spacious dining-room. 我們來到一個寬敞的餐廳。

part_of_speech: ph.: 備用零件
ph.: 業餘時間

other_types: 過去式：specialized   過去分詞：specialized   現在分詞：specializing
part_of_speech: vi.: 專攻；專門從事[（+in）]；【生】專化，特化
vt.: 使專門化；使特殊化；【生】使專化，使特化
sentences: Dr. White specialized in children's diseases. 懷特醫生專治兒科疾病。
Each case must be specialized. 每個案例都要進行特殊分析。
specialized knowledge 專門知識

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 專業；專長；特製品，特產，名產
adj.: 特色的
sentences: Her specialty is biochemistry. 她的專業是生物化學。
Shell carvings are a specialty of the town. 貝雕是該城的特產。
a specialty store 特色商店

part_of_speech: n.: 載明；詳述[U][（+of）]；規格；明細單；詳細計畫書[P][（+for）]
sentences: The engineer can't start working without the specification for the design. 沒有關於設計的詳細計畫，工程師無法開工。
the specification of a microwave oven 微波爐說明書

other_types: 過去式：specified   過去分詞：specified   現在分詞：specifying
part_of_speech: vt.: 具體指定；詳細指明；明確說明[+that][+wh-]；把……列入說明書（或清單等）
sentences: The directions specify how the medicine is to be used. 說明書上規定了這藥如何服用。
The contract specifies red tiles for the roof. 合同規定屋頂用紅瓦蓋。

part_of_speech: n.: （比賽等的）觀眾；旁觀者；目擊者[C]
sentences: The game drew thousands of spectators. 這場比賽吸引了數千名觀眾。

part_of_speech: n.: 馬，馬棚；畜舍[S][P1]；（屬於同一主人或馴馬師的）一群賽馬[S][（+of）]
vt.: 把……拴入馬廄
vi.: 住於廄中
sentences: The horses were led into the stable and each put in a stall. 馬被牽入馬棚，每匹馬都分放在各自的欄內。
The black horse is one of Mr. King's stable. 那匹黑馬是金先生的賽馬之一。
He has a whole stable of informers working for him. 他有一群告密者為他效勞。
Horses and cows were stabled on the lower floor. 馬和牛關在馬廄的底下一層。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 斯塔德（古希臘的長度單位，相當於607-738呎）；體育場，運動場；球場；競技場
sentences: The stadium was filled for the final baseball game. 體育場被觀看最後一場棒球比賽的人群擠滿了。

part_of_speech: n.: （全體）職員，（全體）工作人員[C][G]；幕僚；參謀人員；參謀機構[C][G]
vt.: 給……配備職員[H][（+with）]
sentences: The teaching staff of this college is/are excellent. 這所大學的教師都是出類拔萃的。
He's got some experts on the staff. 他的工作人員中有一些專家。
I have a staff of 15. 我有十五名幕僚。
The old man walked with a wooden staff. 那老漢拄著木柺杖走路。
The flag was flown at half-staff. 那旗幟降了半旗。
The boy was the staff and pride of their age. 這男孩是他們老年時的依靠和驕傲。
Our hospital is staffed with 30 doctors. 我們醫院有三十名醫生。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: （鐵絲）釘書機；小釘書機；裝釘工
sentences: He used a stapler to staple these two pieces of A4 paper together. 他用一個釘書機把這兩張A4紙釘在一起。

other_types: 過去式：stared   過去分詞：stared   現在分詞：staring
part_of_speech: vi.: 盯，凝視[（+at/into/out of）]；顯眼，顯見[Q][（+at/from）]
vt.: 盯，凝視，注視；目不轉睛把……看得[（+into/out of）]
n.: 凝視，注視；瞪眼[C]
sentences: Don't stare at me like that. 別那樣盯著我看。
We stared at him in amazement. 我們驚奇地注視著他。
The old man stared the uninvited guest up and down. 老人把不速之客上下打量了一番。
He gave her a rude stare. 他粗魯地瞪了她一眼。

part_of_speech: n.: 開端；（賽跑時的）發令員；起動裝置
n.: 文具；信紙[U]
sentences: Don't send the order yet, there is a liberal supply of stationery. 現在還不要寄訂單，因為尚有很多文具。
stationery and envelopes 信紙信封

other_types: 過去式：steeped   過去分詞：steeped   現在分詞：steeping
part_of_speech: vt.: 泡，浸泡；浸透；使埋頭，使沉湎；使充滿[H][（+in）]
vi.: 泡，浸泡；浸透
n.: 浸泡；浸泡液
sentences: She steeped the tea in boiling water. 她用滾開的水泡茶。
Professor Smith is steeped in surface physics. 史密斯教授埋頭研究表面物理。
Let the tea leaves steep in boiling water for five minutes. 讓茶葉在滾開的水中浸泡五分鐘。
Put the rice in steep for some time before milling. 碾磨之前先將大米浸泡一些時間。

part_of_speech: n.: 貯存；（知識等的）積蓄[C][U]；進貨，庫存品，存貨[C][U]
vt.: 給（商店）辦貨，進貨[（+up/with）]；庫存，貯存
vi.: 出新芽；辦貨[（+up）]
adj.: 庫存的；現有的；常備的；陳腐的；平凡的；慣用的
sentences: The sailor has a rich stock of tales of adventure. 那個水手滿肚子都是探險故事。
There is not much stock in the shop right now. 目前店裡存貨不多。
Stocks of the company are falling. 該公司的股票正在下跌。
The new employee is a man of Spanish stock. 新來的僱員是西班牙裔的男子。
We stock all types of fur coats. 我們有各種皮衣供應。
You had better stock up with sugar because there is going to be a shortage. 你最好購進食糖，因為市場上馬上就要缺貨了。
I'm tired of his stock reply. 我已聽厭了他老一套的回答。

part_of_speech: n.: 戰略；戰略學[U]；策略，計謀；對策[C][（+for）][+to-v]
sentences: He is an expert in military strategy. 他是軍事戰略專家。
The government adopted a strategy of massive deflation. 政府採取了大規模緊縮通貨的策略。
By careful strategy he managed to push the proposal through. 透過審慎的謀劃，他成功地使該建議獲得通過。

other_types: 過去式：streamlined   過去分詞：streamlined   現在分詞：streamlining
part_of_speech: n.: 流線型
adj.: 流線型的
vt.: 把……設計成流線型；使現代化

other_types: 動詞變化：struck / struck /  stricken / striking
part_of_speech: vt.: 打，擊，攻擊[O1]；（用爪）抓傷；（用毒牙）咬傷；（疾病）侵襲
vi.: 打，擊；襲擊；進攻[（+out）]；（鐘）敲，鳴；（時間）被鳴報
n.[C]: 打擊；攻擊；空襲；罷工，罷課，罷市
sentences: He was struck by lightning. 他被閃電擊中。
She struck him with a stick. 她用棍子打他。
The snake struck the man's hand. 蛇咬傷了那男人的手。
The clock struck twelve. 鐘敲十二點。
The morning sun struck the hilltops. 朝陽照到山頂上。
The girl struck a match to light a cigarette. 那女孩劃火柴點燃一根菸。
They will strike a medal in memory of the great victory. 他們將為紀念這一偉大勝利鑄造一枚勛章。
She read through her essay and struck out a few words here and there. 她將論文通讀一遍，在一些地方刪去了幾個字。
We struck a compromise. 我們達成了妥協。
That play struck me as silly. 那齣戲我覺得很無聊。
They struck camp in the morning. 他們在早晨撤營。
The wind struck a chill into my bones. 風吹得我寒冷徹骨。
He struck a knife into the traitor's heart. 他將刀戳入賣國賊的心臟。
The cuttings have struck roots. 這些插枝已經生了根。
The car struck the main road. 汽車開上了大道。
After months of prospecting he finally struck gold. 經過數月的勘探，他終於發現了金礦。
He struck an attitude of dignity. 他裝出一副尊嚴的樣子。
He struck a tune on the piano. 他在鋼琴上彈了一首曲子。
It struck me that there was no one at home. 我突然想起家中沒有人。
We were struck dumb with horror. 我們被嚇得張口結舌。
His knee struck against the chair. 他的膝蓋撞到了椅子上。
The enemy struck at dawn. 敵人於拂曉時發起進攻。
Twelve has just struck. 剛剛敲過十二點。
He struck on a solution to the problem. 他突然想到一個解決問題的辦法。
The match wouldn't strike. 這火柴劃不著。
A sound struck on his ear. 他聽到一個聲音。
Raising herself slightly, the snake struck. 那條蛇稍稍抬起身，咬了一口。
The coal miners struck for better safety conditions. 煤礦工人罷工要求改善安全狀況。
They struck north. 他們向北走去。
The enemy ship struck. 敵艦降旗投降。
The commander decided to make an air strike on the enemy's supply line. 指揮官決定空襲敵人的補給線。
The steel workers called a strike. 鋼鐵工人發動了罷工。
The bus drivers' strike stopped all traffic. 公車司機罷工使一切交通停頓。
He made a lucky strike and in three months realized a considerable fortune. 他交了好運，三個月就發了相當大的一筆財。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: （畫家等的）工作室，畫室；雕塑室；攝影室；照相館
sentences: Upstairs he had a studio where he painted a little. 他在樓上有一個畫室，有時在那裡作一點畫。
Some of Hollywood's leading studios are interested in signing her. 好萊塢的一些主要電影製片廠有意要和她簽約。

other_types: 過去式：submitted   過去分詞：submitted   現在分詞：submitting
part_of_speech: vt.: 使服從，使屈服[（+to）]；使經受，使受到[（+to）]
vi.: 屈從；忍受；甘受[（+to）]
sentences: We'll submit ourselves to the court's judgments. 我們將聽從法庭的裁決。
The metal was submitted to analysis. 對該金屬進行了分析。
He submitted his proposal for urban development to the city council. 他將城市發展建議提交市議會。
I submit that the terms are entirely unreasonable. 我認為那些條件完全不合理。
I submit that more proof is needed to support the case. 我認為這個案子需要更多的證據證實。
She refused to submit to his control. 她不屈服於他的控制。

other_types: 過去式：subscribed   過去分詞：subscribed   現在分詞：subscribing
part_of_speech: vt.: 認捐；捐助[（+to）]；（在文件等下面）簽（名），署（名）[（+to）][O9]
vi.: 認捐；捐款[（+to）]；訂閱；訂購（書籍等）[（+to/for）]
sentences: He subscribed a large sum to the relief fund. 他向救濟基金捐贈巨資。
He subscribed his name to a petition. 他在請願書上簽名。
They subscribed to local charities. 他們向當地的慈善團體捐款。
He subscribed to Reader's Digest. 他訂閱《讀者文摘》。
Each of us subscribed for 500 shares. 我們每人認購五百股。
He did not subscribe to my proposal. 他不贊同我的建議。

part_of_speech: n.: 捐款，認捐[U][（+to）]；同意，贊成[C]
sentences: his subscription to a fund 他對一項基金的捐款
My subscription to the magazine will soon expire, I will renew it. 我訂閱的雜誌快到期了，我將續訂。

part_of_speech: adj.: 輔助的，附帶的；次要的；隸屬的，附設的
n.[C]: 輔助者；輔助物；子公司
sentences: Public transportation played a subsidiary role. 公共交通起輔助的作用。
The subsidiary is in France but the parent company is in America. 子公司在法國，但母公司在美國。

other_types: 過去式：suggested   過去分詞：suggested   現在分詞：suggesting
part_of_speech: vt.: 建議，提議[+v-ing][+（that）][+wh-]；暗示；啟發[+（that）]
sentences: I suggest our going to the park on Sunday. 我建議我們星期天去公園。
The dentist suggested that she (should) come another day. 牙醫建議她改天再來。
Her expression suggested pleasure. 她面露喜色。
That cloud suggests a boat to me. 那朵雲使我聯想到船。

part_of_speech: n.: 建議，提議[C][U][+that]；暗示，示意，啟發；聯想[U]
sentences: I ordered a steak at his suggestion. 我根據他的建議點了一份牛排。
Poetry achieves its finest effects by suggestion. 詩歌借助暗示聯想達到最佳意境。
I detected a suggestion of malice in his remarks. 我察覺他的話中帶有一點惡意。
Such is the power of suggestion that within two minutes the patient is asleep. 催眠暗示的力量很大，病人不到兩分鐘便入睡了。

part_of_speech: n.: （一套）衣服；西裝[C]；套；副；組[C]
vt.: 適合，中……的意；（不用被動式）與……相配，與……相稱
vi.: 合適，適當；相稱；彼此協調[（+to/with）]
sentences: I picked out a black suit. 我挑了一套黑色西裝。
He will bring a suit against his boss. 他要對老板提出控告。
Would Friday morning suit you? 星期五早上對你合適嗎？
The arrangement suited us both. 這個安排對我們兩人都合適。
This dress suits you beautifully. 這件衣服你穿非常合適。
Her speech was well suited to the occasion. 她的講話在這個場合十分得體。
Will that time suit? 這時間合適嗎？
The position suits with his abilities. 這個職位與他的能力相稱。

part_of_speech: n.: 適合；適當；相配

other_types: 比較級：more suitable   最高級：most suitable
part_of_speech: adj.: 適當的；合適的；適宜的[（+to/for）]
sentences: He was just not suitable for the job. 他就是不適合幹這份工作。

other_types: 過去式：supervised   過去分詞：supervised   現在分詞：supervising
part_of_speech: vt.: 監督；管理；指導
vi.: 監督；管理；指導
sentences: She supervises the whole department. 她管理這整個部門。

part_of_speech: n.: 管理；監督[U]
sentences: There are five people under her supervision. 有五個人在她的監督之下。
New workers often need close supervision. 新工人通常需要嚴密的管理。

part_of_speech: n.: 供應者；供應商，供應廠商；供應國

other_types: 過去式：supplied   過去分詞：supplied   現在分詞：supplying
part_of_speech: vt.: 供給，供應，提供[O1][（+to/for/with）]；補充；滿足
n.: 供給，供應[U]；供應量；供應品；庫存（貨）[C]
sentences: Our farm supplies the market with fruits and vegetables. 我們的農場為市場提供水果和蔬菜。
We supply power to the three nearby towns. 我們對附近的三個城鎮提供電力。
They are engaged in the supply of small parts for replacement. 他們從事提供備用小零件的工作。
We have new supplies of fur coats. 我們有新進貨的皮大衣。
Our medical supplies are running short. 我們的醫療用品快用完了。
My father has cut off the supplies. 父親停止給我生活費了。

other_types: 過去式：supported   過去分詞：supported   現在分詞：supporting
part_of_speech: vt.: 支撐，支托，扶持；支持，擁護，贊成；資助
n.: 支撐，支承[U]；支撐物，支柱；支持者[C]
sentences: The old man entered the room supported by his grandson. 老人由孫子扶著進了房間。
They supported the Democratic Party. 他們支持民主黨。
He has a large family to support. 他要撫養一大家人。
Can you give some examples to support your argument? 你能舉幾個例子來證實你的論點嗎？
The desert climate supports little plant life. 沙漠裡的氣候使絕大多數植物無法存活。
Hunter is the chief support of the family. 漢特是他一家的主要贍養者。
We need your support. 我們需要你們的支持。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 支持者；擁護者；援助者；扶養者，贍養者
sentences: I'm a strong supporter of women's rights. 我是一個婦女權益的堅強支持者。

part_of_speech: n.: 環境；周圍的事物[P]
adj.: 周圍的；附近的[B]；surround的動詞現在分詞、動名詞
sentences: He didn't pay much attention to his surroundings. 他沒有多注意他周圍的環境。
Foxes started coming in from the surrounding countryside. 狐狸開始從附近的鄉下跑進來。

other_types: 比較級：more suspicious   最高級：most suspicious
part_of_speech: adj.: 猜疑的，疑心的；多疑的[（+of）]；可疑的，有蹊蹺的
sentences: I'm suspicious of the government's intentions. 我懷疑政府的意圖。
There were suspicious circumstances about his death. 關於他的死，有一些值得懷疑的情況。

part_of_speech: n.: 配電盤；（電話）接線總機
adj.: 有系統的；成體系的；（做事）有條理的
sentences: This problem cries out for a long-term, open-minded, systematic search. 這個問題十分需要長期的、不帶偏見的、系統的探索研究。
He is systematic in his approach to work. 他工作起來井井有條。
The police made a systematic search of the house. 警察對房子進行了徹底的搜查。

part_of_speech: n.: 靶子；攻擊的目標；（欲達到的）目標，指標
vt.: 把……作為目標（或對象）；規定……的指標
sentences: He missed the target. 他未擊中靶子。
His target is to save $100 a week. 他的目標是每週儲蓄一百元。
His proposal became the target of criticism. 他的建議成了批評的目標。
The company has targeted a profit for the year. 公司已經規定了今年的利潤指標。

part_of_speech: n.: 稅；稅金[C][U][（+on/upon）]；負擔；壓力[S][（+on/upon）]
vt.: 向……課稅；向……收會費
sentences: Every citizen must pay taxes. 每個公民都必須納稅。
The care of six children was a tax on her energies. 照料六個孩子成了她精力上很大的負擔。
A government can tax its citizens directly, and it can tax the property they own. 政府可以直接向公民課稅，也可以對他們的財產課稅。
Reading in a poor light taxes the eye. 在光線不好的地方看書會使眼睛很累。

other_types: 比較級：more technical   最高級：most technical
part_of_speech: adj.: 工藝的；技術的；科技的[Z]；專門的，技術性的
sentences: Technical advances improve productivity. 技術進步提高生產力。
The job calls for technical skill. 做這項工作需要專門技術。
He continued to maintain his technical innocence of any indictable offence. 他仍然聲稱自己從嚴格的法律意義上說並未犯有任何可以起訴的罪行。
technical sulphuric acid 工業硫酸

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 技術人員，技師；（繪畫，音樂等方面）技巧純熟的人
sentences: He is an electrical technician by profession. 他的職業是電工技師。

part_of_speech: adj.: 臨時的；暫時的，一時的[Z]
n.[C]: 臨時工，臨時僱員；臨時事物；臨時房屋
sentences: Ellen has got a temporary job. 艾倫找到一份臨時工作。
She works in the office as a temporary. 她在辦公室做臨時僱員。
The wartime temporaries will be replaced by permanent homes. 那些戰時臨時住房將被永久性住宅代替。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 房客；佃戶；承租人；住戶，居住者
vt.: 租，租賃[H]；居住於[H]
sentences: Do you own the house or are you a tenant? 你是擁有這幢房子還是租住的？
Birds are tenants of the trees. 鳥兒棲息在樹林之中。
This house is tenanted by an immigrant from Asia. 這所房屋為一個來自亞洲的移民所租住。
That old house has not been tenanted for many years. 那幢老房子已經多年無人居住了。

other_types: 過去式：terminated   過去分詞：terminated   現在分詞：terminating
part_of_speech: vt.: 使停止，使結束；使終止；使結尾；【美】免……的職，解僱
vi.: 結束；終止[Q]；結果[（+in）]
sentences: They have terminated the contract. 他們已中止了合同。
During the economic recession the factory terminated a large number of workers. 經濟衰退時期這家工廠解僱了許多工人。
The conference terminated yesterday. 會議於昨天結束。
The airplane terminates here. 這班班機的終點站在這裡。

other_types: 比較級：more terrible   最高級：most terrible
part_of_speech: adj.: 可怕的，嚇人的，可怖的；極度的，嚴重的
sentences: It was a terrible blow to him. 這對他是一個可怕的打擊。
I'm afraid we have made a terrible mess in your room. 恐怕我們把你的房間搞得一團糟了。
I smelt a terrible odor. 我聞到一股難聞的氣味。
She is a terrible student. 她是一個極糟的學生。

part_of_speech: adj.: 可怕的，嚇人的；【口】極度的，極大的[Z][B]
sentences: a terrific scene 一個令人毛骨悚然的景象
a terrific amount of money 一筆巨款
To me, he's been a terrific guy ever since I knew him. 對我而言，他一直是個非常好的人，自我認識他起。

part_of_speech: adj.: 理論的；非應用的；假設的，推理的
sentences: theoretical physics 理論物理
The government and central bank were in theoretical harmony. 政府與中央銀行按理論是協調一致的。

part_of_speech: n.: 學說；論說；……論[C][（+of）][+that]；理論；學理，原理[U][C]
sentences: Darwin spent more than twenty years working on his theory of evolution. 達爾文花了二十餘年時間研究他的進化論。
It seems good in theory, but it doesn't work in practice. 理論上它似乎很不錯，但實際上卻行不通。
My theory is that we'll have a cold winter this year. 依我看今年冬天會很冷。
Many scientists accept the theory that the universe is growing larger. 許多科學家接受這樣的看法：宇宙在不斷增大。

part_of_speech: adj.: 徹底的；完全的；周密的；完善的
sentences: The film was a thorough success. 這電影獲得極大的成功。
You must promise me to take a thorough rest. 你得答應我徹底休息一下。
The doctor was very thorough in his examination of the sick child. 醫生對生病的孩子進行了仔細的檢查。
He is a thorough scoundrel. 他是一個十足的無賴。
She is not brilliant, but she is thorough. 她並非才華橫溢，但很仔細。

part_of_speech: adj.: 整潔的，整齊的；井然的；【口】相當好的[B]
n.[C]: 【主美】（椅背，扶手的）罩布，套子；裝零星東西的容器
vt.: 使整潔，整理[（+up）]
vi.: 收拾，整理[（+up）]
sentences: Her room is always clean and tidy. 她的房間總是乾淨整潔。
None could produce a simple, tidy answer. 沒有人能提出一個簡單而又令人滿意的答案。
$10,000 is a tidy sum of money. 一萬美元是相當大的一筆錢。
She told me to tidy my room. 她讓我把房間收拾一下。
Be sure to tidy up before going out. 出去之前一定要收拾一下。

other_types: 過去式：tipped   過去分詞：tipped   現在分詞：tipping
part_of_speech: vt.: 輕擊；輕觸；給；遞送[O1]
vi.: 踮著腳走；給小費
n.[C]: 小費；告誡；提示[（+for/on）]
sentences: We tipped the taxi driver. 我們給計程車司機小費。
I tipped the waiter two dollars. 我給侍者兩塊錢小費。
Who tipped the scheme? 誰把計畫洩漏出去的？
We gave the taxi driver a tip. 我們付小費給計程車司機。
I gave her a tip on how to concoct a new kind of soup. 我教她配製一種新湯的訣竅。
He gave me some tips on the matter. 他把關於那件事的消息透露給我了。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 旅行，旅遊，遊覽[（+around/of）]；巡視；巡迴演出；巡迴比賽[（+of）]
vi.: 旅行，旅遊；巡視[（+around）]；作巡迴演出（或比賽）
vt.: 旅行，在……旅遊（或參觀）；帶……作巡迴演出；在……作巡迴演出
sentences: Mr. Adams made a tour around East Asia last year. 亞當斯先生去年往東亞旅行了一次。
Their troupe is on tour in the South. 他們的劇團在南方巡迴演出。
He served two tours in Europe. 他在歐洲任職過兩期。
Many Americans tour by car in summer. 許多美國人夏天開車旅遊。
I'd like to tour in companies that go round the country. 我喜歡隨流動劇團作巡迴演出。
She spent her vacation touring Italy. 她去義大利旅遊度假。
The play will tour the provinces in the fall. 這齣戲將在秋天到各地巡迴演出。

part_of_speech: n.: 旅遊，觀光；旅遊業，觀光業
sentences: Taiwan's tourism business suffered a great setback after mainland guests stopped coming. 陸客不來之後，台灣的觀光業大受影響。

part_of_speech: n.: 旅遊者，觀光者[C]；（飛機、輪船等的）旅遊艙，經濟艙[U]
adj.: 旅遊的，觀光的；旅遊艙的，經濟艙的，二等艙的
adv.: 在經濟艙；乘經濟艙
sentences: San Francisco is full of tourists in the summer. 夏天去舊金山旅遊的人很多。
the tourist industry 旅遊業

part_of_speech: n.: 毛巾，手巾；紙巾[C]
vt.: 用毛巾擦[（+down）][O8]
vi.: 用毛巾擦乾身體[（+off）]
sentences: She wrapped her hair up in a towel. 她用毛巾把頭髮包起來。
The maid towelled the child dry. 女佣用毛巾把孩子的身體拭乾。
He was toweling off lustily on the side of the pool. 他在游泳池邊使勁擦乾身體。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 塔；塔樓；高樓；堡壘；監獄
vi.: 高聳，屹立；高高升起[（+above/over）]；超過，勝過[（+above/over）]
sentences: That's a television tower. 那是電視轉播臺。
The skyscraper towers into the sky. 該摩天大樓高聳入雲。
The tall building towers above all the others. 這高樓高出其他所有的建築。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 行蹤；軌道；足跡[P1]；小徑，小道
vt.: 跟蹤；追蹤[（+to）]；沿著（道路）走
vi.: 追蹤；留下足跡
sentences: We followed his tracks in the snow to a hut. 我們沿著他在雪地上留下的足跡走到一間小屋旁。
The train jumped the track. 火車出軌了。
He runs around the track every morning. 他每天清晨繞著跑道跑步。
You're on the wrong track. 你想得不對了。
It was not long before I tracked down the lost wallet. 不久我就找到了遺失的錢包。
The hunter tracked the wolf and managed to catch it. 獵人追蹤狼，並設法逮住它。
The dog tracked mud all over the shiny kitchen. 狗在廚房發亮的地板上留下一屋子泥。
The child rushed into the room and tracked dirt over the floor. 小孩衝進房間，在地板上到處留下帶泥的腳印。

part_of_speech: n.: 貿易，交易，商業[U]；行業[the S]
vt.: 交換[（+for）]
vi.: 做買賣，進行交易[（+in/with）]；【美】做主顧[（+at/with）]
sentences: Japan does lots of trade with the United States. 日本與美國間的貿易頻繁。
He is a blacksmith by trade. 他是個鐵匠。
He got these eggs as a trade. 他交換到這些雞蛋。
That department store has a lot of trade. 那家百貨公司顧客很多。
She traded three apples for a bunch of bananas. 她用三顆蘋果換得一串香蕉。
Can I trade my tobacco for your matches? 我用菸草換你的火柴行嗎？
He trades in silk. 他經營絲綢貿易。
I used to trade at that store. 過去我常在那家商店買東西。

part_of_speech: n.: 傳統；傳統思想[U][C]；慣例，常規[C][U]
sentences: My parents did their best to keep up the family tradition. 我的父母為了保持家庭的傳統竭盡全力。
This decision represents a complete break with tradition. 這一決定完全打破了以往的慣例。
According to the old tradition, the first American flag was made by Betsy Ross. 根據傳說，第一面美國國旗是貝慈‧羅斯縫製的。

other_types: 過去式：trafficked   過去分詞：trafficked   現在分詞：trafficking
part_of_speech: n.[U]: 交通；交通行列；交通量
vt.: 在……上通行；做……生意
vi.: 交易，做非法買賣[（+in）]；來來往往
sentences: There is too much traffic on the road. 這條路上行人車輛太多了。
Police control the traffic in large cities. 在大城市裡，警察控制交通。
Traffic is very heavy during the rush hour. 尖峰時間交通十分繁忙。
Illegal traffic in protected animals is quite common there. 非法買賣受保護的動物在那裡是司空見慣的事。
Passenger traffic has gone up by 20 per cent. 客流量已增長百分之二十。
I don't want any more traffic with his sort. 我不想再和他那種人來往了。
Radio traffic has stepped up enormously. 無線電通訊已大大增加。
This is the most heavily trafficked highway in the state. 這是該州交通最繁忙的一條公路。
He made a lot of money by trafficking illicit merchandise. 他做違禁商品買賣賺了許多錢。
The men trafficked with the natives for ivory. 這些人與土著居民做買賣以換取象牙。
He has trafficked in drugs for many years. 他販賣毒品多年。

part_of_speech: n.: 訓練；鍛鍊，培養[S][U][（+in/for）]；（競賽的）身體狀況[U]
sentences: She was given some quick training at the vocational school. 她在職業學校受過速成訓練。

other_types: 過去式：transferred   過去分詞：transferred   現在分詞：transferring
part_of_speech: vt.[: 搬；轉換；調動；使換車；使轉校
vi.[: 搬遷，轉移；調任；換車，轉車
sentences: She has been transferred to another department. 她已被調往另一部門。
At the port the goods were transferred onto a ship. 貨物在港口被轉移到一艘船上。
Her father transferred her to a better school. 她父親把她轉到了一所更好的學校。
Within a few years they had transferred barren wastes into fertile fields. 幾年之內他們就把荒地變成了良田。
You transfer the embroidery design from the paper to cloth by pressing it with a warm iron. 你用熱熨斗一燙就把刺繡圖樣轉印到布上。
To preserve the farm intact, he transferred it to one heir. 為了保持這個農場的完整，他將它移交給一個繼承人。
The company has transferred to the west coast. 公司已遷往西海岸。
You can take the subway and then transfer to a bus. 你可先乘捷運然後轉乘公車。
June transferred to an American college in 1990. 瓊在1990年轉學到一所美國的大學。

other_types: 過去式：transformed   過去分詞：transformed   現在分詞：transforming
part_of_speech: vt.[: 使改變；使改觀；將……改成；改造；改革；改善
vi.: 改變；改觀；變換；轉換
sentences: The Greggs have transformed their garage into a guest house. 格雷格一家把他們的車庫改成了客房。
The situation has been greatly transformed. 形勢已經大大好轉。
A generator transforms mechanical energy into electricity. 發電機將機械能變成電。
A tadpole is transformed into a frog. 蝌蚪變成青蛙。
A tadpole transforms into a frog. 蝌蚪變成青蛙。

part_of_speech: n.[U: 變化；轉變；變形；變質；【電】變換，轉換
sentences: There was a noticeable transformation in his appearance. 他的容貌有了明顯的變化。

part_of_speech: n.: 運輸，運送[U]；通過，經過；過境；中轉[U]
vt.: 通過；運送過；（天體）經過
vi.: 通過
sentences: These goods were damaged in transit. 這些貨物在運輸過程中損壞了。
The worst part of the ocean transit was now over. 遠洋航程裡最困難的一段已經過去了。
the transit from war to peace 從戰爭到和平的轉變
They transited the goods to another vessel. 他們將貨物轉運到另一條船上。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 運輸；輸送；【美】運輸工具；交通車輛
sentences: The railroad gives free transportation for a certain amount of baggage. 鐵路免費運送一定數量的行李。
public transportation 公共交通車輛
We paid our transportation to Taipei. 我們付了去臺北的旅費。

other_types: 比較級：more tremendous   最高級：most tremendous
part_of_speech: adj.: 巨大的，極大的；【口】極度的，驚人的
sentences: They cost a tremendous amount of money. 他們花去了一大筆錢。
The play became a tremendous hit. 該劇極為叫座。
We had a tremendous time on the beach. 我們在海灘上玩得很痛快。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: （海岸、河流等的）走向；趨勢，傾向；時尚
vi.[: 伸向；折向，轉向；趨向，傾向
sentences: The mountains have a western trend. 群山向西延伸。
The current trend is towards informal clothing. 目前的趨勢是穿著比較隨便。
The road trends to the north. 這條路是向北的。
Share prices have been trending down. 股票價格一直趨向下降。

part_of_speech: n.: 試；試用；試驗[C][U]；考驗；磨煉；艱苦[C][U]
a.[Z: 試驗的；試製的；審訊的；審判的
sentences: The trials show that smoking will do harm to people. 試驗顯示抽菸對人體有害。
His blindness is a great trial to him. 眼睛瞎對他來說是非常麻煩的事。
He was brought to trial on charges of arson. 他以縱火罪被送法院審理。
They succeeded in the experiment on the fifteenth trial. 他們在第十五次嘗試時獲得了成功。
He was hired for a three month period on a trial basis. 他受僱試用三個月。

part_of_speech: n.: （大）勝利[C]；（大）成功，業績[C][（+over）]
vi.: 獲得勝利（或成功）；得意洋洋，耀武揚威
sentences: The football team achieved a complete triumph. 足球隊大獲全勝。
The conquest of outer space is one of the greatest triumphs of modern science. 征服外層空間是現代科學最傑出的成就之一。
Great was his triumph on hearing this. 聽到這事，他大喜過望。
Justice will triumph in the end. 正義終將獲勝。

part_of_speech: n.: 信任，信賴[U][（+in）]；託管，信託；管理，照顧[C][U]
vt.: 信任，信賴[O2]；依靠，依賴[O2]
vi.: 信任，信賴[（+in）]；確信
sentences: I have no trust in him. 我不信任他。
Her child was left in my trust for the winter vacation. 她的孩子寒假裡由我照顧。
The jewels will be held in trust for the girl till she is twenty. 女孩的那些首飾將被託管到她二十歲為止。
He pledged to fulfil his trust. 他保證履行義務。
Why do you trust a guy like him? 你為什麼要信任他這樣的傢伙呢？
I can't trust my memory. I'd better write everything down. 我的記性靠不住，最好把什麼都寫下來。
I trust your wife will soon get well. 我相信你太太不久就會痊癒的。
How can I trust the valuable things to her? 我怎麼能夠把貴重的東西託付給她呢？
We always trust in her cautiousness. 我們對她辦事謹慎一向是信賴的。
It won't do to trust to the inspiration of the moment when speaking to such a big audience. 對這麼多聽眾演講，事先不準備僅靠一時的靈感是不行的。

part_of_speech: n.: 翻倒，翻轉[C]；倒轉；反轉；轉移[C]
adj.: 翻轉的
sentences: This product has a fast turnover, three shipments going out per day. 這產品的成交量很高，每天可出三批貨。
The shop has a turnover of 500,000 dollars a week. 該店營業額為每週五十萬元。
That company has a fast turnover because of the poor working conditions. 那家公司因為工作環境很差，員工流動得很快。
They have a very high turnover of staff. 他們的職員更換很快。

part_of_speech: adj.: 無條件的；絕對的

other_types: 過去式：understood   過去分詞：understood   現在分詞：understanding
part_of_speech: vt.: 理解；懂；熟諳[+wh-]；認識到；了解[+wh-][+（that）]
vi.[W]: 理解；懂得；熟悉[（+about）]
sentences: Does he understand Japanese? 他懂日文嗎？
Do you understand how to operate the machine? 你懂得如何操作這部機器嗎？
I understand her to be a distant relation of his. 據我了解，她是他的一位遠親。
I understand that you will be moving here soon. 我聽說你就要搬到這兒來住了。
We understand that you don't approve of our idea. 據我們了解，你不贊成我們的想法。
They understand literature as language well used. 他們把文學解釋為用得好的語言。
In this sentence the verb is understood. 在這個句子裡，動詞省略了。
Now I understand. 現在我懂了。
He understands about diplomatic etiquette. 他熟知外交禮節。

part_of_speech: adj.: 不利的；不適宜的；不順利的[（+to/for）]；相反的；反對的
sentences: The weather is unfavorable to our plans. 天氣對我們的計畫不利。
He had formed an unfavorable opinion of my work. 他對我的工作已有了成見。
unfavorable omens 壞兆頭

part_of_speech: adv.: 不幸地；遺憾地；可惜
sentences: I was unfortunately delayed. 我不幸被耽擱了。
Unfortunately he won't be here tomorrow evening. 可惜的是他明晚不在這兒。

part_of_speech: adj.: 相同的，一致的；不變的，始終如一的
n.: 制服；軍服[C][U]
vt.: 使成一樣；使一律化；使穿制服（或軍服）
sentences: All these jackets have a uniform size. 所有這些夾克尺寸相同。
The laboratory is kept at a uniform temperature. 實驗室保持恆溫。
Tom looks handsome in uniform. 湯姆穿上制服很英俊。

part_of_speech: adj.: 未損壞的；未受破壞的；未寵壞的

other_types: 過去式：unwrapped   過去分詞：unwrapped   現在分詞：unwrapping
part_of_speech: vi. : 解開；打開；展開
adj.: 即將來臨的

other_types: 過去式：updated   過去分詞：updated   現在分詞：updating
part_of_speech: vt.: 使……合乎時代，使現代化；更新；為……提供（或補充）最新信息

other_types: 過去式：upgraded   過去分詞：upgraded   現在分詞：upgrading
part_of_speech: n.: 上坡；升級；提高品級（或標準）
adv.: 往山上，上坡
vt.: 使升級；提高；提升；以高檔貨的價格出售（低檔貨）；提高……的價格
sentences: Soon the truck came into sight around a bend and on an upgrade. 不一會卡車就出現在一個拐彎和上坡處。
These products are available with many different options and upgrades. 這些產品有許多不同的選擇和升級品。
After a short break the climbers continued upgrade. 稍事休息後，攀登者們繼續往山上走。
Efforts to upgrade the schools must come from the community. 改進學校的努力必須來自該社區。
When several offers came in the house owner upgraded the price. 當有幾個人要買這棟房子時，房主提高了房價。

other_types: 過去式：upset   過去分詞：upset   現在分詞：upsetting
part_of_speech: vt.: 弄翻，打翻；傾覆；打亂，攪亂
vi.: 翻倒；傾覆
adj.: 翻倒的；翻覆的；攪亂的，混亂的
sentences: The generals plotted to upset the government. 將軍們策劃推翻政府。
Rain upset our plans for a picnic. 下雨打亂了我們的野餐計畫。
The Democrat upset the governor in the election. 這位民主黨人在選舉中意外地擊敗了州長。
Losing the necklace borrowed from her friend upset her completely. 她把從朋友那兒借來的項鍊弄丟了，這使她心煩意亂。
The lousy food upsets my stomach. 這糟糕的飯菜使我腸胃不適。
The boat will upset if a storm breaks. 如遇暴風雨，這條船會翻掉。
an upset boat 傾覆的船
He was horribly upset over her illness. 他為她的病而憂心忡忡。
I'm suffering from an upset stomach. 我的腸胃正不舒服著呢。

part_of_speech: adv.: 在樓上；往樓上；往更高的地位（尤指明升暗降）
adj.: 樓上的，在樓上的[B]；高水平的，上層的
n.: 樓上[M]
sentences: Henry lived upstairs. 亨利住在樓上。
She ran upstairs. 她往樓上跑去。
He went upstairs to become board chairman. 他高升為委員會的主席。
The plane tried to avoid a storm by going upstairs. 飛機往高空飛去，以避開風暴。
Neighbors watched from their upstairs windows. 鄰居們從他們樓上的窗戶往外看。
He is skilled in upstairs politics. 他精通上層政治。
They had to rent out the upstairs to make mortgage payments. 他們不得不將二樓租出去以償付抵押借款。
The house has no upstairs. 這房子只有一層。

part_of_speech: ph.: 公用事業賬單；公用事業費用
n.: 空；空白；空間[U]；空處；空地；空房[C]
sentences: the stark vacancy of the arctic landscape 北極景色的極端空白
There is a vacancy on the tenth floor. 第十層樓上有一個空房間。
We have a vacancy for a computer programmer. 我們有一個電腦程式設計師缺額。
The vacancy of the boy's expression made his father doubt if he was listening. 兒子毫無表情使父親懷疑他是否在專心聽。

part_of_speech: adj.: 空的；空白的；空著的，未被佔用的
sentences: By the end of the game, the stadium was almost vacant. 到比賽結束的時候，體育館幾乎空了。
A vacant apartment in New York City is very difficult to find. 在紐約市內很難找到空著無人住的公寓。
That position remains vacant. 那個職位仍舊空著。
That will leave plenty of hours vacant. 那樣的話就有許多空閒時間了。
She has a vacant look. 她臉上沒有表情。

part_of_speech: n.[C,U]: 休假；假期；休庭期；休假日；（房屋等的）騰出，搬出
vi.: 度假
sentences: School is closed for the summer and children are on vacation. 學校夏天關閉，孩子們放假。
They will vacation in Hawaii during Christmas. 他們耶誕節期間將到夏威夷度假。
He is vacationing in Switzerland. 他正在瑞士度假。

part_of_speech: n.[C: 疫苗接種；種痘[（+against）]；牛痘疤
sentences: vaccination against smallpox 牛痘疫苗的接種

part_of_speech: adj.: 各種各樣的；不相同的；變化了的；多變的
sentences: Many varied motives prompt individuals to join a political party. 促使人們加入政黨的動機許許多多且各不相同。
He led a varied life. 他過著豐富多彩的生活。

part_of_speech: n.: 多樣化，變化[U]；種種[S][（+of）]
sentences: What other ways do you know to add variety? 你知道其他增加變化的方法嗎？
People like to live a life full of variety. 人們喜歡過豐富多彩的生活。
He has a variety of interests. 他有多種愛好。
Hospitals deal with diseases of every variety. 醫院診治各種各樣的疾病。

part_of_speech: adj.: 不同的；各種各樣的，形形色色的；好幾個的；許多的[Z]
sentences: Everyone arrived late at the party for various reasons. 由於種種原因，每個人赴會都遲到了。
Wheat is grown in various parts of the country. 全國許多地方都種小麥。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 小販；叫賣者；【律】賣主
sentences: Vendors are busy attracting the attention of children. 小販們正忙於吸引孩子們的注意力。
Vendors are not allowed on this train. 這輛火車上不容許有叫賣者。
The list contains names of the vendors we do business with. 這個名單上有與我們有業務往來的賣主的名字。
Who is the vendor? 誰是賣主？
The vendor is out of order again. 這臺自動售貨機又壞了。
Are there any vendors in this building? 這棟樓裡有自動售貨機嗎？

other_types: 過去式：ventured   過去分詞：ventured   現在分詞：venturing
part_of_speech: n.[C]: 冒險；冒險事業，投機活動；投機活動；企業
vt.: 使冒險；冒……之險；拿……冒險；以……作賭注[（+on）]
vi.: 冒險；大膽行事[（+on）]
sentences: They were the astronauts on the first venture to the moon. 他們是首次登陸月球探險的太空人。
He has started a joint venture in Singapore. 他已在新加坡辦起一家合資公司。
They ventured their lives in exploring the desert. 他們冒了生命危險去沙漠探險。
He ventured large sums of money on speculative stocks. 他將大筆的錢拿去做股票投機。
I venture that you are wrong. 我冒昧說一句，你錯了。
No one ventured to speak to him. 無人敢跟他講話。
He is too timid to venture upon a new undertaking. 他太膽小，不敢從事新的事業。
The children ventured out on the thin ice and fell through. 孩子們冒險踏上薄冰，結果掉了進去。

part_of_speech: n.: 【律】犯罪地點；審判地；（事件、行動等的）發生地；集合地
n.[C]: 病毒；濾過性病毒；病毒感染

other_types: 比較級：more vital   最高級：most vital
part_of_speech: adj.: 生命的；維持生命所必需的[Z][B]；充滿活力的，生氣勃勃的
n.[t: （人體的）重要器官；重要部分，要害
sentences: Growth and decay are vital processes. 生長和衰亡是生命過程。
The Chinese I knew were trusting, open, and vital. 我所認識的中國人信賴別人，坦率，充滿活力。
The questions put forward at the meeting are of vital importance. 會上提出的那些問題極其重要。
He committed a vital error. 他犯了一個致命的錯誤。
He was lucky that the bullet missed the vitals. 他很幸運，子彈沒有擊中要害器官。

other_types: 過去式：waged   過去分詞：waged   現在分詞：waging
part_of_speech: vt.: 進行，從事[（+on/against）]
vi.: 在開展中，在進行中
sentences: England and Spain waged war for many years. 英國和西班牙曾打過多年的戰爭。

part_of_speech: n.: 【主美】走道；通道
n.[C]: 倉庫，貨棧；【英】批發店；大型零售店
vt.: 把……存入倉庫，使落棧
sentences: The boxes are stacked in a warehouse. 這些箱子被堆放在一個倉庫裡。

other_types: 過去式：warned   過去分詞：warned   現在分詞：warning
part_of_speech: vt.: 警告；告誡；提醒[（+of/against）][O2][O5]；預先通知[（+of）][O5]
vi.: 發出警告；發出預告
sentences: He warned me against going outside alone at night. 他提醒我晚上不要單獨出去。
The police warned us not to go out at night. 警察告誡我們夜間不要出門。
The weather station warned that a hurricane was coming. 氣象臺預報颶風即將來臨。

part_of_speech: n.: 警告；告誡；警報[U][C][（+of）][+to-v]；可引以為戒的事（或人）[C]
adj.: 警告的；告誡的；引以為戒的；warn的動詞現在分詞、動名詞
sentences: The son was so captivated with the woman that he didn't heed his parents' warnings. 兒子為這個女人神魂顛倒，全然不顧他父母的告誡。
The red light is a warning sign for stop. 紅燈是警告停止行進的信號。
Let this be a warning to you. 希望這件事能成為你的鑑戒。
The wall caved in without the slightest warning. 事先大家毫無察覺的情況下牆塌了。
The policeman fired a warning shot. 那警察鳴槍警告。

part_of_speech: n.: 授權；批准[U]；【律】授權令；逮捕狀；搜查令[C]
vt.: 授權給；批准；使有（正當）理由，成為……的根據[+v-ing]
sentences: He had no warrant for his action. 他無權那麼做。
The police must obtain a warrant from a judge in order to search a house. 警察必須從法官處取得搜查令才可搜查房子。
He had no warrant for his suspicion. 他沒有理由那麼懷疑。
Have you got a warrant of fitness for your car? 你有沒有一張汽車合格證書？
The storekeeper warranted the goods as of the first quality. 店主保證貨物品質第一。

part_of_speech: n.: 保證書；保單；擔保
n.: 浪費；消耗量
adj.: 不透水的，防水的
n.: 防水材料；防水布[U]；【主英】雨衣[C]
vt.: 使不透水，使防水；把……上膠
sentences: These shoes are waterproof. 這些鞋是防水的。
Put on your waterproofs. It's going to rain. 穿上你的雨衣。天要下雨了。
The company will come up with a new technique for waterproofing walls. 該公司將推出防止牆壁滲水的新技術。

part_of_speech: n.: 財富；財產；資源；富有[U]；豐富，大量[S][（+of）]
sentences: It was a period of wealth and prosperity. 那是一個富有和繁榮的時期。
The dictionary gives us a wealth of phrases and sentences to illustrate meaning. 這本詞典給了我們許多說明字義的片語和句子。

part_of_speech: n.: 【電腦】網站（全球資訊網的主機站）
n.: 重，重量；體重[C][U]；砝碼[C]
vt.: 加重量於，使變重；加重壓於，壓迫
sentences: What is your weight? 你體重多少？
That's quite a weight off my mind. 那真叫我如釋重負。
Our boss's opinions seem to carry very little weight at home. 我們老板的意見在家裡似乎沒有什麼權威。
Matters of great weight are handled by the general manager himself. 重大問題由總經理親自處理。
She was weighted down with cares. 她心事重重。

part_of_speech: n.[U]: 福利；幸福；健康安樂；救濟事業；福利事業
a.[Z: 福利的；福利事業的；接受社會救濟的
sentences: She works hard for the welfare of the poor. 她為了窮人的福利而辛勤工作。
They are living on welfare now. 他們現在靠社會救濟生活。
People are concerned about the cutbacks in federal welfare programs. 人們關注著聯邦福利計畫的削減。

other_types: 過去式：wholesaled   過去分詞：wholesaled   現在分詞：wholesaling
part_of_speech: n.: 批發，躉售[U]
adj.: 批發的；成批售出的；大批的；大規模的；不加區別的；全部的
adv.: 以批發方式；大批地；大規模地；不加區別地；全部地
vt.: 批發（貨物）
vi.: 成批售出；經營批發業
sentences: Retailers buy at wholesale. 零售商整批買進。
Their business is wholesale only. 他們只做批發生意。
Wholesale slaughter was carried out in the name of progress. 大規模的屠殺在維護進步的名義下進行。
Ed sent out Christmas cards wholesale. 艾德大量寄送耶誕卡。
They wholesale the T-shirts at $5 each. 他們以每件五美元的價格批發出售這些T恤衫。
Such shoes usually wholesale for much less. 這種鞋批發出售通常要便宜得多。

other_types: 過去式：won   過去分詞：won   現在分詞：winning
part_of_speech: vt.: 在……中獲勝（或成功）；贏得，獲得，奪得[O1]
vi.: 獲勝，成功
n.: 獲勝，成功，贏[C]；贏得物[P1]
sentences: Their team has won the game. 他們隊贏了這場比賽。
His modesty won him praises. 他的謙虛為他贏得了讚揚。
His deeds won our respect. 他的行為贏得我們的尊敬。
We'll try to win him around. 我們會設法把他爭取過來。
I won purely by chance. 我完全是僥倖贏的。
Our team has had seven wins, two losses and one draw. 本隊七勝二負一平。

other_types: 過去式：withdrew   過去分詞：withdrawn   現在分詞：withdrawing
part_of_speech: vt.: 抽回；拉開；移開；收回；取回；提取[（+from/out of）]
vi.: 撤退；離開；退出[（+from）]
sentences: She withdrew her eyes from his smashed right hand. 她移開視線不去看他那隻打爛的右手。
The government withdraws worn out money from use. 政府收回舊幣使之不再流通。
The motion was withdrawn. 那項動議被撤銷了。
The troops are being gradually withdrawn. 部隊正被漸漸撤回。
He has decided to withdraw from the competition. 他已決定退出競賽。

part_of_speech: n.[U: 收回；撤回；撤清；撤退；退縮；退隱
sentences: They are trying to negotiate the withdrawal of 20,000 troops. 他們正打算協商有關兩萬人的部隊的撤軍問題。
It is not the bank's policy to deduct interest on withdrawals. 提款需扣除利息這並非是本銀行的政策。

part_of_speech: n.: 工作場所
n.[C]: 工場；作坊；小工廠；專題討論會，研討會
n.[U]: 價值；值一定金額的數量
sentences: This necklace is worth 1,000 US dollars. 這條項鍊值一千美元。
That novel is not worth reading. 那部小說不值得一讀。
The exhibition is worth a visit. 這展覽值得一看。
This research project is of great worth. 這一研究項目很有價值。
He keeps in the safe $3 million worth of diamonds. 他在保險箱裡放著值三百萬元的鑽石。

part_of_speech: adj.: 無價值的；無用的；不重要的[Z]
sentences: a worthless fool 沒用的笨蛋
This made the treaty worthless. 這使得條約變得毫無用處。

other_types: 動詞變化：wrapped /  wrapt / wrapped /  wrapt / wrapping
part_of_speech: vt.: 包，裹[（+up/in）]；纏繞，披[O][（+around/about）]
vi.: 纏繞；盤繞；重疊；穿外衣；披圍巾[（+up）]
n.[C]: 包裹物，覆蓋物；外衣；圍巾；披肩[P1]
sentences: I wrapped the book in brown paper before I mailed it. 我先把書用牛皮紙包好，然後郵寄。
She wrapped a scarf around her neck. 她把一條圍巾圍在脖子上。
The skyscraper was wrapped in fog. 摩天樓為霧所籠罩。
He is wrapped up in his work. 他專心致志地工作。
A snake wrapped around the pillar. 一條蛇盤繞在柱子上。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: X射線，X光[P1]；X光照片
adj.: X光線的
vt.: 用X光線檢查
adj.: 每年的，一年一次的；一年間的；按年的
adv.: 每年；一年一度
n.: 年刊；年鑑[C]
sentences: I make a yearly trip to the mountains. 我每年進一次山。
Rainfall this year exceeded the yearly average. 今年的雨量超過了年平均降雨量。
Interest is paid yearly. 利息一年支付一次。

other_types: 過去式：yielded   過去分詞：yielded   現在分詞：yielding
part_of_speech: vt.: 出產；結出（果實）；產生（效果，收益等）；讓於，結於；同意；禮讓
vi.: 出產[Q]；服從；屈服；投降[（+to）]
n.: 產量；收穫量；收益，利潤[C][U]
sentences: These apple trees yield plenty of fruit this year. 這些蘋果樹今年結了許多蘋果。
Because he is such a pompous asshole, I refuse to yield to him. 因為他是個驕慢的混蛋，我拒絕禮讓他。
He was forced to yield the castle. 他被迫放棄城堡。
He didn't yield himself to his rival. 他沒有向對手屈服。
These fruit trees yielded poorly last year. 去年這些果樹產量很低。
We will never yield to invaders. 我們絕不會向侵略者屈服。
The current yield on municipal bonds is 10%. 當前市政債券的利潤是百分之十。

part_of_speech: n.: 青春時代，青少年時期[U]；（男）青年，小伙子[C]
sentences: I spent my youth in the country. 我在鄉間度過了青少年時代。
There are groups of youths playing basketball over there. 那裡，一群群小伙子正在打籃球。
My youth has gone. 我的青春已不復存在。
Cryonics is still in its youth. 人體冷凍學還處於初始階段。

part_of_speech: n.: 零；零號[C]；（刻度表上的）零點，零位；（氣溫的）零度[U]
adj.: 零的；沒有的，全無的
vt.: 把……調整歸零；對……作歸零校正；把……減少到零
sentences: There are two zeros in 1008. 在1008中有兩個零。
At zero water is frozen solid. 零度時水凍結為固體。
Measures have been taken to reduce the incidence of the disease to zero. 業已採取措施把發病率降到最低程度。
I have given it zero thought. 我一點也沒考慮過這件事。
He has given my suggestion zero thought. 他一點也沒有考慮過我的建議。

part_of_speech: n.[C]: 地帶；地區；帶；氣候帶；動植物分布帶
vt.: 使分成區（或帶）[H][（+as/for）]；（為特定目的）劃出……為區[H][（+as/for）]
vi.: 分成區；分成帶
sentences: I'd like to see Europe as a nuclear-free zone. 我希望歐洲成為無核區。
Most of the world's wheat is grown in the North Temperate zone. 世界上大部分小麥種植在北溫帶。
The U.S. and Canada are zoned for postal delivery. 美國和加拿大劃分了郵區。
The downtown area is zoned for commercial use. 市中心被劃出供商業用。
